Sophia wanted to enter the entertainment world?

When had she become so ruthlessly ambitious?

Meeting a director in secret?

At an exclusive members-only club, no less?

What exactly were they discussing?

His frown deepened with each thought.

He knew how striking Sophia's beauty was. Talent agencies would be lining up to sign her.

But had she considered the perils awaiting an unconnected newcomer in that cutthroat arena?

Isabella Evans observed Ethan's darkening expression, her lips curling imperceptibly.

If Sophia was willing to degrade herself for fame, she wasn't even worth the effort of eliminating.

Such opponents didn't deserve her attention.

"Ethan, we should go in. Your parents have been waiting..."

He snapped back to reality with a terse nod.

Arm in arm, they proceeded toward the private dining room.

But Ethan's steps were noticeably heavier than before.

Meanwhile, Sophia stood before the reserved suite, rapping lightly on the door.

Inside, Director Lucas Sheridan paused his discussion with an assistant.

The aide hurried to answer.

At 38, the acclaimed director of "We Are Singers" was renowned for his discerning eye.

When he saw the young woman at the threshold, his words died in his throat.

She wore a simple white tee and jeans, her hair in a high ponytail.

Porcelain skin.

And those eyes—luminous pools reflecting starlight.

"Young lady, are you... lost?"

A knowing smile touched her lips. "Director Sheridan, I'm exactly who you're expecting."

Her research had been thorough. She recognized him instantly.

His eyes widened. "You're... Composer T?"

"Just a pseudonym."

She extended her hand gracefully. "Sophia Laurent."

Lucas was rendered speechless.

Five years ago, a mysterious composer known only as "T" had emerged.

Initially overlooked, every artist who performed T's compositions skyrocketed to fame.

Especially Adrian Valentine, whose career was launched overnight by a single T-penned hit.

Soon, "T" became the industry's golden standard.

From legends to rising stars, everyone coveted T's songs.

The uncanny part? Every composition became a chart-topping phenomenon.

Thus, the industry bestowed the reverent title: Composer T.

Yet T's identity remained an enigma.

Some speculated a retired music maestro. Others imagined an elderly virtuoso.

Never in Lucas' wildest dreams had he imagined Composer T would be a woman in her early twenties.
###Chapter 33

Director Lucas Sheridan's coffee cup clattered to the floor.

Dark stains splashed across his polished leather shoes. He didn't even notice.

"You...you're Composer T?"

His voice trembled slightly from shock.

Sophia Laurent stood at the conference room doorway. Sunlight streamed in behind her, casting a golden halo around her silhouette.

"The one and only."

She casually waved her phone. The screen displayed the famous musician's account.

The director's assistant scrambled to clean up the broken porcelain.

"Please, have a seat!"

Lucas practically tripped over himself to pull out a chair for her.

His eyes sparkled like he'd discovered a new continent.

Who would have thought the musical genius shaking the industry was this stunning young woman?

Sophia sat gracefully. Her black trench coat draped elegantly over the chairback.

"Did you bring the contract?"

She cut straight to business.

Lucas hastily retrieved a stack of documents from his briefcase.

"This is the invitation for 'We Are Singers.' Third episode judge..."

His fingers tapped nervously on the papers.

Sophia took the contract and skimmed through the terms.

The conference room fell silent except for the rustling of pages.

"Pen."

She extended her hand.

Lucas blinked. "You're signing now?"

"Is there a problem?"

She arched an eyebrow.

The director scrambled to produce a fountain pen.

As the pen scratched across paper, Lucas's excitement grew.

"Miss Laurent, have you considered entering the entertainment industry?"

He ventured cautiously. "With your talents..."

"Not interested."

Sophia snapped the contract shut.

She slid the documents back and straightened her collar.

"Music is just a hobby."

The words froze Lucas's expression mid-smile.

The conference door burst open.

"Director, the next segment—"

The staff member's voice died abruptly.

All eyes locked onto Sophia.

Lucas jolted to his feet.

"Let me walk you out."

From conference room to elevator, the director chattered nonstop.

"We'll arrange a private dressing room..."

"Any special requests for promotion..."

Sophia pressed the elevator button with a slight nod.

"Standard procedure is fine."

The closing doors cut off Lucas's eager gaze.

Dim lights flickered in the underground parking garage.

Her heels clicked sharply against concrete.

Keys jingled in her hand when a cold laugh echoed behind her.

"Moving up in the world?"

The voice made her fingers freeze mid-air.
###Chapter 34

Sophia turned to find Ethan's brooding expression staring back at her.

Her brow furrowed slightly. "Since when did you develop a habit of eavesdropping, Mr. Winston?"

His dark eyes gleamed dangerously. "Meeting with Lucas Sheridan—are you trying to break into the entertainment industry?"

"None of your business." Her voice was glacial.

She reached for the car door handle.

A powerful grip suddenly clamped around her wrist.

"We need to talk."

Ethan refused to release his hold.

The moment their skin made contact, Sophia recoiled as if burned.

"Let go!"

His grip loosened in shock at her violent reaction.

"Was that really necessary?" His brows knitted together.

"I'll call the police if you don't release me." Her words dripped with ice.

Ethan reluctantly dropped her wrist, disbelief written across his face.

"Sophia, how much longer will you keep this up?"

The bustling parking lot forced him to exercise restraint.

Rubbing her reddened wrist, Sophia's eyes turned arctic.

"You think this is me throwing a tantrum?"

A bitter laugh escaped her.

So in their eyes, her resolve was merely childish rebellion.

Ethan froze.

Those once-tender eyes now regarded him with complete detachment.

For three years, her gaze had always shone with warmth when looking at him.

Now it held the indifference of a stranger.

An inexplicable tightness gripped his chest.

"After three years together, you should know how I feel."

Sophia's nose stung.

Three years of memories couldn't be erased so easily.

"What exactly do you want to say?"

"We can go back to how things were." Ethan's voice softened.

Sophia arched an eyebrow.

"The arranged marriage with Isabella was a family obligation," he murmured.

"And?"

"In private, nothing changes. I'll treat you well."

Sophia's pupils contracted violently.

He wanted her to be his secret mistress?

A chill crawled up her spine.

The familiar face before her suddenly became unrecognizable.
###Chapter 35

Sophia Laurent stared at the face that once haunted her dreams. Now it felt terrifyingly unfamiliar.

Without hesitation, she raised her hand. The sharp sound of a slap echoed through the empty parking lot.

"Ethan Winston, your audacity knows no bounds."

Her lips curled into a cold smile. "Did you really think I'd wait for you forever?"

Ethan's cheek burned. He stood frozen, unable to believe Sophia had struck him.

"Three years together, and you just walk away?" His voice tightened. "I can give you everything except marriage."

He tried reasoning with her. "With me, you'll never have to beg for opportunities. Winston Group's resources are yours for the taking."

Only then did Sophia understand his confidence.

He thought she'd come to meet the director for a role.

"Save it." Her gaze turned icy. "We're over."

Ethan frowned.

"That night was a mistake, but throwing wine in my face..."

No woman had ever treated him this way.

And Sophia had ignored him for days.

She cut him off sharply. "Ethan, are you deaf?"

Suddenly remembering, she raised her right hand.

The diamond ring on her finger glittered under the lights.

"Forgot to mention. I'm married now. Let's pretend we're strangers."

This ring was part of the set Patriarch Valdemar had given her.

She'd forgotten to remove it after trying it on.

Ethan looked thunderstruck. "Married? Impossible!"

Everyone knew Sophia belonged to him.

"Sophia, don't joke about this..."

Seeing his shock gave her a twisted satisfaction.

"Dead serious." She yanked open the car door. "My husband dislikes me mingling with exes."

The red sports car roared to life and sped away.

Ethan stood motionless until his phone rang.

How could Sophia be married?

He took a deep breath and answered.

"Isabella, I'm coming home now."
###Chapter 36

The moment the trailer for Episode 3 of "We Are Singers" dropped, Twitter exploded.

The show's official account was flooded with over a hundred thousand comments in seconds.

"Holy shit! Composer T is finally showing his face?"
"What kind of connections does this production team have to get someone as elusive as Composer T?"
"Pinch me, girls. Am I dreaming?"

Lucas Sheridan, the show's director, grinned ear to ear as he monitored the skyrocketing viewership numbers. The servers nearly crashed from the overwhelming traffic.

His phone buzzed nonstop with calls from industry peers.

"Lucas, what did you offer Composer T to get him on board?"
"Director Sheridan, can you save a spot for our artist next season?"

Lucas remained silent, amused. Who would've thought a single phone call was all it took to secure the music industry's most enigmatic figure?

Inside a recording studio, Adrian Valentine ripped off his headphones.

"Contact the 'We Are Singers' team. Now."

His manager blinked in confusion. "But you always said reality shows were beneath you."

Adrian's fingers trembled slightly. "Composer T is judging this season."

The manager's coffee cup slipped from his hand and shattered on the floor.

Three years ago, Composer T's hit "Starlight" had catapulted Adrian from a bar singer to a superstar. He'd sent dozens of private messages since—all left on read.

"Is it too late to sign up?" Adrian grabbed his phone. "I'll call Director Sheridan myself."

His manager intercepted him. "Are you insane? Your album launch is next week!"

"Postpone it." Adrian's tone left no room for argument. "Nothing matters more than meeting Composer T."

Meanwhile, in a luxury penthouse...

Sophia Laurent muted her frenetically buzzing phone. On the coffee table lay the judge's contract from the show, signed with a single elegant "T."

She swirled her wineglass, watching amber liquid catch the light. Beyond the windows, neon lights pulsed—an entire city holding its breath for the musical spectacle to come.
###Chapter 37

Adrian Valentine shoved his phone screen right in front of his agent's face. His fingertips trembled with excitement.

"Look! Composer T is going to be a judge!"

The agent took the phone and raised an eyebrow.

"Voice of Asia? Composer T actually agreed to a variety show?"

Everyone in the industry knew this mysterious musician always turned down all invitations.

Adrian spun around in excitement.

"Who cares why he agreed! I'm signing up!"

The agent shook his head helplessly.

"If your fans saw you like this, your aloof heartthrob image would be ruined."

Adrian shrugged nonchalantly.

"No need for personas when meeting your idol."

The agent sighed and picked up the landline.

"Fine, I'll contact the production team. But—"

He paused suddenly, his expression turning serious.

"Nathan Lowell is also competing."

Adrian's lips curled into a cold smile.

"Perfect. Let him witness real talent."

Their rivalry had begun during last year's Golden Melody Awards.

Nathan's fans still trash-talked Adrian online.

The agent hesitated.

"Are you sure you want to share the stage with him?"

Adrian's eyes burned with determination.

"I'd walk through fire just to meet Composer T."

Meanwhile.

Nathan Lowell stared at his phone screen, his knuckles turning white.

"Composer T agreed to this trashy show?"

He'd sent three song requests that all went unanswered.

Emily Lowell peeked out from her livestream.

"Brother, what's wrong?"

The live comments exploded instantly.

Emily's so gorgeous! Sibling goals!

A wealthy heiress working this hard? We stan!

Nathan forced a smile.

"Nothing. Keep streaming."

He pocketed his phone, shadows flickering in his eyes.

This time, he'd make Composer T recognize who the real musical genius was.
###Chapter 38

Emily Lowell wore an off-white lace dress today. Her wavy long hair cascaded over her shoulders. She sat by the floor-to-ceiling window of the recording studio. Sunlight streamed through the glass, illuminating her delicate profile.

Her live stream viewers had surpassed one million.

"Who says I don't have troubles?" She gave the camera a faint smile. Her fingers absentmindedly played with the lace trim of her dress.

The live comments exploded instantly.

"What troubles could a goddess possibly have?"

"Maybe she's troubled about which Hermès bag to carry today?"

Emily's eyes darkened slightly at these teasing remarks.

"Actually..." She bit her lower lip. "My mother hasn't been in good spirits lately."

Fans immediately grew concerned.

"Who dared upset Mrs. Lowell?"

"Tell us Emily! We'll stand up for you!"

Emily shook her head, her eyes glistening. "It's family matters... concerning my sister."

The live stream fell silent for several seconds.

"Sister? Aren't you the only daughter of the Lowell family?"

Emily sighed softly. "I have a long-lost sister who was only found last year. But she..."

Her hesitant tone piqued the fans' curiosity.

"Did she bully you?"

"I know all about rich family drama! She must be jealous of Emily!"

Emily quickly waved her hands. "No, it's not like that. My sister just..." Her voice caught mid-sentence.

The comments flooded with sympathetic messages.

"Don't cry Emily!"

"What did that sister do?"

Emily wiped the corner of her eye, forcing a smile. "It's nothing serious really. My sister just refuses to come home often. Mother waits forever just to see her..."

She lowered her head, fiddling with her dress hem. Her voice grew quieter. "Last week was Mother's birthday. My sister didn't even call..."

The live chat erupted.

"That's too much!"

"Raised outside the family - no manners at all!"

Emily hurried to explain. "No, my sister probably just..."

"You're too kind-hearted Emily!"

"Who needs such an ungrateful sister!"

Emily waved her hands anxiously. "Please don't say that. My sister actually..."

Before she could finish, a flood of new viewers entered the stream.

The comment tone shifted abruptly.

"Heard this stream is discussing the eldest Lowell daughter?"

"I know that sister - she's amazing!"

Emily's expression faltered briefly before she regained her composure. "Seems we have some friends who know my sister here."

She flashed the camera a sweet smile. "That's all for today. See you next time~"

The broadcast ended abruptly.

Fans exchanged bewildered looks.

What... just happened?
###Chapter 39

"Let's get one thing straight first—this is just casual conversation." Emily Lowell raised a finger to the camera, her eyes pleading. "Please don't disturb my sister."

The live comments exploded instantly.
Don't worry Emily, we promise not to bother her.
We just feel bad for you and want to know what happened.

Emily sighed softly, her eyes turning red.
"My sister sued our mother to reclaim the money spent over the past two years..."

She bit her lower lip, voice trembling.
"The money isn't the issue. But her actions humiliated Mom in social circles. These days Mom can't even eat properly. It breaks my heart..."

The stream went wild.
OMG! Suing her own mother?
What kind of monster does that?
Even a dog would show more gratitude!
Girls, I found her social media—let's go teach her a lesson!

Emily lowered her head to hide a smirk, then looked up with feigned panic.
"Stop! You promised me!"

She stomped her foot anxiously, tears welling up.
"I shouldn't have said anything..."

The door suddenly swung open.
Nathan Lowell entered carrying a fruit platter, frowning at his sister's distress.

"Emily, what's wrong?"

She clung to his sleeve like a lifeline.
"Fourth Brother, I messed up..."

Nathan ruffled her hair affectionately.
"Big brother's here. Nothing can hurt you."

The comments section erupted.
Aww Nathan's so protective!
Why can't I have a brother like this?

Emily sniffled pitifully, pointing at her phone.
"I shouldn't have said anything..."

Nathan took the phone, scanning the rapid-fire comments.
"What happened?"

Fans rushed to explain.
Not Emily's fault!
That ungrateful witch deserves to be exposed!

Nathan's expression darkened as he scrolled.
"Someone explain properly."

One comment stood out:
Your biological sister sued Mrs. Lowell!
###Chapter 40

Nathan Lowell's knuckles turned white as he gripped his phone.

"What the hell is Sophia Laurent up to now?"

Emily Lowell bit her lower lip, her eyes slightly reddened.

"Brother...Mom told me not to say anything...It's my fault for losing control during the live stream..."

"How is this your fault?"

Nathan's expression darkened dangerously.

"Explain. Now."

Emily twisted her fingers nervously, her voice trembling.

"Sophia filed a lawsuit against Mom...The legal notice arrived today."

Nathan shot up from his seat.

"Is she insane? On what grounds?"

He couldn't comprehend how Sophia dared to sue their own mother.

Emily's gaze flickered toward the live stream camera as she spoke softly.

"Remember when Mom forgot her card while shopping...She happened to run into Sophia..."

"Sophia lent her a card...Now she's accusing Mom of unauthorized use."

Emily knew exactly how much Victoria had spent.

Sophia's meager salary couldn't even cover one of Emily's designer bags.

Was this petty sum worth a courtroom battle?

What an embarrassing spectacle.

Just wait until the Valdemars hear about this...

A triumphant glint flashed in Emily's eyes.

Blood relation meant nothing.

Sophia would always remain in her shadow.

Bang!

Nathan slammed his fist on the table.

"Is she out of her mind?"

His entire body shook with rage.

"She's caused nothing but trouble since returning! Now she dares to sue Mom?"

The live stream comments exploded.

What an ungrateful daughter!

Shouldn't children support their parents?

This is clearly intentional humiliation!

How could the Lowells raise such disgrace?

We found her! Her name's Sophia Laurent!

Netizens worked quickly.

Sophia's social media accounts were thoroughly exposed.

So she's the long-lost Lowell daughter...
###Chapter 41

Sophia Laurent was taken back to the Lowell family at thirteen. They raised her for ten whole years. Now that she's grown wings, she dares to bite the hand that fed her?

Emily Lowell's fan group exploded with outrage.

"We found out! Sophia Laurent is the chief secretary at Lowell Entertainment!"

"Pathetic. Getting a job at her own family's company? That's pure nepotism."

"If the Lowells hadn't taken her in, she'd still be picking through trash in the slums!"

On the live stream, Emily and Nathan Lowell were sharing intimate moments. Their subtle expressions of distress instantly ignited the fans' fury.

The angry mob stormed Sophia's social media accounts.

"Sophia! Have you no conscience?"

"Buying things for your mother is basic decency. How dare you sue her?"

"Ungrateful wretch! They should've smothered you at birth!"

Sophia was currently handling transition work at Pearl Group, completely unaware of the online storm.

"Fire Sophia! She doesn't deserve to work there!"

"Nepotistic trash. How is she qualified to be chief secretary?"

"Partners will cancel contracts if they know you employ such people!"

The flood of hate comments nearly crashed the company's social media page.

Soon, Lowell Entertainment issued an official statement:

"Sophia Laurent has left Lowell Entertainment and is currently employed by Pearl Group. Please refrain from further commentary."

This announcement only fueled the fans' frenzy.

"See! Even her own family doesn't want her anymore!"

"She must have done something shady!"

"Let's take this to Pearl Group's page!"

The digital mob immediately redirected their attack.

Pearl Group CEO's Office.

Oliver Granger watched the hate-filled screen with a cold smirk.

His fingers flew across the keyboard as he personally typed the response:

"Sophia Laurent is Pearl Group's employee. We're keeping her. Don't like it? Call the police."

The unexpected clapback left everyone speechless.

"Is Pearl Group insane?"

"Birds of a feather flock together!"

"Did their PR team get hacked?"

Neutral observers found the exchange highly entertaining.

"First time seeing a company with actual backbone!"

"That reply was savage!"

"Gen Z really out here revolutionizing corporate culture!"
###Chapter 42

Pearl Group's official statement ignited the fury of online trolls like a spark.

The comment section quickly escalated from passive-aggressive remarks to vicious curses.

Half of the top ten trending topics were dominated by this scandal.

The situation spiraled out of control like an avalanche.

Oliver Granger stared at the malicious photoshopped images on his screen, his knuckles turning white.

Pearl Group's official account issued another statement: "Zero tolerance for cyberbullying. Our legal department has gathered evidence and will prosecute all individuals involved in personal attacks."

This strong stance sobered up many bystanders.

But Emily Lowell and Nathan Lowell's die-hard fans only intensified their attacks.

Sophia Laurent headed straight to Pearl Tower after signing the "We Are Singers" contract.

As she entered the office area, she heard the sound of documents being slammed in the CEO's office.

She pushed the door open to find Oliver Granger glaring at his computer screen.

"Planning to smash your keyboard, Oliver?"

His tense expression softened slightly when he saw Sophia. "Perfect timing."

With a cold smirk, he pulled up the trending page. "Look what your dear sister has done. The entire internet is vilifying you."

Sophia skimmed the sensational headlines indifferently:

#Disowned Heiress Sophia Laurent Sues Biological Mother
#Lowell Family's True Daughter Proves Ungrateful
#Pearl Group Shields Controversial Celebrity

The pinned video showed Emily Lowell tearfully saying in a livestream: "It's all my fault for speaking carelessly... My sister is actually very kind..."

Oliver slammed the desk. "Who does this green tea bitch think she's fooling?"

Sophia scoffed. "Just a ridiculous clown performing."

"They're trying to pressure you into dropping the lawsuit with public opinion," Oliver realized. "The Lowells want to renege?"

"More than that." Sophia toyed with her phone. "They aim to destroy my comeback."

Oliver's eyes turned icy. "In their dreams."

"Don't worry." Sophia stood up. "I'll make them reap what they sow."

Oliver exhaled in relief. "I'm glad you're okay."

What terrified him most was how those vile words might wound her.
###Chapter 43

Oliver Granger relaxed slightly when he saw Sophia Laurent's composed expression.

"Those spreading malicious rumors must face consequences."

"I'll leave it to you then, Mr. Granger."

Sophia walked out of the CEO's office, her heels clicking sharply against the marble floor.

She unlocked her phone to find social media notifications flooding in.

Sophia Laurent: Unauthorized expenditures will be reclaimed.

"How dare you begrudge your own mother money? Ungrateful wretch!"

Sophia Laurent: From age 13 to 18 - five years totaling $170,000. Including Emily Lowell's hand-me-downs.

"Emily's single dress costs over $100,000. These numbers don't add up."

"Post your university expenses if you're so bold."

Cold fury flashed in Sophia's eyes.

Sophia Laurent: Not one cent from the Lowells after turning 18.

The comments section went briefly silent before exploding with renewed vitriol.

"Who paid your tuition then? Liar!"

Sophia played her trump card.

Sophia Laurent: @LowellFamily Care to dispute this?

The attached itemized bills sent shockwaves across social media.

"She even accounted for meal expenses? Brutal."

"Masterstroke. Waiting for the Lowells' response."

"How much did Mrs. Lowell actually spend on her?"

The meticulously documented figures landed like a stinging slap across the Lowell family's collective face.
###Chapter 44

The Lowell family was a prominent dynasty in the entertainment industry.

Richard Lowell held an esteemed position among film directors. In his youth, he was relatively unknown, having directed a few modest art films. Five years ago, his groundbreaking work Lone Mountain took the world by storm. Its raw depiction of the struggles of the underprivileged resonated deeply with audiences, catapulting him to A-list director status.

William Lowell, the eldest son, managed the family empire. Frequently seen at high-profile business events, his sharp-suited executive persona earned him a massive following on social media.

Daniel Lowell, the second son, was a darling of the fashion world. A gold medalist at international design competitions, he now served as creative director of Versini Couture. This haute couture brand—the only one from the country to achieve global acclaim—sparked frenzied demand with every seasonal collection.

Christopher Lowell, the third son, was a sought-after actor. He made his debut in his father’s film and later became a heartthrob through a string of hit romantic dramas, captivating millions of young women.

Nathan Lowell, the fourth son, was hailed as a musical prodigy. His debut album dominated charts, and his concert tickets sold out within seconds.

Then there was Emily Lowell, the family’s beloved daughter and a constant media fixture. Her lavish lifestyle—million-dollar jewelry, limited-edition gowns, globetrotting adventures—epitomized elite privilege. Fans endlessly gushed about how the entire Lowell clan doted on her.

Now, Sophia Laurent’s recent financial disclosure had sent shockwaves through the public.

"Emily’s bracelet alone costs over a million, but Sophia only spent $170,000 in five years? The disparity is insane."

"Don’t forget that $170,000 included tuition and living expenses. Emily’s custom piano is worth eight figures, isn’t it?"

"The real question is how Sophia survived after high school without family support."

Skepticism erupted from all sides.

Some defended the Lowells: "At least they didn’t let her starve. $170,000 isn’t nothing."

"Suing her own mother? How heartless."

"There must be a reason for such unequal treatment between biological children."

Public opinion split sharply.

Then Sophia dropped another bombshell: "Mrs. Lowell misappropriated $9.37 million without my consent. I’m only demanding $9 million in return."

The comment section fell silent.

The staggering figure left everyone speechless.
###Chapter 45

The internet exploded in an instant.

Nine hundred thirty-seven thousand! The staggering figure detonated across comment sections.

"Holy shit! Mrs. Lowell actually spent that much of Sophia's money?"

"I'd have called the cops ages ago. That's not a mother—that's a bloodsucker!"

"Sophia has every right to sue. No mother should exploit her daughter like this."

Keyboard warriors switched sides overnight.

Emily's fans immediately jumped to her defense.

"Nine hundred grand for a secretary? Give me a break!"

"That money obviously came from the Lowells. Now she's biting the hand that fed her."

"Nine hundred thousand? At my salary, it'd take 150 years to save that much!"

Emily's smirk froze as she stared at her phone screen.

Victoria's hands trembled violently.

She never expected Sophia to expose their financial dealings so publicly.

"How dare she!" Victoria snatched a maid's phone.

Her shrill voice pierced the air when the call connected. "Sophia! Are you trying to drive me to my grave?"

Sophia flipped through documents, chuckling. "I have no idea what you're talking about."

"Don't play dumb! What's the meaning of those online posts?" Victoria's chest heaved. "You want the whole world to condemn your own mother?"

A fountain pen twirled between slender fingers.

"First, I wasn't the one who leaked it."

"Second," Sophia's gaze turned glacial, "where were you when the internet crucified me?"

Dead silence filled the line.

Victoria's nails dug crescent moons into her palms.

"Were they wrong?" she suddenly shrieked. "What's so terrible about a mother using her daughter's money?"

Remembering the earlier public sympathy, she straightened her spine.

"Withdraw the lawsuit. Issue a public apology. You can still be the Lowell heiress."

Sophia watched dusk paint the sky outside.

Her reflection in the window glass wore a sardonic smile.
###Chapter 46

Sophia Laurent's lips curled into a mocking smile as she listened to the deliberately magnanimous tone on the phone.

"Mrs. Lowell, haven't you realized it yet?"

She enunciated each word clearly.

"The title of Lowell heiress means nothing to me."

"Before returning to the Lowell family, I struggled to survive in a damp basement."

"After returning, I still lived in shadows—only this time, it was a gilded cage."

"I could see the light, but never reach it."

When she was first brought back to the Lowell mansion, she naively believed she'd finally found a home.

She thought she would have loving parents like other children.

But reality slapped her hard across the face.

These so-called family members not only withheld warmth, but treated her as a bargaining chip.

She gave them her heart, only to receive endless demands in return.

At least now, she had finally awakened.

"Mrs. Lowell, if given the choice, I wish I'd never been born into this family."

The shattering sound of a teacup hitting the floor came through the phone.

Victoria Lowell's hand trembled slightly as she staggered backward.

Had Sophia really lived like this all these years?

Fragments of neglected memories suddenly surfaced in her mind.

Meanwhile, Emily Lowell stared intently at her phone screen.

Since leaking the story online, she had been monitoring public reactions.

She knew Sophia hadn't spent much of the Lowell family's money.

What right did an adopted daughter have to their fortune?

But when she saw the transfer records showing Sophia had sent Victoria over nine million, her pupils constricted violently.

Impossible!

Where did Sophia get that kind of money?

"Emily, what's wrong?" Nathan Lowell approached.

Emily wordlessly handed him the phone. "Fourth brother, look at what sister posted..."

Nathan's brows furrowed instantly after glancing at the screen.

"Seventeen thousand? Is she joking?"

He remembered casually spending over two hundred thousand on a gaming computer.

Not to mention his expensive music equipment.

How could Sophia have only spent that little?

His annual allowance during college exceeded that amount.

"How shameless, fabricating such lies." Nathan sneered.

Emily pressed her lips together silently.

When Nathan saw the nine-million transfer record, his expression darkened further.

"Where did she get that money? Did the old man give it to her privately?"

Nine million wasn't petty cash—no way Sophia could have earned that herself.
###Chapter 47

Nathan Lowell: @SophiaLaurent Suing your own mother with Grandfather's money? Disgracing the Lowell name? Is this your idea of filial piety?

As a top-tier music idol, Nathan's fanbase dwarfed Emily's. Previously uninvolved fans swarmed to join the drama.

Wait—where did Sophia get that money? If it's from Patriarch Lowell, doesn't that make it family funds?

LMAO, using Lowell money to sue Lowells? What kind of mental gymnastics is this?

170k in damages? Is this a joke?

"The number you have dialed is currently unavailable—"

"Who is this?"

A soft chuckle came through. "That's why you called?"

Sophia toyed with a pen, amusement coloring her tone. "Who said the money came from Grandfather?"

"What lie?"

His voice turned odd. "Don't tell me Ethan Winston gave it to you?"
###Chapter 48

Sophia Laurent curled her lips into a cold smile at Nathan Lowell's accusatory tone.

"Since when do I need to justify my finances to you?"

Sophia Laurent: I have formally disowned the Lowell family. All funds are legally obtained.

Sophia deactivated her account without another word.

Turning to her computer, she began analyzing past episodes of "We Are Singers."

On the premiere night of "We Are Singers," Nathan and Emily Lowell became the hottest trending topic.
###Chapter 49

Sophia Laurent, the long-lost biological daughter of the Lowell family, had been trending frequently lately. Her outrageous behavior sparked heated discussions across social media, bringing unprecedented attention to the Lowell siblings.

Lucas Sheridan frowned at the barrage of comments scrolling across his screen.

This Sophia Laurent... was she the legendary Composer T?

Composer T turned out to be a Lowell?

A derisive smirk curled his lips.

From what he knew, Composer T's single commission rate had reached five million three years ago. What was nine hundred thousand to someone like that?

Every eye in the studio locked onto center stage.

The entire audience held their breath, awaiting the mysterious figure's appearance.

As music swelled, a slender figure stepped forward.

Under the spotlight, the young woman shimmered in a flowing lake-blue gown, her porcelain skin glowing, waist cinched delicately. Chestnut hair cascaded over her shoulders, dark phoenix eyes striking—a vision of breathtaking beauty.

The studio fell into stunned silence.

"This... this is Composer T?"

"She's gorgeous! And so young?"

"Are we sure the producers didn't make a mistake? With looks like this, she could debut as an idol!"

"Hello everyone, I'm Sophia Laurent."

A pause, then her lips curved slightly.

"Also known as the composer you call T."

"Did I hear that right? She's really Composer T?"

"She looks barely twenty! Composer T is this young?"

"If Composer T became famous five years ago, that means she started composing as a teenager?"

"My self-esteem just shattered. I'm clearly just taking up space in this world..."

"Wait—what did she say her name was? So...phia Laurent?"
###Chapter 50

The live comments exploded instantly.

Countless netizens rubbed their eyes frantically, afraid they'd misread the name.

"Sophia Laurent" shone brightly on the singer information panel, glaringly conspicuous.

The very same Sophia the entire internet had been vilifying these past few days was now standing on the "We Are Singers" stage?

The comment section erupted.

"It must be someone with the same name!"

"There's no way Composer T could be that vile woman!"

"I'd rather believe it's a typo by the production team!"

The host's earpiece transmitted Lucas Sheridan's voice.

His lips twitched almost imperceptibly.

In the backstage control room, Lucas stared at the barrage of malicious comments with a cold smirk.

These people had no idea who they were insulting.

The stage lights blazed to life.

Sophia stood in the spotlight wearing a white dress, bowing slightly to the judges' panel.

"Good evening, judges. I'm Sophia Laurent."

Her clear voice resonated through the venue.

The host suddenly spoke up. "Miss Laurent, have you been online recently?"

The venue fell silent.

The camera zoomed in as Sophia's eyelashes fluttered slightly.

"Yes."

The question detonated like a bomb.

Sophia's lips curved slightly, starlight shimmering in her eyes.

"Of course."

"After all, I am that Sophia in the news."

"Holy shit! It's really her!"

Backstage in the green room.

Nathan Lowell staggered back two steps, his face ashen.

"Impossible..."

He stared at the figure on screen as if seeing his sister for the first time.

Emily Lowell dug her nails deep into her palms.

Blood dripped between her fingers, staining the carpet with dark crimson blooms.
###Chapter 51

Emily Lowell's nails dug into her palms as she stared at Sophia Laurent under the spotlight.

She had schemed tirelessly to turn the Lowell family against Sophia.

Yet this radiant woman before her was the legendary Composer T.

So what if she was Composer T?

Just a discarded daughter abandoned by the Lowells.

###Chapter 52

The stage lights suddenly blazed to life.

"Nathan's finally on stage!"

"I've waited so long for this moment!"

The episode's popularity exceeded expectations, but public opinion was spiraling out of control.

He wore a black suit with a silver brooch at the collar.

A melancholic ballad.

Nathan's deep, magnetic voice filled the studio.

"When starlight falls..."

Her fingers tapped lightly on the scoring sheet before her.

The melody remained steady.

No dramatic crescendos.

Like lukewarm water.

"Something's missing..."

"Nowhere near his previous work."

"Proof he needs Composer T."

Sophia was writing notes.

She never once looked up.

The deliberate disregard tightened his throat.

He nearly missed a lyric.

Should've been the emotional climax.

But Nathan's delivery stayed flat.

Like completing an obligation.

Not performing.

She set down her pen.

"Mediocre."

Her blunt assessment made nearby staff gasp.

This was her brother.

Such coldness?

Polite applause followed.

Nothing like the initial excitement.

His conflicted gaze lingered on the judges.

###Chapter 53

"This song is like a warm spring sun, capturing the tender emotions of youth."

"The style differs slightly from Nathan's previous works, but remains pleasing to the ear."

The chat exploded:
-What was Composer T about to say?
-Does she know how to improve it?
-Finally, someone tells the truth! This song is mediocre.

Nathan stared intently at Sophia's profile.

She said "melodic line"? How would she know how to revise his composition?

Impossible. She always avoided him.

###Chapter 54

"The melodic structure is complete, but lacks a defining touch."

Nathan Lowell stood center stage, his piercing gaze fixed on Sophia Laurent.

This handwriting...

Those annotated revisions that once appeared mysteriously in the music room—those brilliant modifications that awed him—all came from these hands.

He'd always assumed they were Emily's work.

"Nathan?" A staff member prompted softly.

Nathan snapped back to reality, his grip tightening until his knuckles turned white.
###Chapter 55

The host quickly adjusted her expression, steering the conversation back on track. But the live stream chat had already exploded.

"Nathan's expression just now was so strange!"
"I screenshot it—his eyes were red!"
"What on earth happened?"

Nathan Lowell's fingers trembled slightly as he took the sheet music. He immersed himself in it instantly, scanning each note while silently singing along in his mind.

Three minutes later, his head snapped up. His gaze locked onto Sophia Laurent with complex emotions.

Everything became clear.

All those modified musical arrangements—they were her handiwork.

In the backstage monitoring room, Director Lucas Sheridan frowned at the screen. He immediately pressed the intercom. "Have the host get him to perform it live."

"Nathan, could you sing this revised version for us?" The host smiled sweetly, though her eyes held probing curiosity.

Nathan's Adam's apple bobbed. After a moment of silence, he nodded. "Alright."

The music began.

The once bland melody suddenly came alive. The high notes burned like wildfire, the low notes caressed like gentle rain. The entire song pulsed with soul, making hearts tremble.

As the final note faded, the venue fell into stunned silence.

The live chat erupted.

"This is the Nathan I know!"
"The previous version can't even compare!"
"Wait...why does this style feel so familiar?"

Nathan's gaze never left Sophia. He searched her face for any clues but found only calm composure.

That once-timid girl now stood under the spotlight, radiant enough to blind.

"Why?" His voice tightened.

Sophia tilted her head slightly. "Hmm?"

The microphone emitted faint static in his grip. Just as he opened his mouth to speak, a scream pierced through the venue—

"Someone fainted!"
###Chapter 56

Nathan Lowell's gaze sharpened as he followed the staff member's hurried movements.

That direction was exactly where he had been standing with Emily Lowell moments ago.

His heart lurched. He broke into a sprint.

Sophia Laurent watched his retreating figure thoughtfully.

The expression on Nathan's face had clearly indicated he wanted to ask her something important.

And now, of all times, someone fainted?

She narrowed her eyes toward the gathering crowd.

Who else would make Nathan react like this except Emily?

If they weren't in the middle of filming, she'd have followed to see the spectacle herself.

Just then, the host received instructions from the director.

"Dear audience, due to unforeseen circumstances, we'll pause the live stream for ten minutes. We apologize for the inconvenience."

The broadcast cut off abruptly.

Live comments exploded instantly.

What happened? Who fainted?

Nathan looked frantic—was it Emily?

Tch, what perfect timing...

Exactly! Nathan was clearly about to ask Sophia something important!

Hearing the announcement, Sophia's lips curved slightly.

She rose and walked toward the commotion.

From a distance, she overheard someone questioning Nathan.

"Mr. Lowell, does Ms. Lowell have any preexisting conditions? Hypoglycemia? Anemia?"

"No." Nathan shook his head. "She's always been healthy."

"Please give her space. She needs fresh air."

Emily's assistant wrung her hands anxiously. "The ambulance is on its way. Everyone, please return to your seats. Nathan can stay with her."

She bowed repeatedly. "We're so sorry for the disruption."

The crowd murmured understandingly and dispersed.

Sophia approached unhurriedly.

Her glance swept over Emily, sprawled on the bench.

Rosy cheeks. Even breathing.

This didn't resemble a medical emergency.

"What did you want to ask me earlier?" Sophia cut straight to the point.

Before Nathan could respond, the assistant gasped. "Ms. Lowell is waking up!"

All attention snapped toward Emily.

Nathan immediately knelt beside her, grasping her hand.

"Where does it hurt?" His voice was tight.

Emily offered a weak smile. "I'm fine, Nathan. Probably just skipped breakfast..."

She glanced around apologetically. "So sorry for troubling everyone..."
###Chapter 57

The ballroom glittered under dazzling chandeliers. A crowd hovered around Emily Lowell, fussing over her delicate condition. She reclined limply on the sofa, her face paper-white and pitiful.

"Don't blame yourself, Emily. This wasn't your fault."

"You're so fragile. You should rest more."

"Composer T nearly smashed the piano in his rage earlier..."

A faint smile curled Emily's lips as her gaze found Sophia Laurent across the room. "Sister..." Her voice trembled. "The livestream incident... I truly didn't mean to..."

Sophia leaned against the champagne table, idly tapping her glass. She caught the fleeting triumph in Emily's eyes and chuckled. "Thanks to you, I gained three hundred thousand followers."

Emily's nails dug into her palms. Her attempt to sabotage Sophia had backfired spectacularly.

"Sister..." Tears welled in her eyes. "Are you really suing Mother? After all she's done for us..."

"Done for me?" Sophia swirled her champagne. "By abusing me?"

Emily opened her mouth to protest when she noticed Nathan Lowell's conflicted expression. She seized his hand dramatically. "Fourth Brother, I feel so faint..."

Sophia observed the performance coldly before speaking. "Nathan, ask your question now."

Her glass met the metal table with a sharp clink.

"After tonight, we're strangers."

Nathan wrenched his hand from Emily's grasp. "Why did you revise my score?" His voice tightened. "Why keep it from me?"

The ballroom fell silent. Emily's face drained of color, her perfectly applied lipstick cracking under bitten lips.

Sophia met his gaze.

"I once considered you family." She turned away, her skirt flaring decisively. "Now you're not worth explaining."

Nathan froze as if struck by lightning. A memory surfaced—three years ago, a timid girl hiding in hallway shadows, calling him "Fourth Brother" with hopeful eyes he'd ignored.

"Composer T." A deep voice broke the silence. A broad-shouldered man approached with raised glass, amber liquid reflecting his chiseled features. "An honor to finally meet you."
###Chapter 58

Nathan Lowell's brow furrowed slightly.

That voice was all too familiar.

Lifting his gaze, he saw the face he detested most.

Adrian Valentine beamed at Sophia Laurent. "I'm Adrian Valentine. Remember me?"

Sophia gave a slight nod, her lips curving into a faint smile.

"I do."

She had composed music for him before and listened to his songs.

Nathan stared at Sophia's smile, his frown deepening.

An inexplicable bitterness welled up in his chest.

Didn't this woman know Adrian was his sworn enemy?

Adrian noticed the scorching glare and turned with a raised brow. "Well, if it isn't our prodigy singer. What's this? Bonding with your sister backstage?"

Nathan's expression turned icy. "None of your business."

"Actually, it is." Adrian smirked. "The Lowell siblings are hogging public space and delaying the show..."

His gaze flickered between them. "This program isn't your private playground. Other contestants are waiting."

Nathan's face darkened. "What are you implying?"

Emily Lowell bit her lip, eyes glistening. "I'm sorry... This is all my fault..."

Seeing her distress, Nathan's anger flared.

"Adrian, enough. If you have a problem, take it up with me. Leave my sister out of this."

"Tsk tsk tsk." Adrian chuckled. "The legendary sister complex in action."

He cast a meaningful glance at Emily's teary face. "Pity some people remain oblivious pawns..."

Turning to Sophia, his expression softened.

"Composer T, let's go. No need to watch this farce."

Sophia had wanted to leave anyway. "Alright."

As they turned, Nathan suddenly spoke. "Sophia."

She paused, looking back impassively. "Yes?"

"You know exactly how things stand between us."

Their feud was common knowledge in the industry.

Sophia found it laughable. "What does that have to do with me?"

She'd heard rumors about the rising stars' rivalry.

But why should she care?

Nathan clenched his fists at her indifference. "You're still my sister."

Sophia actually laughed.

After a beat, she murmured, "What a curse that would be."

Nathan's face turned stormy.

Beside him, Emily watched Sophia's cold demeanor, the corners of her lips lifting briefly before morphing back into concern.

"Sister, how could you say such things?"
###Chapter 59

Emily Lowell's eyes brimmed with unshed tears. She bit her lip as she looked at Sophia Laurent. "Nathan has always been so kind to us. Even if you despise me, you shouldn't have said those hurtful things to him... He truly cares about you..."

Nathan Lowell stood nearby, his brow furrowed.

He had to admit Emily was right—blood ties couldn't be severed so easily.

Sophia let out a derisive laugh, her gaze icy. "His kindness to you doesn't extend to me."

Her voice was laced with frost. "And don't flatter yourself. You're beneath my notice."

She'd long seen through Emily's petty schemes and experienced enough of the Lowell family's favoritism.

Now, she wouldn't give Emily another chance.

Nathan suddenly erupted in anger. "Sophia! What have I ever done to wrong you?"

Sophia met his gaze squarely, her eyes sharp.

"Do you genuinely believe you've treated me well?"

She enunciated each word deliberately. "When Emily falsely accused me of stealing her necklace, you forced me to kneel in apology. When she claimed I ruined her dress, you destroyed my art studio. When she had me beaten at school and I came home for help, you slapped me instead..."

Nathan's face gradually paled.

Memories he'd deliberately buried resurfaced with painful clarity.

"Shall I continue?" Sophia's smile was cold.

Even now, for the sake of family interests, they'd unhesitatingly tried to marry her off to a comatose man.

What kind of family was this?

When they'd learned Ethan Winston had abandoned her, their first reaction had been "you must not have been good enough."

Nathan avoided her gaze, his voice unsteady. "I... I didn't know..."

He and Emily had grown up together—naturally, he'd trusted her more.

But now, doubt crept in.

Emily suddenly burst into tears. "Sister, why are you slandering me like this..."

She sobbed dramatically. "If it's because of me, I'm willing to leave the Lowell family..."

Sophia gave her a cold glance. "The truth can't stay buried forever."

Turning back to Nathan, she said, "If you want facts, go investigate for yourself."

With that, she turned to leave.

Adrian Valentine quickly followed. "Composer T, don't waste your breath on them! They're not worth your distress!"

He grinned as he caught up. "I wrote a new song just for you. Want to hear it?"
###Chapter 60

Nathan Lowell stared at the retreating figures, his knuckles turning white.

Adrian Valentine's triumphant expression fueled his rage.

Why?

He was Sophia's blood brother.

Her words echoed in his ears.

Forcing apologies. Destroying her room. That slap...

The Lowell heir had always been domineering but believed himself justified.

Forgotten memories now flooded back.

If Sophia had truly been framed...

A chill ran down his spine.

"Fourth brother..." Emily Lowell tugged his sleeve with tearful eyes.

He whirled around.

This time, her tears didn't soften him.

"If you're innocent, why panic?"

Emily's expression froze.

She forced a weak smile. "I just worry about you..."

Nathan studied her.

"I want to believe you."

He paused. "But truth always surfaces."

Emily paled.

"One more thing." Nathan narrowed his eyes. "Why didn't you explain about the sheet music?"

His first suspicion had fallen on Emily.

Only they two in the family understood music.

He remembered asking her.

And her silent admission.

"What sheet music?" Emily widened her teary eyes. "You must be mistaken."

"I asked if you touched it."

"I only picked it up." She bit her lip. "The wind was strong that day..."

Nathan frowned.

Could it really be a misunderstanding?

"Fourth brother..." Tears streamed down Emily's face. "Are you abandoning me?"

His heart softened. "Don't be ridiculous."

Seeing the sister he'd doted on since childhood, he couldn't stay harsh.
###Chapter 61

Nathan Lowell's chest burned with fury.

His knuckles turned white as he glared at the man laughing with Sophia Laurent in the distance.

That was his sworn enemy.

Why did his own sister have to side with him?

"Emily, go rest," he turned to Emily Lowell. "I'll have my assistant take you home."

Emily's head snapped up, panic flashing in her eyes.

"Fourth Brother, the show's about to start—"

"We Are Singers" was the hottest variety show right now, with Composer T guaranteeing record ratings.

She'd fought hard for this opportunity.

"You fainted earlier," Nathan said firmly. "Your health comes first."

Emily's eyes reddened with frustration.

"I'm fine, just a little low blood sugar—"

"Enough." Nathan cut her off. "My assistant will take you to the hospital."

As he turned to leave, Emily grabbed his sleeve.

"Fourth Brother!"

Nathan frowned and pulled his arm free.

"The show's starting."

He strode toward the studio without looking back.

Emily stood rooted to the spot, nails digging into her palms.

Her venomous gaze locked onto Sophia across the room.

Why hadn't that bitch died abroad?

Those useless foster parents should've smothered her at birth.

Her phone vibrated abruptly.

Emily's face paled when she saw the caller ID.

She hurried to a secluded corner.

"Are you insane?" she hissed. "Why are you calling now?"

A raspy chuckle came through the line.

"Breaking bridges after crossing the river, Miss Lowell?"

Emily clenched her jaw.

"You'll get your money. Don't contact me again."

"Two million," the man demanded. "Things are heating up. My boys need to disappear."

Emily trembled with rage.

"You—"

"No payment? Fine." His voice turned sinister. "I wonder how the Lowells would react to learning their daughter hired hitmen—"

"Shut up!" Emily snapped. "Send me the account number."

She ended the call, her expression darkening.

This was all Sophia's fault.

Everything would've been perfect if she'd never existed.
###Chapter 62

"Two million?" Emily Lowell's grip tightened around her phone, her knuckles turning white.

The man on the other end chuckled. "Does Miss Lowell find it too expensive?"

"This is blackmail," she hissed, glancing around cautiously.

"What choice do we have?" His tone was mocking. "The boys are short on cash lately. If we don't get paid, we might have to tell everyone how Miss Lowell hired thugs to kidnap her own sister—"

"Shut up!" Emily's face drained of color.

A lighter clicked through the receiver. He exhaled smoke. "Made up your mind?"

Emily bit her lip until it bled.

"Give me three days."

"Smart girl!" He laughed. "Always knew Miss Lowell was reasonable."

Her hands trembled after hanging up.

Taking deep breaths, she dialed another number.

"Chris..." Her voice instantly cracked with fake tears.

Christopher Lowell was on a filming break. "Em? What's wrong?"

"How much?"

"Two million." The words came out barely audible.

His brows furrowed. "Did Sophia do something again?"

"No..." Emily quickly denied. "It's personal."

"Stop covering for her." Chris scoffed. "That lunatic's been stirring trouble online. Should've known she'd target you."

"Send me your account details. I'll transfer it now."

A smirk flickered in Emily's eyes, though her voice quivered. "Thank you, Chris..."

"Don't mention it." He sighed. "Once I wrap this shoot, I'm dealing with Sophia."

The transfer notification chimed as Emily touched up her makeup.

Staring at her flawless reflection, she sent the payment.

"Money's sent. Keep your mouths shut."

The instant reply came: "Don't worry, Miss Lowell. We're professionals."

She slammed her phone screen dark.

Stage lights illuminated Sophia Laurent during her interview, radiant as always.

Emily's nails dug into her palms.

This bitch was why those gangsters had leverage over her.

Payback would come.
###Chapter 63

Nathan's attitude had shifted. Sophia could clearly sense the newfound distance between them.

The unconditional doting she once received now felt like a veil had been drawn over it.

All because she altered a musical score?

Were material possessions truly more precious than two decades of shared history?

The stage lights dimmed at the center.

Adrian cradled his guitar as the final note trembled in the air.

"Thank you, everyone."

When he bowed, his gaze locked onto Sophia in the judges' panel.

This folk ballad had consumed half a year of his life.

He'd traversed northwestern deserts and southern river towns, transforming a wanderer's solitude into melody.

His warm vocals concealed steel-like resilience.

Exclamations of admiration rippled through the judging panel.

"Remarkable talent! This song speaks to every traveler's soul."

"Did you compose both lyrics and music? Your progress is astounding."

"It moved me to tears. Such depth from someone so young."

Adrian offered polite smiles, but his eyes never left Sophia.

His peach-blossom gaze shimmered with flecks of light.

Sophia's crimson lips curved upward.

"Emotionally rich, rhythmically compelling. Your performance perfectly captured the song's essence."

Adrian's eyes instantly brightened.

"Really? Thank you, Composer T!"

He beamed like a child receiving candy.

Live comments flooded the stream.

[OMG! Adrian's ears turned red!]
[That's Composer T! His idol!]
[Their chemistry is off the charts!]
[Can't stop screenshotting this perfection]

In the penthouse of Valdemar Tower, Ethan gripped the edge of his desk, knuckles whitening.

Three years together, yet he'd never known the woman who shared his bed was a music legend.

Nor that she carried Lowell blood.

If only he'd discovered sooner...

He snatched his suit jacket with sudden violence.

The elevator mirrors reflected his stormy expression during the descent.
###Chapter 64

Under the spotlight, Nathan Lowell stared at Adrian Valentine's radiant smile, his knuckles turning white.

He glanced at Sophia Laurent's smiling profile, feeling a lump in his throat.

But he couldn't leave now.

He had to choose Sophia as his mentor.

The realization tightened his throat.

He never dreamed that Composer T, whom he idolized, would turn out to be Sophia.

The irony was unbearable. Those precious musical revisions he treasured weren't from Emily Lowell at all.

Memories flooded back.

When Sophia first returned to the Lowell family, he had considered making amends.

But then...

Witnessing her repeated targeting of Emily, he'd sided completely with his adoptive sister.

For years, he'd treated Sophia with cold indifference while defending Emily at every turn.

Until today.

Onstage, Sophia shone so brightly that he couldn't help reevaluating his biological sister.

If those accusations were true...

Nathan closed his eyes briefly.

He needed time to investigate.

But right now, he just wanted to be near Sophia.

The first round of "We Are Singers" officially began.

Thirty contestants took the stage one by one.

Adrian's performance brought the house down.

Nathan's singing was equally stunning.

"Advancing contestants: Adrian Valentine, Nathan Lowell, Chen Xue..."

"Professor Laurent, please choose me."

His peach-blossom eyes brimmed with anticipation.

Sophia smiled. "Agreed."

The live stream exploded.

[Our dream came true!]
[Divine pairing!]
[Their visuals are unmatched!]

"Drive faster," he ordered coldly.
###Chapter 65

As an industry titan, Winston Group's entertainment empire spanned the nation. For Ethan Winston, locating the filming site of "We Are Singers" took mere minutes.

On set, Nathan Lowell immediately interrupted when he heard Sophia Laurent accept Adrian Valentine's collaboration request.

"Sophia, you're partnering with me next round."

His commanding tone carried habitual authority, as though this were nonnegotiable.

Live comments exploded.

[How rude!]
[Nathan asked her personally!]
[Who does she think she is? Just because she writes songs?]
[Emily's the better sister anyway.]

She paused. "I don't want to work with you."

Sophia's laugh held no warmth. "If I had a choice, I'd renounce the Lowell name."

"Yes."

Her finality silenced him.

"Absolutely."

During the lunch break, Sophia exhaled—only to spot the last person she wanted to see.
###Chapter 66

The recording for "We Are Singers" took place in the private garden of a five-star hotel.

The production team had booked the entire venue. Only staff and invited guests were permitted entry.

Sophia Laurent had just finished rehearsals and was drinking water in the rest area.

When she looked up, she unexpectedly met a familiar pair of eyes.

Ethan Winston strode toward her in a crisp tailored suit.

"Sophia, we need to talk."

She set down her water bottle, her expression instantly turning frosty.

"Mr. Winston, we have nothing to discuss."

Their exchange drew curious glances from nearby crew members.

Noticing the attention, Ethan frowned slightly.

But he quickly softened his tone. "You won't even speak to me now?"

"No."

Her reply was crisp and final.

She couldn't forget how he'd called them mere acquaintances in front of Isabella Evans at the restaurant.

Nor could she erase the memory of him shamelessly proposing she become his secret lover.

The boy who'd once risked everything to save her had become the person who hurt her most.

"When did you become so heartless, Sophia?"

"Ethan, have you forgotten who cheated first?"

"You're the one who couldn't let go of your first love. You're the one who denied our relationship in public."

Seeing her stance soften slightly, hope flickered in his eyes.

"Sophia, there's really nothing between Isabella and me."

His voice took on a coaxing tone.

"Let's stop this nonsense and get back together."
###Chapter 67

The staff around them pricked up their ears, their gazes darting between the three figures.

The air was thick with tension.

Before Ethan Winston could finish speaking, Nathan Lowell had already stepped protectively in front of Sophia Laurent.

"Are you deaf, Winston?"

His glare was sharp as a blade. "Sophia wants nothing to do with you right now."

Ethan's eyes turned icy.

"Compared to me, it's the Lowell family she's desperate to escape from, isn't it?"

He stared Nathan down, his voice dripping with sarcasm.

These past days, he'd been closely monitoring Sophia's situation.

From Emily Lowell exposing family matters, to the online backlash, and finally that disownment notice.

He understood Sophia's resolve better than anyone.

But could blood ties truly be severed so easily?

This was merely a power play against Nathan.

"Whatever happens, she'll always be my sister. Who do you think you are?"

"Are you two done yet?"

If Ethan had chased after her to explain at the birthday banquet that day...

Perhaps she might have given him a chance to speak.

She couldn't care less.

Unless they came to ask about the baby, she couldn't be bothered.

Sophia's tense nerves relaxed slightly.

"Sure."

Adrian's smile deepened.

"This way. I know a great private kitchen."

They walked away side by side.

Two pairs of eyes burned holes into their retreating backs.

Adrian suddenly turned and gave them a meaningful smile.

Nathan and Ethan's faces darkened instantly.

As Sophia moved further away, Nathan gritted his teeth and followed.

Ethan remained rooted to the spot, unmoving.

He couldn't understand.

After swallowing his pride to reconcile, why was Sophia still treating him this way?

Where was the girl who used to adore him with her whole heart?

Everyone in their circle knew how deeply she'd loved him.

Over such a trivial matter, she'd changed just like that?

He'd thought she was merely throwing a tantrum.

Now it seemed her heart had long flown elsewhere.

And the culprit was undoubtedly Adrian Valentine!

Clenching his fists, Ethan strode after them.
###Chapter 68

Sophia Laurent had just settled by the window when Adrian Valentine handed her the menu.

She reached for it, then froze mid-motion. Two familiar figures appeared at the entrance.

Her fingers stilled.

The slightest kindness lingered in her memory.

Valdemar Sanatorium.

Henry Chamberlain waved a tablet at the hospital bed.

"Mr. Valdemar, your wife is actually Composer T!"

"Check out how this guy looks at her. Tsk."

Alexander Valdemar: "......"

Since his condition improved, Henry had abandoned all professional restraint.
###Chapter 69

Alexander lay motionless on the hospital bed, his ears ringing.

"Shut up."

His eyes snapped open, voice icy.

Henry immediately fell silent.

Since regaining consciousness, Alexander had drifted in and out of sleep for days. At least he was awake now, easing Henry's burden considerably.

After concluding a business meeting at noon, Henry had come to the sanatorium to unwind. His girlfriend kept bombarding him with celebrity gossip, which he'd ignored.

Until Sophia's name appeared.

He couldn't resist sharing the updates with Alexander—Emily instigating online attacks against Sophia, the truth coming to light, the restaurant scene with three men surrounding Sophia.

Alexander's tone was dismissive.

His periods of lucidity remained limited, preventing him from managing company affairs. This hospitalization conveniently exposed those with ulterior motives.

The longer outsiders believed him comatose, the sooner they'd reveal themselves.

With the marriage already publicized, divorce would only raise suspicions now.

"Don't mention her around me again."

Alexander closed his eyes.

Henry nodded hastily.

A bodyguard's voice sounded outside. "Madam, you've arrived."

Sophia stood at the doorway, responding softly.
###Chapter 70

The hospital room was so quiet you could hear the IV drip.

Henry Chamberlain heard footsteps outside and instinctively glanced at Alexander Valdemar lying in the bed.

Alexander's eyes remained closed, his breathing steady with no signs of waking.

Sophia Laurent pushed open the door.

"Madam." Henry immediately straightened his posture, his expression respectful.

"Mr. Chamberlain." Sophia gave a slight nod.

She had come straight from the television station without even removing her makeup.

Ethan Winston and Nathan Lowell had been waiting for her backstage, but she'd taken a detour to leave.

Now the person she knew best in Riverdale was actually Patriarch Valdemar.

Sophia stared at the man in the hospital bed.

Alexander's eyelashes cast faint shadows under the light.

She wished he would wake up soon.

Then she could finally end this farce of a marriage.

The Valdemars had already delivered their promised benefits to the Lowells.

All she had to do was play her part until the curtain fell.
