Sophia gazed at the arrogant young man before her, a flicker of heartache flashing in her eyes.

Her once humble and polite younger brother had been completely transformed by the vanity of the entertainment industry.

With the Lowell family's backing, striking looks, and several hit dramas under his belt, Christopher had skyrocketed to fame as a top-tier celebrity.

The sudden influx of wealth and recognition had gradually led him astray.

Now he looked down on everyone, acting as if the world revolved around him.

Sophia's lips curved into a meaningful smile.

"Not only will I reprimand you, but I'll also make you pay for what you've done today."

Christopher burst into exaggerated laughter as if hearing the most ridiculous joke.

"Hahaha, am I hearing this right?"

"You? Sophia Laurent? What could you possibly do to me?"

He arrogantly grabbed a teacup from the table and smashed it on the floor right in front of her.

The sharp sound of shattering porcelain echoed through the office.

"Go ahead. Let's see how you'll—"

Sophia calmly instructed the receptionist, "Call the police. Someone is intentionally damaging company property."

Then she ordered the approaching security guards, "Block all exits. Don't let anyone leave."

Christopher always traveled with an entourage—assistants, makeup artists, and four bodyguards.

This was why he dared to act so recklessly.

With wealth, influence, millions of fans, and bodyguards by his side, he believed he could buy his way out of any trouble.

Over time, he grew increasingly insolent.

The bodyguards immediately formed a protective circle around Christopher, facing off against the security team.

"Sophia Laurent, have you lost your mind?"

Christopher doubled over with laughter. "You're calling the police over a few cheap cups?"

He gave Sophia a disdainful once-over.

"What can the police even do?"

"You might end up worse off than you started..."

Sophia ignored his taunts.

Pearl Group's security team was well-trained, swiftly blocking all possible exits.

Ten minutes later, police sirens grew louder.

"Who reported the incident?"

Sophia pointed at Christopher. "Officer, this man intentionally destroyed company property."

The scene was chaotic—shattered vases, teacups, and scattered documents littered the floor.

The officer turned to Christopher. "Did you cause this damage?"

Christopher shoved his hands in his pockets, sneering. His assistant smoothly stepped forward to mediate.

"Officer, this is just a misunderstanding. We're willing to compensate for the damages."

The officer looked at Sophia. "They've offered compensation. Would you—"

Sophia shook her head. "I refuse compensation. He acted deliberately and has broken the law."

She cast a cold glance at Christopher.

"According to public security regulations, intentional destruction of property warrants legal consequences."

The officer nodded in understanding and approached Christopher.

"Sir, please come with us."

"What?" Christopher's face paled. "Do you know who I am?"

"The law applies equally to everyone."
###Chapter 115

The officer's expression was stern. "Please cooperate with the investigation."

Christopher Lowell smirked arrogantly. "What's the hurry?"

He pulled a check from his briefcase and flung it toward Sophia Laurent.

"How much could these worthless things cost? Here's ten thousand - enough to buy new ones."

The check sailed through the air in an arc.

Sophia watched the fluttering paper, her eyes turning icy.

"Such generosity, Mr. Lowell. One might mistake this for charity."

She stepped on the fallen check with her heel.

Christopher's face darkened instantly. "Sophia, don't push your luck."

His assistant stepped forward, lowering his voice threateningly. "Know when to stop, Ms. Laurent. Crossing the Lowells won't end well for you."

Sophia walked straight to the officers.

"Officers, there's been trespassing and attempted bribery at my company. I'd like to file a formal complaint."

Her voice was clear and composed.

The officer nodded. "Do you have surveillance footage?"

"The security room is on the second floor."

Sophia led them toward the elevator.

Christopher shoved past his bodyguards. "Sophia! Stop right there!"

No one turned back.

Ten minutes later, the officers returned with bodycam footage.

"We have sufficient evidence. Take him away."

Two officers immediately restrained Christopher.

He struggled violently. "Do you know who I am? Sophia! You'll regret this!"

Sophia watched coldly.

The assistant approached with a grim expression. "Ms. Laurent, you're no match for the Lowell family."

"Thanks for the warning."

Sophia suddenly smiled. "I almost forgot - your specialty is exploiting legal loopholes."

She turned toward the private elevator.

Custodial staff quickly cleaned the scene.

Inside her office, Sophia dialed Patriarch Valdemar.

"Grandfather, it's me."

A kind voice answered. "Sophia dear, calling at this hour?"

"I need your help with something."

After a brief explanation, Patriarch Valdemar's voice turned grave. "They dared bully my granddaughter-in-law? Leave this to me."
###Chapter 116

The Lowell Group had dominated the business world for years with deep roots and extensive connections. A minor issue like Christopher Lowell's should have been resolved with a single phone call.

Christopher thought so too.

When the police took him away, he remained completely calm. With a lazy glance at his assistant, he followed them without hesitation.

He assumed it was just a formality. He'd be released before even setting foot in the station.

But to his surprise, after interrogation, he was directly locked in a holding cell.

"What's the meaning of this? Where's my lawyer?" Christopher frowned.

This wasn't his first time at the police station.

Previously, he'd always been bailed out immediately after arrival.

"You're suspected of intentional property damage. The assessed loss exceeds five thousand dollars, meeting the case filing threshold."

The officer paused. "If no settlement is reached, you'll face ten days detention plus fines, along with full compensation for damages."

"I'll pay ten times the amount!" Christopher said darkly. "I already gave her a check. I'll add more if needed. You have no right to detain me."

"Sorry, the victim refused compensation. The check has been returned to your assistant."

Christopher's face turned stormy.

"Do you know who I am? Get Commissioner Woods here—"

The officer's brow furrowed.

"The law applies equally to everyone."

With that, he gestured dismissively. "Take him away."

Christopher looked like he'd swallowed a fly.

Meanwhile.

The assistant immediately called William Lowell.

"Mr. Lowell, there's trouble."

William was still reeling from Sophia Laurent establishing Pearl Entertainment. With the company in chaos, his mind was elsewhere.

He glanced at the caller ID and rubbed his temples.

"What is it?"

Christopher should have returned from filming to attend the "River Banquet" premiere.

"Mr. Christopher was taken by the police. The lawyer's bail request was denied. Could you—"

"What happened?" William's frown deepened.

"He just broke some things. The other party refused compensation and called the police directly..."

This wasn't Christopher's first offense. William was used to it.

"Whose property was damaged? I'll handle it." He suppressed his irritation. "I'll make some calls to the station."

The assistant sighed in relief.

"It was Pearl Entertainment's reception desk. Just some inexpensive items."

William: "..."

Silence fell.

With anyone else, the Lowell name would suffice. Especially now with the Valdemar connection.

But of course, it had to be Sophia.
###Chapter 117

That woman was utterly unyielding now. Getting her to relent was harder than scaling the heavens.

William Lowell took a long moment to collect himself before exhaling sharply. "What madness possessed Christopher to provoke Sophia?"

His assistant caught the edge of displeasure in his voice and discreetly glanced at the delicate Emily in the backseat.

"Third Young Master heard about Sophia's recent actions and intended to advise her to show restraint," the assistant chose his words carefully. "But Sophia not only refused to listen, she insulted him. In the heat of the moment, he vandalized Pearl Group..."

A vein throbbed at William's temple.

Just hearing the name "Sophia" triggered a headache now.

"Enough. I'll handle it." He massaged his forehead. "Tell Christopher to stay away from Sophia from now on."

That woman was like a bristling cat now—untouchable.

But no matter how troublesome she was, she couldn't possibly cause real waves.

The turmoil at Valdemar Group was escalating. Sooner or later, it would reach her.

And then...

Though puzzled, the assistant nodded. "Understood. I'll relay your message."

After hanging up, William dialed another number.

"Commissioner Woods, long time no see." His tone was familiar, almost jovial.

A hearty laugh came through the line. "Thanks to you, I'm doing well."

"When are you free for a drink? My treat."

"Ah, my health hasn't been great lately. Can't handle alcohol these days."

After some small talk, William got to the point. "Truth be told, I have a favor to ask..."

The line went silent for two seconds.

"This is about your brother, isn't it?" Commissioner Woods' chuckle carried understanding.

William didn't deny it. "Youngsters act rashly. I hope you can overlook this. I'll personally bring him to apologize."

"No need for apologies."

The Commissioner's voice turned stern. "We're law-abiding citizens. Illegal activities mustn't be tolerated, don't you agree?"

"Of course, you're absolutely right."

William forced a laugh while mentally cursing Christopher to hell.

Of all people, why provoke Sophia?

That woman was all thorns now—impossible to touch.

"Ah..."

Commissioner Woods sighed heavily. "It's not that I won't help you, but this time it's truly impossible. Perhaps... try someone else?"

William's heart skipped a beat.

For someone of the Commissioner's standing, bailing someone out over minor vandalism should've been effortless.

"This..."

Sensing his shock, Commissioner Woods lowered his voice. "Your brother kicked an iron plate this time. Orders came directly from above—due process must be followed. No exceptions."
###Chapter 118

William Lowell's brow furrowed deeply. "Even you... can't do anything about it?"

"Hmm." Commissioner Woods sighed quietly. "It's better to stay in one's lane. There's always someone stronger..."

The line fell silent.

"Discipline your brother properly when he gets out." The commissioner's voice grew stern. "Before he causes real trouble."

The call ended abruptly.

William's knuckles turned white around his phone.

Suddenly remembering something urgent, he dialed Sophia's number.

"Beep—"

The mechanical tone made his expression darken instantly.

"Bang!"

Files scattered across the office floor as he swept them aside.

William's chest heaved violently.

After a long pause, he called Christopher's assistant.

"How could Christopher suddenly go after Sophia during closed filming?"

The assistant glanced nervously at Emily before—

"Let me."

Emily took the phone, her eyes red-rimmed. "Big brother..." Her voice trembled with tears. "It's all my fault..."

"When third brother asked about family matters, I spoke without thinking..."

Sobs carried through the receiver.

William's chest tightened.

"Not your fault." He softened his tone. "You know how hotheaded Christopher is."

"But..." Emily choked out, "Sister got hurt because of me—"

"Sophia's just petty!" William's voice turned icy. "This has nothing to do with you."

A faint smile flickered in Emily's eyes.

"Should I apologize to her?" she asked timidly. "If she'll forgive—"

"Absolutely not!"

William's refusal was final.

"She's the one who owes apologies."

His tone gentled. "Don't worry. Sophia can't cause any real waves."

"Mmm..." Emily responded obediently. "Let me know if you need anything."

"You..." William sighed. "If only Sophia had half your sense..."

"Sister's actually quite kind—"

"Only you would defend her." William snorted.

Emily's lips curved slightly.

"Big brother..." She suddenly lowered her voice. "About Mom asking for money last time..."

William froze.

He'd just transferred 1.5 million last month.

Again?
###Chapter 119

William Lowell drummed his fingers on the desk, his brow furrowed.

The bank transfer notification on his phone screen weighed on him like a stone.

"Big brother..." Emily Lowell's voice quivered through the phone. "Mom's really upset."

A vein throbbed at William's temple.

He knew all about Sophia Laurent's outrageous demand for nine million.

"Sophia doesn't deserve this money," he ground out.

But the image of Emily's tearful face softened his resolve.

"I own an apartment downtown," William exhaled sharply. "Sell it and give the money to Mom."

The words felt like a knife twisting in his chest.

That property was his grandfather's wedding gift—a prime location now worth over ten million.

"Really?" Emily's voice brightened instantly. "You're the best, big brother!"

Her saccharine tone eased his pain slightly.

"Anything for you," he forced a smile.

Consider it disaster prevention money.

After Sophia sent her own father to prison, who knew what she'd do next?

Emily hung up, a cold smirk curling her lips.

She immediately dialed Victoria Lowell.

"Mom..." she drawled, injecting vulnerability into her tone.

"What is it?" Victoria sounded exhausted.

"Don't be angry," Emily softened her voice. "I've secured the nine million..."

Silence.

"Where did you get that kind of money?" Victoria's pitch rose sharply.

"A friend loaned it to me." Emily kept her tone light. "I couldn't let you face a lawsuit."

Victoria's voice cracked.

"My sweet girl," she choked out. "Those ungrateful sons of mine are useless in a crisis!"

Emily's eyes glinted with contempt.

"The boys care about you too," she lied smoothly.

If not for the Lowell Entertainment shares, she wouldn't lift a finger for the old hag.

"Come for dinner tonight," Victoria's mood visibly lifted. "I'll have the kitchen make your favorite sweet and sour ribs."

"Of course." Emily's reply dripped honey.

She hung up and immediately opened a real estate app.

She'd had her eye on that apartment for ages.

Not only would this solve the immediate problem, but she'd profit handsomely.

That fool Sophia had unwittingly done her a favor.
###Chapter 120

The assistant exhaled sharply after ending the call with William Lowell.

He directed the driver to take Emily Lowell to her destination while rushing back to the police station with the lawyer.

"Christopher Lowell is charged with intentional property damage with aggravating circumstances," the officer stated impassively. "He's sentenced to ten days detention and a fine of one thousand yuan."

"What?" The assistant shot up from his seat. "That's impossible!"

He gestured to the lawyer beside him. "We're willing to compensate for all damages. This punishment is excessive!"

The officer pulled up surveillance footage. "The video clearly shows premeditated destruction."

Beads of sweat formed on the assistant's forehead.

He stepped into a corner and redialed William's number.

"Don't bother me!" William snapped, still fuming over the villa incident. "I can't deal with this now!"

The assistant's hand trembled slightly around the phone.

"Mr. Lowell, if the third young master gets detained, the company's reputation—"

A loud thud interrupted him as William slammed his desk.

"Tell PR to draft a statement blaming everything on Sophia Laurent!"

The assistant paled.

Ending the call, he forced himself to approach the officer again.

"We'll pay twenty times the damages. Could you possibly—"

"Take it up with the victim," the officer cut him off.

The assistant clenched his fists.

He knew Sophia wouldn't let Christopher off easily.

For the first time, resentment toward Emily surfaced in his mind.

If she hadn't gone crying to Christopher, he wouldn't have lost control.

But the real villain was Sophia.

That venomous woman would even scheme against her own brother.

A cold glint flashed in the assistant's eyes.

He would make Sophia pay for this.

At the police station, Christopher's face mask was removed.

Gasps erupted around the room.
###Chapter 121

The police announcement came abruptly.

Property damage cases usually aren't serious enough to draw much attention.

But this was different.

Who was Christopher Lowell? A top-tier celebrity with millions of devoted fans.

The moment news of his detention broke, sharp-eyed netizens screenshotted and reposted it.

The hashtag #TopCelebChristopherDetainedForVandalism instantly exploded across the internet.

The top three trending spots were all dominated by related topics.

Fan groups erupted into chaos.

Sure, Chris has a temper, but there must be a reason!

Vandalism? That's worth detention?

He could pay ten times the damages without blinking!

This has to be the first time a top celeb got detained over something so trivial!

Fans flooded discussions with frantic comments.

Details? What exactly did he damage?

Who dared provoke our Chris?

If I find out who, I'll curse their ancestors into oblivion!

There were plenty of eyewitnesses at Pearl Group that day.

Soon, insiders began leaking information.

I saw Christopher smash things at Pearl Group with my own eyes.

It was because of Sophia Laurent.

Just some phones, cups, and brochures—how much could those even cost?

...

As more photos from the scene circulated, the truth became clearer.

Fans who learned the full story went ballistic.

Is Sophia insane? Calling the cops on her own brother?

No wonder the Lowells hate her—she's twisted!

I heard Nathan Lowell lost all his endorsements because of her!

Why doesn't that viper just die?

Pearl Group, right? Let's storm their accounts, girls!

The fan army mobilized swiftly.

Pearl Group's official account was the first target.

Then came Sophia's Composer T profile.

Even Lucas Sheridan and the "Empress" official page weren't spared.

A tidal wave of vitriol crashed down.

Fans of Emily Lowell, Richard Lowell, and Nathan Lowell joined the fray.

Comment sections turned into cesspools of profanity.

A handful of rational netizens tried to interject.

If the police detained him, doesn't that mean Christopher actually broke the law?

What's wrong with someone exercising their legal rights?

But their voices were quickly drowned out.

Even worse, major gossip accounts suddenly launched a coordinated attack.

All targeting Sophia Laurent.
###Chapter 122

The trending list exploded overnight.

#MusicQueenSophiaLaurentOnceLickedBootsOfRichFamily#
#SophiaLaurentHomewreckerHistoryExposed#
#HeirWinstonStolenFromChildhoodSweetheartByMusicMogul#

Marketing accounts coordinated their attacks, flooding the internet with salacious revelations.

The allegations were a toxic mix of truth and fiction.

At the center were Ethan Winston, heir to the Winston Group conglomerate, music icon Sophia Laurent, and socialite Isabella Evans.

The Winston Group owned multiple entertainment companies, making Ethan a regular fixture in both business and gossip columns.

He was considered one of "Hollywood's Three Most Eligible Bachelors" alongside William Lowell and Alexander Valdemar.

The exposé detailed Ethan and Isabella's childhood romance.

Their families were old money acquaintances who grew up together.

The post included intimate childhood photos of the pair.

Young Ethan held Isabella's hand, his sunlit smile radiating pure affection.

Comments erupted:

"OMG! This is fairy-tale love!"
"The way Ethan looks at Isabella—so tender!"
"So she's the legendary first love!"
"Now THIS is a power couple!"

Then the narrative took a sharp turn.

Subsequent photos showed Sophia with Ethan.

Ethan remained stone-faced while Sophia beamed in every shot.

One showed Sophia waiting outside Winston Tower late at night.
Another captured her serving Ethan soup with excessive enthusiasm.
A particularly damning image depicted Sophia struggling to support a drunken Ethan.

Public outrage mounted:

"Disgusting! She's clearly throwing herself at him!"
"No shame chasing wealth and status!"
"Homewreckers deserve hell!"
"No wonder Isabella left the country—who could endure this?"

Sophia scrolled through the posts with a bitter smile.

The photos were real.
The events had indeed occurred.

She and Ethan got together a year after Isabella's departure.

During a family memorial trip, she'd recognized Ethan as the boy who once saved her life.

From then on, she quietly followed his career.

After Isabella left, Ethan drowned himself in alcohol.

She'd only approached him out of concern.

Then Ethan unexpectedly proposed dating.
###Chapter 123

Ethan Winston's voice was soft, yet it landed like a stone breaking the calm surface of a lake.

"Sophia Laurent, let's give this a try."

Her eyelashes fluttered in surprise. But she nodded quickly.

She didn't dislike Ethan. In fact, she rather admired him.

The photos leaked by the media were taken a year into their relationship. Ethan's expression was as aloof as ever in those pictures. At the time, she hadn't noticed anything amiss.

Looking back now, his reluctance was obvious.

What had he really been thinking?

Where did she stand in his heart these past three years?

Sophia closed her eyes briefly, her chest tightening.

The sudden ringtone shattered her thoughts.

"Sophia, have you seen the news?" Oliver Granger's voice crackled with urgency.

She steadied herself. "I have."

"Should PR issue a statement immediately?"

Sophia frowned in contemplation.

The backlash was overwhelming. First Christopher Lowell's arrest, now her relationship with Ethan being twisted into something ugly. The internet was a chorus of vitriol.

Clearly, multiple parties were fueling the fire.

"Have PR release a statement," she paused. "As for Ethan and me..."

He probably wouldn't cooperate.

Hanging up, she opened her social media. Private messages flooded in, freezing her phone momentarily.

Each one was a venomous curse.

Homewrecker. Monster. Deserving of death. Every word pierced her heart.

The comments section was no better.

Pressing her lips together, she quickly drafted a post:

[Truth speaks for itself]

She attached the surveillance footage of Christopher vandalizing Pearl Group's offices.

The video sparked an immediate shift in public opinion.

"Christopher's behavior is outrageous!"

"Anyone would've called the police. That's blatant vandalism."

"Rumors of his arrogance were true. The Lowells always covered for him."

"Serves him right. His malice is written all over his face."

Christopher's fans lashed out:

"Sophia pushed him too far!"

"Why would he target only her? She must've provoked him!"

"Compared to Emily Lowell, Sophia's nothing!"
###Chapter 124

Sophia's fans and neutral observers fought back against Christopher's supporters.

"Can Christopher's fans be reasonable for once? Admit your mistakes when you're wrong!"

Christopher's fans ignored the facts and attacked Sophia instead.

"Her own family hates her. That proves she's bad luck!"

"Homewrecker deserves to die!"

"Personal relationships and artistic work are separate matters!"

"My relationship with Ethan Winston began one year after Isabella left. We've since broken up."

"Media lies! It was a normal relationship!"

"Homewrecker trying to whitewash herself?"

An unknown number.

"Sophia, it's me."

Her expression remained blank. "What do you want?"

"Do we have to be so distant?"

Her eyes turned icy. "Mr. Winston, we were never close."

"A lapse in judgment."

Ethan fell silent.

"Have you forgotten everything I did for you?"

Sophia's left hand clenched briefly before relaxing.

"You were good to me, and I repaid you in kind. We're even."

Truthfully, Ethan had treated her well.

Never missed a birthday surprise.

Always brought gifts from business trips.
###Chapter 125

Sophia Laurent had once been abused by her adoptive parents and misunderstood by her biological family.

In her naivety, she believed Ethan Winston was the only person in the world who truly cared for her.

Back then, she was so desperate for love that she romanticized every little thing Ethan did as kindness.

On the other end of the call, Ethan's expression darkened instantly.

When Sophia received no response after a long pause, her voice turned icy. "If you have nothing else to say, Mr. Winston, I'm hanging up."

Ethan finally snapped out of his thoughts.

"Have you seen the posts online?"

Hearing his deliberately stern tone, Sophia frowned. "I have."

She forced her voice to sound indifferent. "And?"

"If you apologize to Gabrielle, I'll help clear your name."

Sophia couldn't believe her ears. "You want me to apologize to Gabrielle Winston?"

"For hitting her," Ethan said, his tone laced with authority. "Sophia, you weren't like this before."

In the past, she had always endured Gabrielle's bullying without complaint.

Because Gabrielle was his sister.

The Winstons had spoiled their daughter rotten since childhood—even Ethan couldn't control her.

Sophia let out a bitter laugh. "That's because I was stupid back then."

Her voice was firm. "I won't apologize. She doesn't deserve it."

That slap wasn't just for Gabrielle insulting her unborn child.

It was for all the years of humiliation Gabrielle had put her through.

Gabrielle had branded her a seductress who lured her brother away, targeting her at every turn and publicly shaming her.

Sophia had swallowed her pride for Ethan's sake.

And in return, Gabrielle only grew bolder.

She was nothing but a spoiled heiress with a fragile ego.

Ethan's voice sharpened with urgency. "Sophia, do you really want to cut ties with the Winstons?"

This time, Gabrielle hadn't just cried to him—she'd dragged their parents into it.

They'd vowed to teach Sophia a lesson themselves.

The thought alone gave Ethan a headache.

"Sophia, be reasonable. I'm doing this for your own good."

Sophia almost laughed at the absurdity.

After a long silence, she spoke slowly. "Ethan, are you out of your mind?"

Her words were deliberate. "Or do you just not understand human language?"

Ethan was rendered speechless.

His frustration boiled over. "Sophia, you've changed! Do you really think I'd harm you?"

Sophia gave a soft, humorless chuckle. "Who knows?"

She paused, her voice glacial. "After all, we're nothing to each other now."

Even clearing her name came with the condition of her bowing her head in apology.

She must have been blind to ever love a man like him.
###Chapter 126

Ethan's grip tightened around his phone, his knuckles turning white.

"Sophia, must you go this far?"

His voice trembled with suppressed rage, veins pulsing at his temple.

Outside the floor-to-ceiling windows, twilight painted his brooding profile in somber hues.

That night... he'd said things he shouldn't have.

###Chapter 127

Isabella's fingers glided across her phone screen as the venomous comments scrolled past.

Lowell Family Villa.

Richard smashed the vase on the coffee table the moment he hung up.

Just as the nine million scandal settled, new trouble arose?

"The Valdemars won't tolerate this scandal." William narrowed his eyes. "Just wait and see."
###Chapter 128

Richard Lowell slammed his teacup onto the coffee table with a jarring clatter.

"Sophia Laurent has gone completely rogue! The Valdemars doing her the favor of disciplining her should be considered a blessing."

His face darkened with rage, veins bulging at his temples.

"We arranged that marriage hoping she'd support the family. Instead, she's working against us at every turn."

William Lowell smirked, fingers drumming against the armrest.

"Once the Valdemar succession is settled, no matter who takes charge, she'll face consequences."

Richard snorted, lifting a freshly poured cup.

"Pearl Entertainment is doomed. That narrow-minded girl thinks she's fit to lead?"

William suddenly wore a calculating smile.

"If she had any sense, she'd merge Pearl Entertainment with Lowell Entertainment now to save herself."

"Pity..."

Richard shook his head in disdain.

"Trash from the gutter will always be trash."

Victoria Lowell sat silently in the corner.

She remembered the first time she saw Sophia—a timid girl in ill-fitting hand-me-downs, standing awkwardly at the doorway.

She'd wept from pity then.

But now...

Sophia's constant hostility toward Emily and erratic behavior made affection impossible.

Emily was so considerate.

Not only gentle and attentive, but she'd even covered that nine-million deficit.

As for Sophia...

If only she'd return to that docile girl from before, perhaps there'd still be hope.

Emily Lowell lingered at the staircase landing, lips curling upward.

Blood daughter or not?

She'd been thoroughly eclipsed by her adopted sister.

What did Sophia's competence matter?

In the Lowell family, no one would ever take her side.

Ethan Winston wouldn't spare her a second glance either.

She was destined to be the joke.

Online sentiment had completely reversed after Ethan's statement.

The internet flooded with vitriol against Sophia.

"Congratulations to Mr. Winston and Miss Evans! Some people should know their place."

"Childhood sweethearts are so pure. Homewreckers should disappear."

"Mr. Winston's direct rebuke must sting. How's that face feeling, Miss Laurent?"

Each comment cut deeper than the last.
###Chapter 129

Morning sunlight filtered through the curtains as Sophia Laurent's phone vibrated.

A compressed file from the private investigator sat quietly in her inbox.

She opened her social media app. The private message inbox was overflowing. Some messages contained vicious insults, while others offered warm encouragement.

The usually gentle music icon's words burned with anger: "Have some people lost their minds? Adults should think for themselves instead of blaming victims. @SophiaLaurent, ignore those keyboard warriors. I've got your back."

With Adrian's massive fanbase, the post instantly trended.

Comments flooded in with overwhelming support.

If the Winstons could weaponize public opinion against her, she'd fight fire with fire.

Within thirty minutes, explosive hashtags dominated trends:

#Shocking! Scion Of Wealthy Family Cheated On - Drunken Video Leaked#
#Music Prodigy Two-Timed - Dumped Childhood Friend For Foreign Lover#
#Plot Twist! So-Called First Love Was Serial Cheater#

The threads contained irrefutable evidence against Ethan Winston and Isabella Evans.

Timelines clearly showed Isabella had left for abroad with a foreign music student four years prior - long before Sophia ever met Ethan.

The most damning evidence was a nine-photo collage showing Isabella making out with her foreign boyfriend in a bar, straddling him while scantily clad.

Comments erupted:

"OMG! This changes everything!"
"Isabella's behavior is downright trashy!"
"So Sophia was the real victim here?"
"Poor Sophia! Dealing with these two must be karma for past sins!"

The tide of public opinion began turning.
###Chapter 130

The internet had been reveling in Ethan Winston and Isabella Evans' fairytale romance.

Then the bomb dropped—news broke of Isabella's affair with a foreign boyfriend.

Sophia Laurent transformed overnight from the vilified "other woman" to the most innocent victim.

Disgusting behavior.

Sophia didn't care.

She was waiting for the private investigator's report.

Since Christopher Lowell insisted on self-destruction, she'd happily deliver his comeuppance.

Ethan Winston's office at Winston Group.

The CEO glared at his screen, face stormy.

Public opinion had flipped overnight.

He and Isabella were now universally reviled.

The door burst open.

Gabrielle Winston stormed in, furious.

"Brother! Has Sophia lost her mind? How dare she do this to you?"

Her voice dripped with disbelief. "She adored you! Why would she let the internet attack you?"

Ethan's temple throbbed.

He wondered the same—when had Sophia changed?

He'd explained the birthday incident.

The thought pressed on his chest like a boulder.

Gabrielle ranted on: "Since she's playing dirty, we should expose her! I saw her at the OB-GYN—she's probably pregnant, trying to trap you—"

"Enough!" Ethan snapped. "That's impossible."

"No buts." His tone brooked no argument.

She bit her lip. Sophia's reaction that day had been suspicious...

Yet her brother seemed certain.

"Ancient history." Ethan's voice turned glacial.

Isabella's past meant nothing.

This engagement was merely a chess move to seize Winston Group.
###Chapter 131

Gabrielle Winston bit her lip, her face etched with frustration.

"Are we just letting the online scandal slide?"

Ethan Winston snapped out of his thoughts, his expression indifferent.

"The buzz will fade eventually."

Right now, securing control of the company was his top priority.

Her plan to force Sophia Laurent into a public apology had failed.

Her stiletto heels clicked sharply against the floor.

She couldn't swallow this humiliation.

If her brother was so certain Sophia wasn't pregnant, then her visit to the OB-GYN...

Could she be carrying a bastard child?

Yeah, right.

Since when had Miss Winston ever accepted defeat?

It was a custom piece Sophia had gifted him for his birthday last year.

Posts about Ethan Winston and Isabella Evans gradually disappeared across platforms.

Anyone with eyes could tell Winston Corporation was pulling strings behind the scenes.

Though the posts were gone, the truth had already spread.

Netizens flooded Sophia's accounts with apologies.

Only Christopher Lowell's fans continued making noise.

Even if she wasn't the other woman, Sophia was no saint—why else would her own family despise her?

Christopher had such a gentle temperament; smashing things must've been an accident. How dare she call the police!

That vicious woman clearly wanted to ruin her own brother!

Just as the fans reached peak outrage, a new wave of exposés flooded the internet.

#Shocking Footage: A-List Star Assaults Rookie Actor On Set#

#Exclusive: Christopher Lowell's Hit-and-Run Leaves Victim Severely Injured#

#Insider Report: Top Actor Bullied Co-Star Into Depression and Career Exit#

Christopher's scandals erupted like a volcano.
###Chapter 132

Sophia Laurent's fingers trembled slightly as she stared at the barrage of explosive posts flooding her computer screen.

Each post meticulously documented Christopher Lowell's misdeeds over the years, accompanied by irrefutable evidence.

Christopher had skyrocketed to fame through a youth idol drama, building his public persona as a hardworking heir from a wealthy family.

But his true colors emerged after achieving stardom.

On set, he frequently arrived late and left early, treating crew members like servants.

During variety show recordings, he often walked off when dissatisfied with the script.

Most shockingly, he had committed a hit-and-run while driving drunk, leaving a newlywed couple severely injured in the hospital.

"We don't want compensation. We just want justice." The couple lay bandaged in their hospital beds during the video testimony.

A former actress forced out of the industry accused, "He bullied me relentlessly on set, abusing his celebrity status."

Sophia was stunned to discover Christopher's crimes far exceeded her worst assumptions.

They couldn't believe their idol of many years was such a monster.

Some dug up old fan videos, realizing his so-called "heartwarming gestures" had all been staged.

"We've been deceived..." The fan groups echoed with collective anguish.

Fans who had scrimped to buy his albums now felt physically ill.

They desperately searched for counterevidence, only to find each accusation watertight.

Sophia experienced mixed emotions watching this unfold.

She hadn't expected the private investigator to uncover so much damning material.

The victims' decision to come forward now clearly signaled they'd reached their breaking point.

Public opinion shifted instantly.

The attacks previously directed at Sophia now targeted Christopher.

"Someone like this doesn't deserve to be an idol!"

"He should be blacklisted!"

Sophia gently closed her laptop and exhaled deeply.

This battle was hers.
###Chapter 133

The evidence against Christopher Lowell was overwhelming.

Every detail was meticulously documented—dates, locations, names.

Victims came forward with firsthand accounts, sealing his fate in disgrace.

"That bitch Sophia Laurent is ruining Christopher!"

Christopher, locked in a detention cell, remained oblivious to the outside world.

Old cases from years ago resurfaced.

A venomous glint flashed in his eyes.

"Sophia... just you wait."

The scandal prompted more apologies to Sophia.

Her fan count skyrocketed.
###Chapter 134

Richard Lowell nearly passed out from rage.

The conference room at Lowell Entertainment was piled with breach notices from major brands.

Christopher Lowell's scandal was far worse than Nathan Lowell's.

Julian was another A-list actor under their banner with a solid fanbase.

Scarlett Ashcroft.

Sophia had researched her background.

Trained at drama school with solid acting chops, yet only landing minor roles.

Her only viral moment was a cheating scandal where only the boyfriend's blurred back was shown.

Sophia pulled up Scarlett's audition reels.

Even in bit parts, her performances were mesmerizing.

"She's the one." Sophia stepped on the accelerator.

The GPS led to a shabby tenement in the outskirts.

"Who is it?"

"Sophia Laurent from Pearl Group."
###Chapter 135

Sophia Laurent stood before the door and pressed the bell lightly.

Footsteps echoed from inside, followed by a brief pause.

"Who is it?" A clear female voice came through the door.

"It's me, Sophia Laurent."

The sound of a turning lock. A sliver of light revealed a delicate face. Scarlett Ashcroft's brows were slightly furrowed, surprise flashing in her eyes.

"I know about the breach fee." Sophia interrupted. "Just tell me if you're interested."

Scarlett's nails dug unconsciously into the armrest.

Six years ago, she'd signed that contract full of dreams. Now at twenty-four, she'd hit rock bottom in her career.

Sophia's expression didn't flicker.
###Chapter 136

When Scarlett first joined Lowell Entertainment, she was an unknown newcomer.

Her career had hit rock bottom. Brands avoided her due to the scandal of being cheated on. Her agent faced constant rejections.

What was the catch?

"I've seen your work."

The industry was full of actresses like her.

Even Sophia couldn't explain it.

Perhaps she'd immediately envisioned Scarlett as the Empress during their first meeting.

Sophia's exquisite features stood out even among entertainment's most beautiful stars.

Her clear phoenix eyes held undeniable conviction.

"Here's Pearl Group's contract. Review it first."

Scarlett took the document, reading every line carefully.

Sophia waited patiently.

She inhaled deeply. "Ms. Laurent, is this contract genuine?"

Compared to Lowell's predatory terms, this offer seemed too good to be true.

It outlined clear career development and guaranteed annual resources.

The breach fee was shockingly low—only one million, practically symbolic.

Most astonishing was the 50-50 profit split after operational costs—terms reserved for A-list stars.

"Absolutely." Sophia's tone left no room for doubt.

###Chapter 137

Missing this opportunity meant remaining buried at Lowell Entertainment forever.

The breach fee was negligible.

They only lacked proper opportunities.

Payment before working?

She'd thoroughly vetted Scarlett.

The money could be taken, but wouldn't be.

Her heart pounded wildly against her ribs.
###Chapter 138

The Lowell Group headquarters towered in the city's busiest commercial district, its glass facade glittering under the sunlight.

A handful of obscure talents no one remembered.

Julian and Vanessa? Both her discoveries.

Tiffany currently held sway—even executives tread carefully around her.

"Scarlett, know your place!"

"Control your people."
###Chapter 139

Until he'd hooked up with Derek's niece.

For years, Tiffany had bullied them under Derek's protection.

###Chapter 140

In this cutthroat entertainment industry, free lunches were always traps in disguise.

###Chapter 141

Sophia Laurent's features were undeniably exquisite. Yet every time Scarlett Ashcroft saw her, she was clad in a sharply tailored black suit, her hair pulled back in a severe bun, her expression as stern as a judge.

All these years of swallowing her pride had been for her bedridden mother awaiting a kidney.

Melanie clapped a hand over her mouth, her shoulders shaking violently.

The decisive, elite agent had returned.

Scarlett watched Melanie's straightened back and hurried after her with a smile.

The sharp click of high heels echoed across the marble floor.
###Chapter 142

Derek Langley lounged in his oversized leather chair at Lowell Entertainment's general manager office. Tiffany Merouin nestled against him, allowing his rough hands to roam freely over her body.

"Mr. Langley, that Melanie keeps strutting around the office like she owns the place. It's driving me crazy..."

She dragged out the last syllable with saccharine sweetness.

Derek closed his eyes, savoring the sensation of having a beautiful woman in his arms.

He'd once been a mere slaughterhouse assistant. His current position came solely through his cousin's influence as a top executive at headquarters.

With his average looks and short stature, women wouldn't have glanced at him twice before.

Since gaining power, many had thrown themselves at him, but none matched Tiffany's cunning charm.

That would jeopardize not just him, but his cousin who'd secured his promotion.

Playtime aside, he understood these stakes perfectly.

"Actually, no."

Melanie's contemptuous glance swept over Tiffany's disheveled state.

"Those who climb the casting couch always fall eventually. As for you, Derek—nepotism and embezzlement will ruin this company."

For three years, artists' complaints had snowballed toward headquarters, only to be suppressed.

She knew—once contracts expired, Lowell Entertainment would become an empty shell.

Derek's face darkened dangerously.

"Who the hell do you think you are, Melanie? You dare judge me?"

"I'm here to notify you," Melanie straightened her spine, "I'm resigning. Heading to HR now."

Derek's lips twisted into a vicious smile. "Resign? I'll make sure you never work in this industry again."
###Chapter 143

Liam Valdemar learned to ski with astonishing speed. Though young, he possessed remarkable natural talent.

Falling was nothing unusual for him. Each time, he'd quickly pick himself up and continue practicing.

Ethan Valdemar stood by the rink, his gaze never leaving the small figure gliding across the ice.

"Dad, look!" Liam called excitedly, successfully executing a spin.

Ethan's lips curved slightly. "Not bad. Much better than yesterday."

The coach nearby gave a thumbs-up, praising his young student's performance.

The audition room fell into complete silence. All eyes were fixed on the center of the stage. This scene depicted the pivotal moment when Princess Xiao Yuezhen, upon learning of her brother's assassination, made the earth-shattering decision to disguise herself as a man and inherit the throne.

The Xiao imperial lineage had dwindled to only two heirs - the twin siblings Xiao Yuezhen and Xiao Yueqi. With the empress deceased and the emperor on his deathbed, the ambitious feudal lords finally launched their rebellion.

The twins had always resembled each other. With careful makeup, Xiao Yuezhen became the spitting image of Xiao Yueqi. She padded her boots to add height, straightened her posture, and lowered her voice.

The scene's greatest challenge lay in portraying Xiao Yuezhen's simultaneous fear and fortitude. Though raised as a sheltered princess, she had trained in martial arts and scholarship since childhood - now she must summon every ounce of that training.

Director Sheridan had auditioned dozens of actresses. Younger stars could only portray panic, while veteran actresses were too old for the role. Not until Scarlett appeared did he find his true Xiao Yuezhen.

"William Lowell came specifically to apologize?"

She gave a light chuckle. "How extraordinary."

A flicker of discomfort crossed William's face.

"If you require it, I'll apologize right now."

His expression turned earnest. "We were wrong to neglect your feelings before."

Sophia observed his performance in silence.

What new scheme was this?

Interpreting her silence as acquiescence, William pressed on.

"Sophia, I saw those interview videos..."

His face contorted with feigned distress. "I never imagined your adoptive parents treated you so cruelly..."

"Oh." Sophia responded coldly.

Those videos had been an unplanned consequence.

Her original intention was merely to expose Derek Langley's true nature and reveal Emily Lowell's character to the Lowell family.

Emily's placement of Derek in Lowell Entertainment undoubtedly concealed deeper schemes.

She didn't believe a single word of William's hollow concern.

If the Lowells truly cared, they wouldn't have waited until now to show concern.

She hadn't forgotten how Richard Lowell and William had practically wanted to strangle her before.

William continued his act.

"Come home. This time we'll treat you properly."

His eyes brimmed with manufactured hope. "Give us a chance to make amends, won't you?"

Sophia met his expectant gaze and murmured, "Home?"

"Yes, home." William nodded eagerly.

Sophia smiled.

"You're right. It is time to go home. Excuse me."

William's eyes lit up.

"You'll return?"

Finally, he could rid himself of the company's mess.

Had he known it would be this easy, he would have come sooner.

Sophia found his delighted expression laughable.

"Poor memory, William? I'm Mrs. Valdemar now."

William's face froze.

"Sophia, you—"

Sophia opened her car door without hesitation.

"I'm visiting my husband at the sanatorium."

The curve of her lips held no warmth as she spoke.
###Chapter 191

William Lowell stood frozen in place.

Those words had pierced his heart like a blade.

Sophia Laurent's taillights disappeared around the corner, leaving only a wisp of exhaust in their wake.

His fists clenched until his nails bit into his palms.

He was her real brother.

Twenty years of family ties meant nothing compared to a stranger lying in a hospital bed.

He remembered Sophia chasing after him as a child, calling him "big brother" in that sweet voice.

She had been so obedient then.

Sophia's car descended into the underground parking of Valdemar Sanatorium.

She checked her phone after cutting the engine.

A message from Margaret Delaney's doctor: The patient regained consciousness briefly this morning—five minutes.

A faint smile touched Sophia's lips.

The elevator carried her straight to the VIP ward on the top floor.

Patriarch Valdemar looked up from his paperwork at the sound of footsteps.

"Grandfather."

Sophia's voice was bright and clear.

The old man set down his fountain pen, the creases around his eyes softening.

"Perfect timing. The kitchen just finished stewing chicken soup."

Four dishes and a soup waited on the dining table.

Sophia picked up a braised pork rib with her chopsticks. The meat fell apart tenderly at the slightest pressure.

She ate with relish, her cheeks puffing slightly with each bite.

Patriarch Valdemar studied her.

His granddaughter-in-law was more resilient than he'd expected.

"How's work lately?"

Sophia swallowed before answering. "Smooth. The new project launches next week."

She made no mention of the Lowell family.

The old man nodded, his gaze flickering to her flat stomach.

"Alexander woke briefly this morning."

Sophia's chopsticks stilled.

"Did the doctor say he's improving?"

"Yes. His fingers moved."

His tone was measured, but a glimmer of relief shone in his eyes.

Sophia lowered her head over her rice bowl. Her lashes cast shadows across her cheeks.

She pictured the pale man in the hospital bed.

Last time she saw him, his eyelids had fluttered.

Like butterfly wings.

"Margaret was conscious for a while today too."

Patriarch Valdemar's sudden remark made Sophia's head snap up. Her eyes glittered like stars.

"Really? What did she say?"

"She called your name."

Sophia's nose stung.

She ducked her head to sip soup, letting the steam blur her vision.

The meal continued in unusual quiet.

Only the occasional clink of tableware broke the silence.

Sunlight streamed through the window, gilding Sophia's hair.

A golden halo.
###Chapter 192

Sophia Laurent stared at the exquisite dishes on the dining table, but her thoughts drifted to Margaret Delaney's sickbed. Patriarch Valdemar, meanwhile, was weighed down by worries, the recent turmoil at the company leaving him restless.

The aroma of braised pork ribs filled the dining room, the meat so tender it practically melted in the mouth.

The rich scent of wild mushroom chicken soup wafted through the air, while the greens were crisp and fresh enough to snap.

Sophia helped herself to two bowls of rice and finished an entire bowl of soup. Her unpretentious appetite eased the tension in Patriarch Valdemar's brow.

The villa erupted into chaos.

###Chapter 193

Henry Chamberlain exchanged a glance with the butler. Both men frowned simultaneously.

His expression turned solemn. "The Patriarch needs complete rest. Any stress could worsen his condition."

Though the doctor phrased it diplomatically, everyone understood the implication.

A heavy silence fell over the hospital room.

"I'll go," Henry broke the silence.

The butler immediately objected. "No. Without a Valdemar family member present, it'll only fuel speculation. The stock price will plummet further."

Henry massaged his temples. "But we don't have better options right now."

Alexander Valdemar had regained consciousness, but his awareness came and went.

Not to mention his multiple fractures made public appearances impossible.

This press conference had been scheduled when both the Patriarch and Alexander were lucid, meant to stabilize the Valdemar Group's situation.

No one anticipated Vincent Valdemar would provoke the Patriarch into collapsing at this critical juncture.

The Valdemar direct lineage now only included Vincent.

But letting him represent the family? That was laughable.

Vincent was a hopeless incompetent who favored his illegitimate son Sebastian.

Allowing him to speak for Valdemar Holdings would mean surrendering the Patriarch's lifelong work.

Worse still, Vincent's recent phone call clearly had ulterior motives.

If internal chaos erupted, certain parties would exploit the situation.

As the two men reached an impasse, a clear voice interrupted:

"Have you forgotten the family member the Patriarch just acknowledged?"

Sophia Laurent hadn't planned to involve herself in Valdemar affairs.

She intended to leave eventually.

But the Patriarch had treated her well. Since circumstances demanded it, she saw no harm in helping.

Before marrying into the family, she'd done thorough research.

The Patriarch had long retired from frontline operations, with Alexander steering Valdemar Holdings.

Alexander's ironclad principles and fair dealings commanded respect even from industry veterans.

His presence alone kept dissenters in check.

But since his accident, subtle shifts had begun.

Initially, things remained calm.

As time passed, however, probing attempts multiplied.

The family publicly called it a car accident with ongoing treatment.

Yet industry circles already buzzed with rumors of Alexander's vegetative state.

This press conference aimed to restore confidence in Valdemar Holdings.

Stabilizing the stock price would buy time to address internal issues.

But with the Patriarch aging and Alexander's prolonged unconsciousness, the situation would only deteriorate.
###Chapter 194

Undercurrents surged within Valdemar Holdings. Both Patriarch Valdemar and Alexander Valdemar found themselves in precarious positions.

As Alexander's nominal wife, Sophia Laurent was inevitably swept into the turmoil.

Vincent Valdemar, though mediocre in ability, had spent years cultivating loyalists within the corporation. His sudden visit to the sanatorium clearly harbored ulterior motives.

Henry Chamberlain and the butler finally noticed Sophia standing nearby. The clarity in the young woman's voice momentarily brightened their expressions before dimming again.

The press conference concealed unseen dangers, with treacherous questions lurking at every turn. Could this inexperienced girl possibly handle it?

Yet Sophia suspected deeper machinations. Despite the Valdemars' prolonged media blackout, the rumors had only intensified—clear evidence of orchestrated manipulation.

Vincent's earlier conduct unmistakably sought to position Sebastian Valdemar for succession. His timing in provoking the patriarch suggested calculated maneuvers.

This press conference would likely be anything but peaceful.

As a corporate titan, Valdemar Holdings' every move sent ripples through the markets. News of Alexander's car accident had long circulated through business circles.

The press conference venue was packed to capacity, with major media outlets poised for action. When the entourage stepped onto the stage, every lens instantly focused on the center.
###Chapter 195

"Sir, Ms. Laurent truly embodies what a Mrs. Valdemar should be."

"You should have seen how she silenced those reporters—"

"Enough." Alexander's icy tone cut through the air.

He'd watched every second of that press conference.

"...Understood."
###Chapter 205

Henry immediately fell silent when he sensed Alexander's foul mood.

The office plunged into brief silence.

"The press conference exceeded expectations," Henry ventured cautiously. "Those old foxes on the board must be sweating now."

Alexander tapped the desk with his slender fingers, his gaze icy. "Proceed as planned."

"Understood." Henry nodded before adding, "We've made progress in locating Miss Tiffany Morrison. We should have concrete leads within a month."

Alexander's eyes flickered slightly. He merely gave a noncommittal hum.

Memories of that business gala three months ago resurfaced.

Sebastian had drugged him. The hotel surveillance was tampered with. Only a blurry name remained as a clue.

With countless girls named Tiffany Morrison across the country, the search had been painstakingly slow.

Henry sighed inwardly.

Now that Sophia was in the picture, he secretly hoped this search would lead nowhere.

Sophia was not only exceptionally capable but also utterly devoted to Alexander.

Her willingness to enter a therapeutic marriage with the Valdemars spoke volumes about her sincerity.

"Mrs. Valdemar is at the sanatorium visiting the Patriarch," Henry probed. "Shall I ask her to join you?"

Alexander's mind flashed to Sophia sneaking a touch on his face earlier.

"Unnecessary." His tone came out stiffer than intended.

Henry's eyebrows shot up in surprise.

That reaction... seemed unusually intense?

"I'll check on the Patriarch then." Henry tactfully changed the subject, then added indignantly, "Your father did show up at the press conference today. Thankfully Madam intervened in time."

Alexander's expression darkened instantly. "Don't mention him."

"Right, right." Henry forced a conciliatory smile. "I'll go find Madam now."

Alexander said nothing.
###Chapter 206

The word "Mrs. Valdemar" from Henry Chamberlain echoed relentlessly in Alexander Valdemar's mind.

Sophia Laurent's poised figure under the flashing cameras lingered in his thoughts.

He rubbed his temples, forcing himself to focus elsewhere.

The greedy face of Vincent Valdemar surfaced before him.

The temperature in the hospital room seemed to plummet.

Meanwhile, Sophia had arrived at Patriarch Valdemar's ward.

After Vincent's earlier outburst, the old man looked visibly weaker.

He reclined against the pillows, staring blankly out the window.

"Grandfather, are you feeling better?"

Sophia's bright voice cut through the sterile silence like sunlight.

The Patriarch turned slowly, his clouded eyes finally focusing.

"Sophia..." His voice was hoarse.

She quickly poured him a glass of warm water.

The butler standing nearby exhaled in quiet relief.

The old man had been silent since waking—until Sophia appeared.

With the water, some color returned to the Patriarch's face.

"Thank you for today."

Sophia shook her head, her eyes crinkling. "We're family."

She remembered all his kindness—from arranging Margaret Clementson's care to defending her against the Lowells.

This man had given her the warmth of kinship she'd never known.

The Patriarch froze.

"Family" was a foreign concept in the Valdemar household.

Vincent drowned himself in debauchery. Victor Valdemar was lost in his art.

The Valdemars glittered on the surface but were ice beneath.

Looking at this radiant young woman, he felt an unfamiliar warmth in his chest.

"Yes. We're family."

His sons were disappointments, but at least the younger generation held promise.

Though even they kept him at arm's length.
###Chapter 207

Special Treatment

Patriarch Valdemar lay on the hospital bed, gazing absently at the sunlight streaming through the window.

Sophia Laurent pushed the door open gently, carrying a fresh bouquet of lilies.

"Grandfather, the doctor said your fainting spell was mainly due to emotional stress." She arranged the flowers in the vase by the bedside. "A few days of rest, and you'll be discharged."

The old man turned his head, his expression softening.

In the entire Valdemar family, only Sophia addressed him as "Grandfather" so naturally—without a trace of flattery or fear.

"Hmm." His voice was gentler than usual.

The faint floral scent filled the room. Suddenly, Patriarch Valdemar sat up straighter.

"Sophia, I want you to temporarily take over as CEO of Valdemar Holdings."

Her hands, adjusting the flower stems, stilled.

"Me?"

She recalled her promise at the press conference—merely a stopgap measure to stabilize the stock price.

Valdemar Holdings was teeming with talent. The board alone had over a dozen elites. An outsider like her would never be the logical choice.

The old man's eyes burned with conviction. "You."

A rare smile smoothed the wrinkles at the corners of his eyes.

"I believe you're capable."

Sophia pressed her lips together.

She was carrying Alexander's child. Divorce was inevitable. Taking over Valdemar would only complicate things.

But with internal strife and Vincent Valdemar circling like a vulture, the family patriarch genuinely needed help.

"I..."

Seeing her hesitation, he sighed.

"If it's too much, forget it. I'll find another solution."

The resignation in his voice tugged at her heart.

"I can assist temporarily."

With Oliver Granger managing Pearl Group, she only needed to sign off periodically. Helping Valdemar weather the storm shouldn't be an issue.

Consider it repayment for the old man's kindness these past months.

When Alexander woke, this goodwill might smooth the divorce proceedings.

"Excellent!" His eyes brightened. "I'll have HR issue the notice immediately."

He paused, then added, "Come to me anytime you need guidance."

Sophia nodded.

Once committed, she would give it her all.

The patriarch studied her decisive demeanor, satisfaction growing.

Such a remarkable woman. Why couldn't she have been born a Valdemar?

After he drifted off, Sophia visited Margaret's room.

Dr. George Whitmore was just leaving.

"Ms. Laurent." The doctor adjusted his glasses. "Your patient is showing signs of regaining consciousness."

Her heart skipped.

"Truly?"

She'd worked tirelessly to treat Margaret—not just out of gratitude, but because the woman held the complete truth about the switched identities.
###Chapter 208

Dr. George Whitmore adjusted his glasses. "Spending more time talking to her could help with the awakening."

"Understood."

Sophia Laurent nodded in gratitude. As she turned to leave, she paused.

She bit her lip. "How is Alexander... doing?"

Dr. Whitmore's gaze flickered. "His brain condition is stable. Other injuries are being handled by specialists."

Sophia's fingers trembled slightly.

The answer couldn't be clearer—he was still unconscious.

Leaving the consultation room, Sophia lingered in the hallway before inexplicably heading toward the VIP ward.

Just a post-meal stroll, she told herself. And perhaps a glance at that breathtaking face.

"Madam!" A bodyguard's surprised voice called from behind.

Frowning, Sophia pushed the door open.

On the hospital bed, Alexander Valdemar instantly shut his eyes at the sound of movement.

His tall frame lay motionless, encased in plaster. The overhead light cast delicate shadows across his sharply defined features.

Sophia narrowed her eyes.

His complexion seemed rosier than last week?

When she'd last seen him, his handsome face had been nearly translucent with pallor. Now, a healthy flush tinted his skin, making his striking features even more mesmerizing.

"Tsk." She couldn't help murmuring. "If this were ancient times, you'd have caused wars between royal consorts."

Alexander's breath hitched.

The sweet scent of gardenias and freesia enveloped him, sparking an absurd realization—

Was she... just after his looks?

The Valdemar genes had always been exceptional, and he'd inherited the best from both parents. In his youth, this face had brought endless trouble before eventually becoming a symbol that struck fear in others.

Lost in thought, he heard her soft sigh again. "Wake up soon..."

The trailing note carried an indescribable melancholy.

If this dragged on much longer, she'd have to discuss divorce with the Patriarch.

After all, her baby bump was becoming harder to conceal.
###Chapter 209

Sophia Laurent wanted to discuss the divorce face-to-face with Alexander Valdemar.

Alexander listened to her soft sigh, his emotions in turmoil.

Was she truly this eager for him to wake up?

He could tell her he was already conscious.

But the master strategist found himself at a loss when facing Sophia.

Maintaining this marriage was currently the most advantageous move for Valdemar Holdings.

A sudden divorce would not only crash stock prices but also shake investor confidence.

Alexander clenched his fists, never before so desperate to recover.

Unaware, Sophia continued speaking.

"Grandfather asked me to temporarily assume the role of CEO. You owe him for this favor..."

A dozen compensation plans flashed through Alexander's mind.

He couldn't give her love.

But materially, she would want for nothing.

After rambling a while longer, Sophia stood to leave.

"I'm visiting Grandfather now. Rest well."

Her footsteps faded.

The moment before the door closed, Alexander opened his eyes.

He stared at her retreating figure with profound intensity.

After leaving the hospital, Sophia visited Margaret Delaney.

That evening, she dined with Patriarch Valdemar before being driven back to Westmount Villa.

"Your official appointment begins tomorrow. Get some rest tonight."

Sophia nodded obediently.

The appointment notice had been circulated company-wide.

At dawn, Henry Chamberlain arrived in high spirits.

After breakfast, he personally drove Sophia to Valdemar Holdings' headquarters.

The glass skyscraper stood imposingly in the CBD district, its facade glittering in the morning light.

News of the leadership change had caused an uproar.

Shareholders exchanged uneasy glances during the morning meeting.

When Sophia entered the conference room, all eyes turned toward her.

Dressed in a crisp black suit with her hair in a severe bun, she cut an imposing figure.

"I'm Sophia Laurent, acting CEO."

Before she finished speaking, Director Huang slammed the table.

"A mere girl presuming to lead Valdemar?"

Others chimed in: "Can you even read financial statements? Don't embarrass yourself!"

"Resign now. This isn't some playground."

Sophia took her seat with unshaken composure.

"I won't step down until Alexander wakes up."

She met Director Huang's gaze directly. "Mind your language."

Then she scanned the room. "If anyone has business concerns, voice them now."
###Chapter 210

Chairman Huang's greasy face turned beet red in the boardroom.

He slammed his hands on the table and pointed at Sophia Laurent. "Who the hell do you think you are? How dare you lecture us?"

Sophia calmly adjusted her cuffs without even looking up.

"Mind your blood pressure, Chairman Huang."

Her casual remark only enraged him further.

"Since when does a woman run Valdemar Group?" He sneered. "Go home and take care of your kids!"

The shareholders exchanged uneasy glances. The air grew thick with tension.

Sophia suddenly smiled.

She slid a document to the center of the table.

"The Eden Project. Chairman Huang's responsibility."

The first page revealed staggering red numbers.

"Eight billion budget. One-year timeline." Sophia tapped the table. "Three billion over budget. Six months behind schedule. Only 50% completion."

Beads of sweat formed on Huang's forehead.

"Market fluctuations—"

"Really?" Sophia cut him off. "Then why was the contract awarded to your nephew's shell company?"

Gasps filled the room.

Shareholders passed the document around, their expressions darkening.

"More interesting," Sophia produced another file, "four billion additional funds were approved during Alexander's coma."

Her gaze turned razor-sharp.

"Where did that money really go?"

Huang shot up, his chair screeching across the floor.

"You're slandering me!"

Sophia pressed a remote.

Projected images showed Huang's nephew's new mansion and luxury cars.

"Three million dollar villa. Two limited edition sports cars." She smirked. "Business must be booming."

The room erupted.

"Huang Yousheng! You think we're fools?"

"No wonder you kept delaying progress reports!"

Huang's face turned ashen. His legs trembled.

Sophia stood, looking down at him.

"Now. Explain yourself."
###Chapter 211

"The Eden Project at Riverside Plaza was highly coveted by numerous competitors. Our company exerted tremendous effort to secure it." Sophia Laurent tapped her slender fingers lightly on the conference table. "Mr. Huang, is this how you embezzle company funds?"

Beads of sweat formed on Huang Yousheng's forehead.

"Don't listen to her nonsense," he forced a dry laugh. "Construction delays are common. Every project encounters unexpected issues."

"Unexpected?" A shareholder slammed the table and stood. "A year and a half, and less than half is completed. Is that just an 'issue'?"

Another shareholder smirked. "The real surprise is that the contractor happens to be your nephew, isn't it?"

The room erupted in murmurs.

Several senior shareholders exchanged glances before speaking slowly. "Huang Yousheng, you misappropriated company funds while Mr. Valdemar was in a coma. Now you're obstructing Ms. Laurent's appointment—afraid the truth will come out?"

"Ms. Laurent graduated from a prestigious university and built her own company from scratch. Her competence is undeniable."

"What exactly is your motive for making things difficult for her?"

These veterans who had fought alongside Patriarch Valdemar now stood firmly behind Sophia.

Huang Yousheng paled but managed a strained smile. "Give me six more months. I guarantee completion."

The shareholders hesitated.

Then Sophia's cool voice cut through the tension. "I'm afraid that won't be possible, Mr. Huang."

She raised her phone, displaying a police investigation notice on the screen.

"You're suspected of occupational embezzlement. The authorities have already launched an inquiry." Her gaze swept across the room. "Pending investigation, you are hereby suspended from all duties."

Silence fell over the conference room.

Every eye was fixed on the composed young woman in astonishment.
###Chapter 212

The business world is a battlefield where no one dares show their hand too soon.

Sophia Laurent had barely arrived at Valdemar Holdings when she stirred up a storm. Her audacity turned heads.

Didn't she know the consequences of making enemies?

The Valdemar Group was riddled with factions. By targeting Raymond Huang, she risked setting off a chain reaction.

Raymond Huang stood frozen, his fingers trembling slightly.

"You want to take over the Eden Project?"

Sophia remained calm, her gaze sharp. "Correct. Until the police complete their investigation into the missing 1.1 billion, I'll be overseeing it."

She paused, then added, "Don't worry, Mr. Huang. Your personal freedom won't be restricted during the inquiry."

Raymond's face darkened instantly.

"Sophia! Do you realize you're playing with fire?"

A faint smile touched Sophia's lips.

"You misunderstand, Mr. Huang. I'm simply following protocol."

"Those who truly care about Valdemar will welcome this. After all..."

Her eyes swept the room. "No one wants parasites eating away at our collective interests, do they?"

A vein throbbed in Raymond's forehead.

"I can provide full accounting records! Don't let this little girl deceive you—"

Sophia chuckled softly.

"Such resistance to a professional audit... Is there something you're hiding, Mr. Huang?"

The boardroom fell silent.

Several shareholders who had been ready to defend Raymond quietly stepped back.

The Eden Project had an 800 million budget. Seven hundred million had been spent, yet less than half the work was completed. After Alexander Valdemar's coma, another 400 million was injected.

The irregularities were obvious.

But what truly unsettled them was this seemingly delicate woman's preparedness.

Sophia had studied dossiers on every key Valdemar executive until dawn.

She knew every shareholder in that room intimately.

Raymond Huang was merely her first warning shot.

With Patriarch Valdemar aging and Alexander comatose, oversight had slipped.

The Eden Project was the biggest loophole.

And Raymond Huang had walked right into her crosshairs.

"This is slander!" Raymond turned desperately to the other shareholders. "Someone speak sense here!"
###Chapter 213

"You're letting this little girl kick me out today? You'll regret this."

Most shareholders had already sided with Sophia Laurent.

If Raymond Huang was truly innocent, why was he so panicked?

Several shareholders who had previously supported Sophia now spoke up with pleasant smiles.

"Raymond, consider it a short vacation. The project will still be yours once the investigation concludes."

"Exactly. As long as the funds check out, you'll remain in charge."

Raymond Huang listened to their seemingly supportive yet firm insistence on the investigation, his chest tightening with rage.

His gaze darkened as he glared at Sophia, eyes glinting with malice.

"Do you know who I am?"

"I was building this empire with Patriarch Valdemar when you were still playing in the mud!"

Sophia's smile vanished, her aura turning razor-sharp.

"I am currently the acting CEO of Valdemar Holdings, with full authority over all company matters."

She met his glare without flinching. "Until the police investigation is complete, Mr. Huang, you are on leave."

Her clear, decisive tone cut through the room like a blade, sending a chill down everyone's spine.

For a moment, the shareholders saw a glimpse of Alexander when he first took the reins—
relentless and fearless.

The young couple shared the same commanding presence.

After security escorted Raymond Huang out, no one dared challenge Sophia again.

The meeting proceeded smoothly as department heads delivered their reports.

Henry Chamberlain watched the orderly proceedings with quiet surprise.

He had expected a bloodbath today.

Yet Sophia had struck at the heart of the matter with precision.

No wonder she had meticulously reviewed the shareholder profiles yesterday.

What he assumed was routine preparation turned out to be a calculated move—
taking down the loudest troublemaker first.

Though a minor player, Raymond's dismissal sent a clear warning to the old foxes.

Henry's gaze lingered on the composed young woman at the head of the table, admiration swelling in his chest.

No wonder Patriarch Valdemar had chosen her as his heir's wife.

Her effortless poise—confident yet understated—was nothing short of awe-inspiring.

The meeting stretched from dawn until midday.

Sophia reviewed every report before closing the session with a final nod.
###Chapter 214

After the meeting, Henry Chamberlain escorted Sophia Laurent to Alexander Valdemar's office.

Sophia knew the rumors but had never met him in person.

###Chapter 216
