"What kind of CEO is she? You're the executive assistant, second only to my brother in the company. Why listen to her?"

Suppressing a laugh at his outburst, Henry said, "She is my direct superior now, appointed by the Patriarch himself. Maybe... you should take it up with him?"

Adrian rolled his eyes. "If I dared approach the Patriarch, would I be here begging you?"

"Then what?" Henry spread his hands. "I have to follow her orders unless I want to lose my job. You understand."

Adrian gritted his teeth. "That woman is ruthless."

Suddenly, his eyes lit up. "How about... you lend me some money?"

Henry sighed. "Young Master, you overestimate me. If I had two million in savings, why would I still be working?"

Adrian looked shocked. "My brother pays you that little?"

Henry chuckled. "Young Master, my annual salary is already top-tier in the industry. It's just that your financial perspective differs from ordinary people's."

This sheltered young master could casually squander two million on a breach fee—what did he know about the struggles of earning money?

After a long silence, Adrian finally said, "Forget it. I'll figure it out myself."

At worst, he'd just finish filming that awful drama.

So what if people mocked him?

As Henry watched Adrian leave, an inexplicable pang of sympathy struck him.

He shook his head.

An illusion. It had to be.

How could this pampered young master possibly be pitiable?

Still...

Was cutting off his financial support really the right move?

The kid did seem genuinely distressed...

After all these years in the entertainment industry, he'd gained nothing but infamy...

Henry lingered at the door for a moment before knocking on Sophia Laurent's office again.

Inside, Sophia was browsing through Adrian's gossip headlines.

The more she read, the more appalled she became.

Compared to other wealthy heirs like Nathan Lowell and Christopher Lowell, Adrian's reputation was abysmal.

The internet mercilessly mocked him:

"Worst actor alive."

"More temper than talent."

"Professional diva."

"Plastic-faced pretty boy."

The most ridiculous was the plastic surgery rumor.

With the Valdemar family's impeccable genes, surgeons probably used their features as reference models.

What surprised her most was that despite the relentless criticism, Adrian had never once flaunted his family background.

In the entertainment world, he was notorious for:

Assaulting reporters.

Envying peers with fans.

Sabotaging others' fan events.

In short, his name was synonymous with scandal.
###Chapter 221

Adrian Valdemar's acting clips went viral online.

Those exaggerated memes were wildly shared by netizens.

His wide-eyed and pouty screenshots were captioned with hilarious texts.

The comment section was flooded with laughter.

Sophia Laurent tapped her fingers on the desk, staring at the computer screen.

Adrian's career history gave her a headache—five years in the industry with zero notable works.

Yet his scandals piled up like a mountain.

A knock interrupted her thoughts.

Henry Chamberlain entered just as she switched the computer screen.

"Madam."

"What is it?"

Henry hesitated. "About the young master's allowance... Mr. Valdemar never interfered before."

Sophia frowned slightly. "Suspend it for now."

The Valdemars could certainly afford it, but Adrian's behavior had crossed the line.

Henry took the hint and excused himself.

The office fell silent again as Sophia continued reviewing Adrian's file.

In the entertainment circle, Adrian was infamous as a playboy.

He changed girlfriends more frequently than his clothes—from influencers to D-list celebrities, none were spared.

Those million-dollar watches and limited-edition sports cars served as his best "calling cards."

Though ridiculed online, Adrian earned a notorious nickname in the industry—"The Generous Casanova."

His lavish breakup settlements kept his exes from badmouthing him.

Sophia opened the shooting schedule for "Love You Forever."

Coincidentally, it was filmed at the same studio as "Empress."

She closed her laptop, deciding to visit the set tomorrow.

The stack of documents on her desk reminded her of Valdemar Group's backlog.

With the aging Patriarch Valdemar, many matters had been neglected.

Sophia picked up the top report and began reviewing it meticulously.

Meanwhile, Henry was en route to the sanatorium.

He clutched the surveillance footage copied from the security room.

The recording showed Adrian's arrogant demeanor, making Henry shake his head.

Though the Patriarch ruled with an iron fist, Alexander had always indulged his younger brother.

Henry needed to report this in advance to avoid future misunderstandings.

The crisp sound of a slap echoed sharply from the video.

Henry couldn't help but wince—Madam's strike was merciless.
###Chapter 222

Henry Chamberlain pushed open the doors of Valdemar Sanatorium.

Patriarch Valdemar sat by the floor-to-ceiling windows, enjoying his lunch.

Sunlight streamed through the glass, illuminating the dining table. The old man picked up a piece of braised pork and chewed slowly.

He already knew everything about the company's recent developments.

He had thought Sophia Laurent would barely manage against the cunning old foxes.

But she hadn't just survived—she'd turned the tables and taken control of the company.

A flawless victory.

As for her management skills, time would tell.

Her boldness and strategy had impressed him.

His spirits had visibly improved. He'd already asked for two extra servings.

"Henry, you're here?" The patriarch set down his chopsticks with a smile.

Seeing the healthy flush on the old man's face, Henry exhaled in relief.

It had been a long time since the patriarch looked this content—not since Alexander's accident.

They chatted about company affairs for a while. Then, after hesitating, Henry brought up Adrian.

"Sir, there's something I need to report."

He recounted Adrian's harassment of Sophia at the office, including every arrogant word.

He even played the surveillance footage from his phone.

Adrian's lewd behavior was unmistakable.

The patriarch's expression darkened instantly.

"That disgrace!"

His chopsticks slammed onto the table, rattling the dishes.

"Skipping business school to become an actor! Years in the industry with nothing to show for it, and now he's picked up his father's womanizing ways!"

His beard trembled with rage. "Good! Alexander spoiled him rotten!"

Henry remained silent.

The young master was indeed outrageous. Fooling around was one thing, but drugging his own brother?

All because he "couldn't stand seeing his brother live like a eunuch."

If it were up to Henry, he'd have broken the boy's legs long ago.

Adrian had fled abroad that very night, clearly guilty.

No one could have predicted Alexander's sudden accident.

Still fuming, the patriarch stormed into the adjacent hospital room.

Alexander lay motionless on the bed, his breathing steady.

"Look what your indulgence has done!"

The patriarch jabbed a finger at the bed. "Every time I tried to discipline him, you stopped me! Now he's harassing your wife!"

"Thank God she has sense and put him in his place. Otherwise, that brat would've gone completely out of control!"

His shouts echoed through the room, met only by the steady beep of the heart monitor.

Exhausted, the patriarch finally left.

Once the footsteps faded, Henry cleared his throat. "Mr. Valdemar, he's gone."

The man on the bed opened his eyes.

His dark gaze was sharp as a blade. The temperature in the room seemed to drop.

"Explain."

Henry repeated the incident and handed over his phone.

Watching Adrian's crude behavior, Alexander's brow furrowed.

When he heard the vulgar remarks, his expression turned stormy.

His brother was long overdue for discipline.
###Chapter 223

Alexander's gaze turned icy as he watched the surveillance footage.

The audacious young man in the video had dared to disrespect his wife.

Even after being rejected, the fool persisted with threats and harassment.

Utter lawlessness.

His attention shifted to the woman wielding a leather belt.

Her tailored suit was immaculate, every hair perfectly in place.

The way she swung the belt was precise and graceful, exuding a lethal elegance.

Alexander arched an eyebrow.

He was accustomed to delicate socialites, not this kind of formidable woman.

It was... intriguing.

But Adrian's pained screams snapped him back to reality.

Though troublesome, this younger brother was his responsibility.

Vincent Valdemar had been a philandering father who neglected his lawful wife and heir.

His mother, shattered by betrayal, succumbed to mental illness.

Sweet as honey in her lucid moments, but a raving lunatic during episodes.

His childhood echoed with paternal indifference and maternal hysteria.

At least he'd tasted fleeting maternal warmth.

Adrian... had never been wanted.

Alexander still remembered that stormy night - his mother's hands around the infant's throat.

He'd fought desperately to save that tiny life.

His reasoning had been simple - a brother would ease the loneliness.

With the Patriarch preoccupied by business, Adrian became his charge.

Perhaps his indulgence had fostered such recklessness.

"Mr. Valdemar..." Henry ventured cautiously, "Madam already gave Young Master Adrian a chance."

Alexander shot him a glacial look.

"Too much free time?"

Henry awkwardly rubbed his nose.

He'd expected outrage from this notorious brother-protector, not this calm detachment.

Alexander forwarded the video to his phone and tossed the device aside.

The frozen image showed Sophia mid-lash.

That striking poise lingered in his mind.
###Chapter 224

Henry Chamberlain's ears burned under Alexander Valdemar's questioning. His fingers unconsciously fiddled with his suit cuff.

"Ahem..." He cleared his throat. "I was just curious... How do you feel about Madam disciplining Young Master Adrian?"

Alexander's knuckles rapped twice on the desk.

What could he say?

Adrian Valdemar needed discipline.

Yet his grip on the fountain pen tightened slightly at the sound of those pained cries.

"Let her be."

"Make it happen."

Sophia Laurent handed the last document to her assistant as the clock struck noon.

She rubbed her aching lower back and dialed her driver.

The Tangcheng Film Studio pass rustled softly in her bag.

The set of "Love You Forever" was located at the western edge of the studio.

Under the scorching sun, Sophia stood beneath a tree with her parasol.

A shrill reprimand pierced the air.

"Are you made of wood? Can't even play a spoiled rich kid properly?"

The female director in a floral shirt waved her script wildly. "Even extras act better than you!"

Adrian's dress shirt clung to his sweat-drenched back.

His lips pressed into a thin line, lashes casting delicate shadows in the sunlight.

Sophia's fingertip swiped across her phone screen.

A red recording light blinked to life.

The director suddenly hurled a water bottle at him.

"Again! One more screw-up and you're fired!"

The bottle grazed Adrian's temple before exploding against the concrete in a burst of water.

Sophia narrowed her eyes.

She watched as the young man silently bent to retrieve the bottle and walked toward the trash can.
###Chapter 225

The studio lights glared harshly.

Adrian Valdemar stood before the camera, beads of sweat forming at his temples.

The female director's furious voice echoed across the set. "Cut! Adrian, you're playing a spineless coward, not some martyr with unbreakable pride!"

The clapperboard snapped shut again.

This scene required the male lead to defend the female lead by confronting Adrian's character—a spoiled rich kid.

The script demanded Adrian grovel after being hit.

Yet his eyes still burned with defiance.

"Useless!" The director hurled her script to the ground. "How dare you call yourself an actor? Go home and play the young master where you belong!"

The set fell deathly silent.

Sophia Laurent stood in the shadows, her brow furrowed.

"I'm Adrian's legal guardian." Sophia stepped forward. "Why are you singling him out?"

Director Chen narrowed her eyes.

Her gaze raked over Sophia's tailored suit and striking features before smirking. "Ah, the sugar mommy finally shows up."

Whispers rippled through the crew.

"I'm his legal sister." Sophia's gaze turned razor-sharp. "Though I'm curious—if Adrian's acting is so terrible, why cast him at all?"

Director Chen's expression faltered.

Sophia advanced like a predator. "Using his fame for publicity while making him your punching bag? Clever scheme."

Crew members exchanged uneasy glances.

Someone muttered, "No wonder he gets so much hate..."

Director Chen flushed with rage. "He's terrible and you expect me to pretend otherwise?"

"Coaching actors is your job." Sophia's smile chilled the air. "Or can you only direct by screaming to hide your incompetence?"

The atmosphere turned glacial.

Adrian stood frozen, his knuckles whitening around clenched fists.

He never expected Sophia to appear.

Least of all to defend him.
###Chapter 226

Director Chen's spittle sprayed across Adrian Valdemar's face.

"Your acting is worse than a block of wood!" she shrieked, veins bulging in her neck. "You're dragging down the entire production!"

Adrian clenched his fists. His nails dug crescent moons into his palms.

He bit down hard on his lower lip, swallowing every retort.

Sophia Laurent observed the spectacle from the sidelines, her expression glacial.

She saw right through Director Chen's ploy—using Adrian's scandal to promote this low-budget drama.

"Quite the performance, Director." Sophia's stilettos clicked against the floor as she strode forward. Every head turned.

Director Chen's face paled. "And you are—"

Adrian's head snapped up. His eyes widened in disbelief.

Had she lost her mind? Since when was he her boy?

The air turned leaden.

"Preposterous!" Director Chen's voice cracked. "Leave the set immediately! You're disrupting—"

Hadn't this woman refused to pay his breach fee just yesterday?

"Don't worry." Sophia pulled out her phone. "Valdemar's legal team will handle the paperwork."

Her eyes narrowed. "Though I wonder if that figure would hold up in court."

All color drained from Director Chen's face.

No low-budget contract could withstand that level of scrutiny.
###Chapter 227

Director Chen's face darkened instantly, his fingers tightening around the script's edge.

"The breach fee is clearly stated in black and white. What's there to question?"

Sophia Laurent didn't even spare him a glance, striding straight toward Adrian Valdemar.

Adrian instinctively took half a step back, his Adam's apple bobbing nervously.

"W-what do you want?"

Sophia arched an eyebrow at his cowardly display, a teasing smirk playing on her lips.

"So jumpy? Afraid I'll devour you?"

Adrian stiffened his neck in defiance. "Don't be ridiculous!"

He inched backward again as he spoke.

"Freeze."

Sophia's expression suddenly turned icy. "I'll count to three. Take one more step and see what happens."

Adrian immediately rooted to the spot.

"Good boy."

Sophia nodded approvingly. "Just answer me this—how much are they paying you for this role?"

Adrian scratched his head. "Uh... twenty-eight thousand?"

The set fell dead silent.

Sophia nearly laughed in disbelief.

A top-tier celebrity taking chump change for a gig?

Even with Adrian's tarnished reputation, his star power was undeniable. A single tweet from him could trend for days.

The "Love You Forever" crew was clearly taking him for a fool.

Crew members exchanged uneasy glances. Even the greenest newcomers earned more than Adrian.

Two million in breach fees?

This was outright robbery.

Sophia turned to Director Chen with a knowing smile.

"Quite the scheme you've got, Director Chen."

She delivered the final blow leisurely. "Scam a few more artists into breaching contracts, and you won't even need box office revenue, huh?"

Director Chen's face cycled through shades of green and white.

Adrian remained frozen in place, dumbfounded.

"What are you waiting for? Let's go."

Adrian hesitated, glancing at the cameras.

"Seriously? We can just leave?"

Sophia grabbed his wrist decisively.

"Follow me."

Director Chen stomped his foot in fury.

"Adrian! You haven't finished today's scenes!"

Sophia didn't bother turning around as she waved dismissively.

"Twenty-eight thousand isn't worthy of Mr. Valdemar's acting caliber."

Director Chen screeched after them, "I'll expose you both on social media!"

Adrian suddenly spun around.

"Be my guest."

He flashed a roguish grin. "Don't forget to tag me. I'll give you a like."
###Chapter 228

Sophia Laurent ignored Director Chen's threats and strode away without looking back.

Adrian Valdemar hesitated on the spot.

Over the years, he'd grown accustomed to being mocked by the entire internet...

But who enjoyed being constantly criticized?

Seeing Sophia show no intention of stopping, he reluctantly followed.

Whatever!

One more humiliation wouldn't kill him.

Though he detested this woman, her earlier defense of him had been... unexpectedly impressive.

Not that he'd ever thank her for it.

If she hadn't interfered, he could've just paid the penalty and left.

If Alexander were awake, he wouldn't have made such a fuss over trivial matters...

"Do you enjoy acting?"

Sophia's voice snapped him out of his thoughts.

They'd reached a quiet corner.

Her expression was serious, gaze focused.

Adrian scowled. "None of your business."

Sophia frowned.

"If you love something, give it your all."

His lips twitched.

How did these two strangers share the same lecturing tone?

He rolled his eyes. "Who says I'm not serious?"

Sophia said nothing.

Memories of his cringe-worthy acting compilations flooded her mind.

As much as she wanted to defend him, Adrian's acting skills were... objectively terrible.

Sophia studied him closely.

Adrian bore sixty-percent resemblance to Alexander, both sharing those captivating peach-blossom eyes.

But Alexander's gaze carried authority that commanded respect.

Adrian's eyes shimmered with naive innocence—when he wasn't wearing that insufferable smirk.

With such features, he should've been beloved.

How had things gone so wrong?

His current attitude provided the answer.

This young master did as he pleased in the industry, with no management to rein him in.

"Which agency represents you?"

Adrian's arrogant expression froze.

"Why do you care?"

Sophia chuckled darkly.

"Adrian Valdemar, asking for punishment?"

She picked up a wooden stick from the flowerbed, testing its weight.

"Do you need a beating to cooperate?"

Adrian's eyes widened at the makeshift weapon.
###Chapter 229

Adrian Valdemar stumbled back two steps, his Adam's apple bobbing. "Do you have violent tendencies? Hitting people at the drop of a hat—what kind of lady behaves like that?"

Sophia Laurent's lips curved slightly. "Lady-like behavior?"

She weighed the wooden stick in her hand. "Ready to answer my questions properly now?"

Adrian rolled his eyes in defeat. "No agency."

Several entertainment companies had approached him, but their gazes made his skin crawl.

Those agents' greedy eyes when they stared at his face resembled starving wolves spotting fresh meat.

Though unafraid, he refused to work with such people.

Even with his current online backlash, offers still poured in.

No wonder his career was in shambles.

"Who handles your red carpet looks?"
"Who manages crisis PR?"
"Who buries negative热搜?"

"Narcissism is a disease."

Sophia massaged her temples: "..."

"Impressive."

This young master's showbiz approach was truly primitive.

Adrian sneered: "Why would I need that trash? I can roast ten haters single-handedly."

"Damn right."

Now she understood why even his god-tier looks couldn't gain fans.

With his venomous tongue,任性 attitude, and unfiltered persona, he was a walking entertainment industry disaster.

Young Master Valdemar's situation was worse than she'd imagined.

"What's the point of these pointless questions?" Adrian frowned impatiently.

"Will Valdemar Group really cover my breach fee for 'Fleeting Love'?"

That was his only concern now.

Sophia nodded. "My word is bond."

Valdemar's legal team would handle it personally.
###Chapter 230

Adrian Valdemar finally relaxed when Sophia Laurent gave in.

He snorted coldly. "At least you know your place."

If not for worrying about how to explain things to his elder brother when he woke up, he would have cut ties with this woman long ago.

Adrian turned to leave.

"Wait."

Sophia's voice made him pause.

He turned back warily. "Looking for another fight? I won't let you win this time."

The spacious corridor gave him confidence to escape if needed.

"Obviously." Adrian didn't hesitate. "You're vicious, cruel, and downright poisonous—"

Sophia narrowed her eyes, tapping the rod against her palm.

"Care to repeat that?"

Adrian immediately shut up.

The welts from this morning's beating still ached faintly.

This woman was practically a violent maniac.

When they first met, he'd mistaken her for some delicate little flower.

Turned out she was a thorny, aggressive predator.

Now just looking at Sophia made his whole body ache.

"I own an entertainment company. I want to sign you."

She'd been about to promise him top-tier resources.

But this idiot wouldn't even let her finish.

Adrian lifted his chin arrogantly.

"I'll take a few acting roles."

Sophia burst out laughing.

"What decent scripts would come looking for you?" She didn't mince words. "Don't tell me it's another fourth male lead in some cheap web drama like 'Love You Forever'?"

Not that she looked down on Adrian.

With his controversial reputation and cringe-worthy acting skills, no serious production would cast him.

Those offering roles just wanted to cash in on his notoriety.
###Chapter 231

Adrian Valdemar's face darkened instantly after hearing Sophia Laurent's words.

He gritted his teeth. "Who made that rule? I can do more than just idol dramas. I can handle spy thrillers, fantasy epics—"

In idol dramas, he played minor roles. In spy thrillers, he was cast as sleazy villains. In fantasy epics, he ended up as the comic relief.

Empress and Imperial Feast were the two hottest productions right now.

Empress was a prestige production. The role of the Young Marquis was complex—a spoiled nobleman who indulged in hedonism until tragedy forced him to grow into a war hero.

The character's dramatic arc demanded serious acting chops.

More importantly, the script specified the actor had to be breathtakingly handsome.

Director Lucas Sheridan had auditioned countless actors without finding the right fit. Fans had even started online polls about it.

"I'm serious," Sophia said. "Your looks are perfect for this role."

Adrian's face was undeniably striking.

Though he'd taken acting classes, he'd never quite grasped the craft.

Playing shallow roles in cheesy romances was one thing. A production like Empress? Unthinkable.
###Chapter 232

Sophia's eyebrows arched slightly at Adrian's evasiveness.

The young master actually had some self-awareness.

"Knowing your shortcomings means you should work to improve them, not run away." Her tone turned stern. "What future can you have by wasting your days like this?"

She sounded just like his eldest brother.

"Forget about 'Empress.' I'm leaving."

The upcoming historical drama was already the hottest project in the industry before filming even began.

Every veteran actor and A-lister was fighting for a role.

The girls he'd known before would laugh at anything he said.

Had his jokes really been that cruel all along?
###Chapter 233

###Chapter 234

Adrian Valdemar had lived in shadows for as long as he could remember.

In the Valdemar household, only his eldest brother Alexander ever acknowledged him.

His father despised him. His mother loathed him, often resorting to physical abuse.

One memory stood out vividly—his mother gripping his throat during an episode, screaming hysterically, "Why don't you just die?"

Even in lucid moments, she avoided him like the plague.

His grandfather was preoccupied with business. Alexander was buried in studies.

Gradually, Adrian grew accustomed to solitude.

Then Julian arrived—a boy even more unfortunate than himself. Finally, he had company.

As an adult, people either treated him with cold indifference or groveled for favors.

This was the first time anyone had offered him genuine kindness.

Adrian froze, fingertips trembling imperceptibly.

He clenched his jaw, forcing his expression into practiced indifference.

Sophia Laurent gave him no time to recover. Turning to Lucas Sheridan, she declared, "He's perfect for the Young Marquis role."

Lucas raised an eyebrow, reassessing Adrian.

The young man's striking features—chiseled jawline, arresting eyes—lived up to the script's description of "peerless beauty."

More remarkably, his looks were completely natural.

Lucas's eyes lit up. "Sophia, another Lowell Entertainment discovery? How has someone this striking stayed under the radar?"

"Not ours." Sophia cleared her throat. "Just tell me if he'll work."

"Physically? Flawless." Lucas nodded. "Shall we screen test now?"

Adrian's breath hitched.

"Not today." Sophia waved a hand. "I'll bring him back in a week. Can you wait?"

"Absolutely!" Lucas agreed readily. "We've searched three months for this role. A few more days won't matter."

Adrian remained rigid throughout, his mind reeling even as he followed Sophia out.

A screen test?

What if he embarrassed himself?

What if he humiliated Sophia?

Regret flooded him. He should have refused outright.

"Earth to Adrian!" Sophia's voice carried across the distance. "Stop daydreaming! Come here!"

He bristled instantly. "Who are you calling—"

"Whoever responds." Her smirk held feline mischief.

Scowling, Adrian stalked after her—though the tips of his ears burned betrayingly red.
###Chapter 235

Lucas Sheridan's lips curved into a smile as his gaze flickered between the two. "Sophia, who's this?"

Sophia Laurent reached out to ruffle Adrian Valdemar's hair. "My kid."

Pretty face, poisonous heart.

Brat needed discipline.

Henry immediately warned, "Young Master, Mr. Valdemar's awakening must remain confidential. No leaks."

Adrian looked surprised. "She doesn't know?"

Henry shook his head gravely. "Not yet."
###Chapter 278

Adrian Valdemar felt a surge of complicated emotions after Henry Chamberlain's warning.

He had always held prejudices against Sophia Laurent. But now, he had to admit she genuinely cared for him and his brother.

Any other gold-digging woman would have handed over money without hesitation. Only Sophia would impose restrictions.

Seeing Henry's solemn expression, Adrian grew even more unsettled.

When Sophia called, his tone softened involuntarily.

"Sophia, what's up?"

Her brows furrowed at his uncharacteristic gentleness.

Had he gotten into trouble again?

Why did he sound so guilty?

"Melanie said you left work early. Where are you?"

His eyes darted away. "Grandfather invited me for dinner. Want to join?"

"No." She paused. "Check your email. I sent you the audition script for the Young Marquis role."

To her surprise, Adrian complied without argument. "Got it."

His cooperation was unexpected, but she didn't dwell on it.

Lately, handling Valdemar Group affairs had become second nature to her.

Even the troublemakers within the company had quieted down.

After entrusting the film project to Adrian, she focused on her own work.

Soon, audition day arrived.

Returning to the film studio, Adrian's mindset had completely transformed.

Last time, he'd been a washed-up actor at everyone's mercy.

Today, he was auditioning for the male lead in the blockbuster "Empress."

This would have been unimaginable before.

He knew his acting limitations all too well.

Not to mention his chronic camera fright.

After entering the studio, he excused himself to the restroom, asking Sophia to go ahead.

Ten minutes of mental preparation later, he finally mustered the courage to leave.

A shrill female voice cut through the hallway.

"If it isn't Mr. Valdemar! Finally come to pay your breach fee?"

It was Director Chen from "Fleeting Love," dressed in haute couture, her face twisted in mockery.

Adrian froze.

Had Sophia been too busy to handle this?

"Don't play dumb!" Chen sneered. "Did you really think you could get away with it? That legal notice from your company was laughable—"

Hearing this, Adrian actually relaxed.

With feigned interest, he asked, "Oh? What exactly did our legal team demand?"
###Chapter 279

"You want me to issue a public apology and declare the previous contract invalid?" Director Chen arched her eyebrows dramatically. "How absurd!"

Adrian Valdemar studied her twisted expression before chuckling.

"Indeed absurd."

The Valdemar Group's legal department had never lost a case since its establishment. He wondered what lawyer this washed-up director had hired to make such outrageous demands.

A faint smirk played on Adrian's lips, his striking features illuminated under the studio lights. Director Chen's eyes gleamed with undisguised lust as her gaze roamed over him.

"Actually..." She lowered her voice suggestively. "The compensation could be waived. If you'd just... keep me company for a while..."

Though well-preserved for her forties, the crow's feet around her eyes betrayed her age. Her attempt at coquettishness turned Adrian's stomach.

"Granny, is your house missing mirrors or toilets?"

His expression darkened. "At your age, you should spare people this secondhand embarrassment. Is your face made of reinforced concrete?"

The verbal dagger struck true. Director Chen's face purpled with rage. "You insignificant brat! Crushing you would be easier than squashing an ant!"

"Spare me!"

Adrian unleashed his full disdain. "You think you can sexually harass me? You only bully newcomers on set while groveling before investors. If your face could generate electricity, we could shut down every nuclear plant in the country!"

His notorious temper wasn't unfounded, but he never picked fights without cause.

"Tell me, are you hormonally imbalanced or just pathologically desperate?"

Director Chen trembled with fury. "You—you'll regret this! Not a penny less than two million! Don't come crawling back to me later!"

"Get psychiatric help."

Adrian turned on his heel and strode away without a backward glance.

Her shrill scream followed him: "Adrian Valdemar! You'll pay for this!"

Crew members exchanged bewildered looks as they passed by. Another meltdown from the director?

Adrian headed straight to the "Empress" set afterward. Director Chen's tantrum had unexpectedly eased his nerves.

After exchanging pleasantries with director Lucas Sheridan, he took his position before the camera.

Today's audition involved the Young Marquis' pivotal breakdown scene upon learning of his father's death—requiring seamless transitions from aristocratic charm to stunned disbelief, then utter devastation.

The challenging sequence had stumped every previous auditioning actor, leaving Lucas unsatisfied.
###Chapter 280

Adrian Valdemar had memorized every line of this scene.

Professor Eloise Fairchild had meticulously dissected the emotional journey of the Young Marquis for him.

During the first rehearsal, his performance was riddled with flaws.

After countless corrections from his mentor, he finally grasped the essence—only then did he dare accompany Sophia Laurent to the audition.

"Action."

At Lucas Sheridan's command, the set fell into complete silence.

All eyes locked onto Adrian.

Under the weight of their gazes, his body trembled imperceptibly.

He curled his lips into a roguish smirk, his voice dripping with languid amusement. "What's so glorious about military achievements? A life of wine and song is far more pleasurable."

His delivery was unexpectedly polished, capturing the essence of a spoiled nobleman with startling accuracy.

Were it not for the faint tremor in his limbs, it would have been flawless.

Just then, a servant from the Marquis's household rushed in. "Young Master, stop drinking—you must return home at once—"

The Young Marquis swirled his wine cup lazily. "Why the hurry? The night is still young."

The servant's face crumpled. "My lord... your father... he was stabbed by rebels outside the city walls. His body... has just been brought back to the manor."

The smile froze on the Young Marquis's face.

For several seconds, he stood motionless. His voice cracked. "What... did you say?"

His first instinct was disbelief—surely this was some cruel jest.

But he dismissed the thought instantly.

No servant would dare fabricate such news about the Marquis.

The Young Marquis staggered to his feet, knocking over his wine cup. He stumbled toward home, his movements unsteady.

As he turned, the playful glint in his eyes shattered into raw panic.

When he reached the manor gates, the sound of wailing from within rooted him to the spot.

After a prolonged silence, he pushed open the doors to his father's courtyard with trembling hands.

The sight of the Old Marquis's lifeless body engulfed him in tidal waves of grief.

The light in his bright eyes dimmed instantly.

A single tear traced down his cheek unnoticed.

The audition ended.

The set remained eerily quiet.

Lucas was the first to snap out of it.

He studied Adrian with a furrowed brow.

Sophia stood nearby, equally perplexed.

Both had noticed Adrian's trembling from the moment he stepped on set—a stark contrast to his flawless performance during last night's rehearsal.

Was it nerves?

The crew gradually regained their composure.

Their glances at Adrian carried pity.

His lines and expressions had been impeccable.

But the disjointed body language ruined it.

Lucas was notoriously exacting, and Richard Lowell's provocations had only intensified his demands.

Otherwise, the role of the Young Marquis wouldn't have remained uncast for so long.
###Chapter 281

Adrian Valdemar felt the weight of gazes piercing his back like needles, each pitying sigh a fresh sting.

His fists clenched so tightly his nails dug crescent moons into his palms.

Failure. Again.

The uncontrollable trembling before the cameras had shattered him once more.

This role was the opportunity he'd dreamed of—more precious than he'd ever imagined.

The lingering intensity of his performance left his eyes burning. He ducked his head swiftly.

"Let's talk in my lounge," Lucas Sheridan's voice cut through the silence.

Sophia Laurent murmured assent.

Adrian trailed behind them in silence, shoulders hunched like a chastened child.

Inside the lounge, Lucas wasted no time. "Adrian's performance today isn't at the Young Marquis's standard."

His gaze locked onto Sophia. "This project is critical for all of us. It must be flawless."

The unspoken implication hung heavy between them.

Sophia glanced at the boy biting his lip raw and sighed inwardly.

She knew how far he'd come. His delivery and expressions were perfect—if only his body would cooperate.

She'd promised no interference in casting when securing the investment.

Yet she couldn't let this chance slip away.

"However," Lucas continued, "if he fixes that one issue, I'll give him another audition. As a favor to you."

Sophia's eyes brightened.

"No." Adrian's voice scraped like sandpaper.

He'd heard enough hollow praise. Minor roles in "River Banquet" and "Empress" were beyond him—how could he hope for "The Long Ballad"'s third lead?

Another audition would only deepen the humiliation.

Sophia's palm smacked against the back of his head.

"Are you insane? Turning down this opportunity?" She turned to Lucas. "Thank you. We'll regroup and return."

Lucas nodded. "His acting's actually solid. Just needs to conquer that camera fear."

Once the director left, Sophia frowned. "What happened today?"
###Chapter 282

Just as Adrian was about to shout "one," rapid footsteps echoed outside the banquet hall.

Henry rushed to the second floor. "Boss! The Winstons are here!"

"What?"

Adrian's expression darkened instantly. He grabbed Sophia and shoved her toward Henry. "Take her away!"

"Yes, sir."

Henry dragged Sophia toward the back corridors.

"My shoes!"

Sophia's heels lay abandoned by the sofa.

Adrian kicked them under the couch with his foot.

There was no time to evacuate the first-floor crowd.

The Winston patriarch barged in with Isabella in tow.

"Ah—" Isabella screamed, covering her eyes.

The old man's face twisted in rage. "Clear the room!"

"Understood!"

Winston bodyguards sprang into action.

Guests scrambled for the exits. Women fled in every direction.

Lucas seized the chance to slip away with the crowd.

Outside, his men rushed forward anxiously. "Sir, what happened?"

"Minor issue." Lucas removed his mask. "Keep watching the Valdemars."

"Sir!" Another guard reported urgently. "Damian is inside too!"

"What?" Lucas kicked the man. "Why didn't you say so sooner?"

The guard cowered.

Lucas replaced his mask and vaulted back over the wall.

The banquet hall blazed with light.

Adrian descended the stairs calmly. "Mr. Winston, such an unexpected visit. No advance notice?"

"Notice?" The old man's cane struck the floor with a crack. "Notice for this depraved spectacle?"

"Standard business tactics." Adrian remained unruffled. "If it offends you, I'll cancel it."

Isabella flushed with anger. "Disgusting! Our family would never stoop to such methods."

"Different rules in Lorville."

"You—" Isabella suddenly remembered her purpose. "Where's Sophia? You brought her here—was this your plan all along? Hand her over!"
###Chapter 283

The cruel taunts were seared into Adrian Valdemar's memory like brands. Even after a decade, they remained as vivid as yesterday.

Every time he stood before the camera, those venomous words resurfaced on their own.

In the dressing room, Adrian took a deep breath in response to Sophia Laurent's inquiry.

"Never mind. The netizens are right. I'm not cut out for acting."

Damian Valdemar had always been his rival. When Adrian first entered the industry, he'd had plenty of fans.

When had the mockery begun?

Probably around the time Damian joined the entertainment world.

A weariness unbefitting his youth flickered in Adrian's eyes.

"I need a few days off."

Sophia studied his defeated expression, hesitating before speaking.

"Alright. Take some time to regroup."

Adrian's medical report showed no abnormalities.

The problem must be psychological.

This wasn't something to rush.

Sophia decided to investigate privately—perhaps consult Patriarch Valdemar for insight.

What exactly had this young heir endured?

Meanwhile...

Director Beatrice Holloway of the "Fleeting Love" production slunk back to her private lounge.

"Young Master Valdemar..."

Her obsequious smile was a far cry from her usual demeanor.

"That brat has no sense. I berated him for days, and he actually quit..."

"Can't you be more creative?" The voice on the phone dripped with disdain.

"Sleep with him, and I'll finance another series for you."

Beatrice's eyes lit up. "Really?"

Millions in funding, plus Adrian's striking looks...

"Don't worry. I'll find a way to secure him. I'll even send you the footage."

"Tch. I'll await good news." The call disconnected.

Beatrice's wrinkles smoothed with satisfaction.

She dialed Adrian's number.

"My tone was too harsh earlier. There's a cast dinner tonight—you should come."
###Chapter 284

Adrian Valdemar was at his lowest point.

He walked mechanically toward the studio exit.

His phone rang abruptly. He answered without checking the caller ID.

Director Chen's artificially sweetened voice came through.

Adrian's brow twitched almost imperceptibly.

What was this old woman scheming now?

Had she been plotting revenge since he humiliated her publicly?

The air around him turned icy.

Sophia Laurent immediately noticed the shift in his mood.

But the next second, Adrian suddenly laughed.

"Sure. Where?"

Hearing his agreement, Director Chen's face lit up with a smile.

"I'll book a private room right away. I'll text you the address later. You must come."

Her excitement was practically dripping through the phone.

Adrian's lips curled into a cold smirk, though his tone remained warm. "Count on it."

"Perfect! Tonight we'll talk things through. Let's put the past behind us. I promise to get you back on set."

A flash of mockery crossed Adrian's eyes. "How generous of you, Director Chen."

She hung up, thoroughly pleased, as if victory was already in her grasp.

What she didn't see was Adrian's terrifyingly dark expression.

Did she really think he was that naive?

Sophia frowned at the mention of "Director Chen."

"The director from Fleeting Love contacted you?"

Adrian shrugged. "Said it's a cast dinner."

Sophia grew more suspicious.

Why would they invite Adrian to a cast dinner?

The legal team had already sent a termination notice demanding a public apology.

This sudden invitation reeked of ulterior motives.

Sophia quickly assessed the possibilities: either they were surrendering—or setting a trap.

If it was the former, she wouldn't interfere with Adrian's decision.

But if it was the latter? As his guardian, she wouldn't stand by.

"Where's the dinner?"

Adrian shrugged again. "She didn't say yet."

"Forward me the address when you get it."

Adrian shot her a wary look. "Why?"

Sophia smiled innocently. "I'm free tonight. Might as well join the fun."

"Absolutely not." His refusal was instant.

This wasn't a social call.

He wasn't that helpless child anymore.

Sophia studied his unusual reaction and blinked. "You're not actually considering going back to that production, are you?"

Adrian scoffed. "I'd rather play a corpse than return to that dump."

Sophia stared.

"That's... quite the career aspiration."

When Adrian offered no further explanation, she didn't press.

She'd find out his whereabouts one way or another.

And she was just as curious about Director Chen's real intentions.
###Chapter 285

Night fell as city lights flickered to life.

Adrian Valdemar jolted awake from a chaotic dream, beads of sweat forming at his temples. He had dreamed of being trapped in that dark storage room again, surrounded by classmates' mocking laughter.

The sudden ringtone shattered the silence.

"Adrian, everyone's waiting. Where are you?" Director Chen's voice crackled through the receiver.

Adrian rubbed his temples. "On my way."

He hung up and checked the time. Outside, the city was already illuminated.

The private club was located in the suburbs. When Adrian pushed open the door, the private room buzzed with clinking glasses and boisterous chatter.

Nearly the entire "Love You Forever" cast had gathered.

"Adrian's here!" someone called out warmly.

Adrian paused. These fresh-faced actors' eyes held none of the calculation or flattery he was accustomed to.

"Sit here!" A ponytailed girl waved at him.

As Adrian moved to join her, Director Chen intercepted him.

"Adrian, we need to talk." The director slung an arm around his shoulders. "Sit by me."

Murmurs of agreement rose around them.

"Clear the air already."

"Director Chen means well."

Adrian's lips curled into a cold smile. He recognized that predatory gaze—a hunter eyeing trapped prey.

"Sure." He agreed readily.

Triumph flashed in Director Chen's eyes as he handed Adrian a glass of baijiu.

"My apologies. Let this drink make amends."

Adrian accepted the glass, fingertips tracing its rim.

Director Chen raised his orange juice. "Cheers."

His smile widened as he watched Adrian's untouched drink.
###Chapter 286

Director Chen tapped her fingers lightly against the glass, creating tiny ripples in the juice. Her smile froze when she noticed Adrian Valdemar's untouched drink.

"What's wrong, Young Master Valdemar? Not good enough for your refined palate?"

Adrian lazily lifted his gaze, toying with the silverware between his slender fingers. "At least you're self-aware."

Director Chen's meticulously drawn eyebrows knitted together. "What do you mean?"

"Exactly what I said." Adrian tugged carelessly at his collar, revealing the hint of a tattoo on his collarbone.

Director Chen slammed her hands on the table. "Adrian Valdemar, don't push your luck!"

Adrian suddenly laughed, though his eyes remained icy. "My luck is far too valuable for the likes of you."

His mood had already been foul before this ill-timed meeting. This clueless director had chosen the worst possible moment to provoke him. Forcing him to drink strong liquor upon arrival? Did she really think he was some pushover?

Director Chen abandoned all pretense, slamming her glass down. "Do you really think you're walking out of here unscathed?"

Adrian scoffed, sinking deeper into the leather sofa. "Who said anything about leaving?"

This was Valdemar territory. He was curious to see what tricks this woman had up her sleeve.

Director Chen trembled with rage. "Fine! Let's see how long that arrogance lasts..."

The rookie actors exchanged uneasy glances. Some began inching toward the exit.

"Director Chen, I just remembered I have an audition..."
"My agent needs me..."

Adrian narrowed his eyes. "Going for the strong-arm approach, auntie?"

Director Chen traced the rim of her glass with blood-red nails. "You're too naive, Young Master Valdemar. You're drinking that liquor today."

Adrian discreetly pressed the service button, but no one responded.

His stomach dropped. Valdemar Hotels never had service lapses unless...

"Save your energy." Director Chen waved her phone triumphantly. "All staff on this floor received 'temporary reassignment' notices."

Adrian's knuckles whitened beneath the table, though his expression remained impassive.
###Chapter 287

Undercurrents

At age ten, Adrian Valdemar was discovered covered in bruises by his elder brother Alexander during a routine clothing change. The next morning, Patriarch Valdemar personally retrieved the boy to the family manor.

From that day forward, Adrian began daily combat training at dawn under the Valdemar security chief's supervision.

Director Chen drummed lacquered crimson nails against the tabletop, watching Adrian's expression darken with visible satisfaction.

"Did you think I'd invite you here unprepared?"

Her sharp clap summoned assistants and bodyguards. "Restrain him."

Adrian lunged for the private room's exit.

The hallway staff could provide witnesses if he just reached—

The door swung open to reveal unnatural stillness.

Every VIP room stood darkened. Even the service call buttons had been deactivated.

A security guard's uniform gleamed conspicuously near the elevators.

"Help! Kidnapping!" Adrian gasped, clutching the guard's sleeve. "I'm the second heir of Valdemar Holdings!"

The guard remained immobile.

Footsteps approached. Adrian shoved past only to be seized by vise-like grips.

His pupils contracted.

The betrayal stung deeper than expected—his own family's security turning against him.

"Our thanks," an assistant simpered. "This thief stole props from our production."

The guards handed Adrian over without hesitation.

When the door sealed shut again, Director Chen swirled her merlot with deliberate slowness.

"Must we resort to unpleasantness?" Her gaze traced his disheveled collar. "Such unnecessary defiance."

Adrian mentally cursed eighteen generations of Chen ancestors.

"Now Director," he suddenly beamed, "just a harmless prank."

Her eyes narrowed. "More tricks?"

"Wouldn't dream of it." He shrugged toward the liquor table, fingers brushing a crystal glass. "Not when even your security dances to your tune."

"Spill one drop," she hissed, "and you'll drink double."

Amber liquid caught the chandelier's glow as Adrian raised his glass.

"Such exquisite vintage..." His throat worked with each deliberate swallow. "Waste would be criminal."
###Chapter 288

Director Chen narrowed her eyes, her gaze locked onto Adrian Valdemar. She watched intently as he drained his glass in one gulp, only relaxing slightly when his shoulders finally slumped.

Adrian set down the empty glass. An unnatural flush crept up his cheeks.

He rubbed his temples, his eyes growing unfocused. His thick lashes cast shadows under the lighting, obscuring the calculating gleam that briefly flashed in his pupils.

With a dull thud, Adrian collapsed face-first onto the dining table.

Director Chen's lips curled in triumph. She gestured to her entourage. "Take him to room 1808."

Two burly bodyguards hauled the unconscious man toward the elevators.

The moment the door closed behind them, Director Chen pounced on the bed. Her trembling fingers traced the sharp angles of Adrian's jawline.

"Don't blame me for being ruthless. You brought this on yourself..."

She retrieved professional recording equipment from her designer bag, setting up the tripod with practiced ease.

"Cooperate nicely, and I'll make sure you get all the resources you need..."

As Director Chen undid her blouse buttons, Adrian's eyes snapped open.

In one fluid motion, he flipped their positions and pressed a pillow over her face. She thrashed violently, but years of gym training made Adrian immovable.

Within thirty seconds, he had her trussed up with torn bedsheets like a mummy.

Director Chen's muffled screams came out as incoherent whimpers.

Adrian straightened his cuffs with deliberate slowness, looking down at her with icy detachment. "Wondering why the drugs didn't work?"

He pulled out his phone with a smirk. "My grandfather was a master vintner. I grew up swimming in alcohol."

"As for your special cocktail..." Adrian chuckled darkly. "I switched our glasses when you checked your messages."

Director Chen turned deathly pale. She remembered Adrian excusing himself to grab napkins right then.

"Mmmph!" She writhed against her restraints.

Adrian arched an eyebrow. "Something to say?" At her frantic nodding, he yanked out the gag.

"You'll regret this!" Director Chen hissed. "I'll make sure you never work in this industry again!"

Adrian threw back his head and laughed. He leaned down until his lips brushed her ear. "Director Chen, who exactly holds the leverage here?"

Straightening up, he tapped his phone screen. The recording played back her earlier incriminating words. "Attempted sexual assault carries quite the sentence."
###Chapter 289

Director Chen didn't panic at his words. Instead, she smiled with confidence.

"What can you do? Do you have proof?"

Adrian pointed to the selfie stick in the corner. The recording phone's red light was blinking.

"Didn't you set this up yourself?"

But her arrogance quickly returned.

"I suggest you let me go. The entire hotel is locked down. Security is everywhere. You can't escape."

She lowered her voice threateningly.

"You don't want to mess with the people behind me. Cooperate, and you'll suffer less."

That was the second young master of the Valdemar Group. How could a small-time actor like Adrian compete?

Both shared the surname Valdemar, but their statuses were worlds apart.

"Blame your bad luck."

Adrian understood everything in an instant.

From the moment he accepted the role in "Fleeting Love," he had fallen into Damian's trap.

Choosing a Valdemar-owned hotel was meant to lower his guard.

The mistreatment on set was all to distance Director Chen from Damian.

Though he hadn't drunk the spiked wine, he'd already finished a full glass of liquor.

If the entire hotel was under Damian's control, he truly had no way out.

"Don't waste your energy. The signal jammer's been on this whole time."

A flicker of despair crossed Adrian's eyes.

Since being adopted by Patriarch Valdemar, Damian had only dared to scheme in secret.

This was the first time he'd acted so brazenly.

Adrian couldn't help but worry about what would come next.

An eight-year-old Damian had been capable of terrible things. Now, his methods would be even crueler.

The video was likely just the beginning.

"Relax, we don't want your life. Just cooperate."

Adrian scoffed.

"Do you even know what kind of person Damian is?"

Her face turned deathly pale.

"Damian is the illegitimate son of a mistress. Understand now?"

Director Chen's legs gave out. She nearly collapsed to the floor.
###Chapter 290

"Are you also from the Valdemar family?" Director Chen's voice rose sharply, her fingers trembling uncontrollably. "The Valdemar Group that dominates the business world?"

Her teacup slipped from her grasp, leaving a dark stain on the carpet.

A mocking smirk twisted Adrian Valdemar's cold features. "That bastard Damian Valdemar dares to represent the Valdemars?"

He loathed that surname.

The hotel lobby glittered under crystal chandeliers.

Sophia Laurent strode through the revolving doors in stilettos, flanked by twelve black-suited bodyguards.

The receptionist's hands shook so badly she could barely hold the phone upon seeing the embossed "Valdemar Group CEO" title.

In the penthouse suite, the aroma of tea swirled.

"Don't worry, Second Young Master," the manager fawned as he poured tea. "That guy won't escape."

Damian toyed with his phone, the screen displaying live footage from the sixteenth floor.

"If only my dear brother knew how helpful you're being..." He deliberately trailed off.

The manager instantly caught the hint. "It's an honor to assist the First Young Master."

On the monitor, Adrian's fist smashed into the wall.
###Chapter 291

Dark clouds gathered over Valdemar Holdings.

Alexander Valdemar lay comatose in the hospital while Vincent Valdemar and his illegitimate son circled like vultures. The corporate empire teetered on the brink of upheaval.

"Working for Young Master Damian is the greatest honor of my life."

The manager bowed so low his forehead nearly scraped the carpet. He didn't know who was locked in the private room—only that some D-list celebrity had foolishly offended the Valdemar heir.

He silenced it with a scowl.

The lobby gleamed under crystal chandeliers.

Sophia checked her watch. Adrian had only been inside twenty minutes—not enough time for even Damian's traps to spring. Yet her brow furrowed slightly.

The chandelier's light turned glacial in her eyes.
###Chapter 292

Warren Kingsley hurried out of the elevator.

His eyes immediately landed on Sophia Laurent standing in the hotel lobby. His lips curled in an involuntary sneer.

But when he noticed Henry Chamberlain beside her, he quickly plastered on a professional smile.

"Ms. Laurent, Mr. Chamberlain. I'm Warren Kingsley, the hotel manager."

Although the Valdemar brothers currently controlled the family empire, the Patriarch's appointed CEO still required surface-level respect.

Sophia instantly caught the disdain in his eyes. Her gaze turned glacial.

"Manager Kingsley, Adrian Valdemar is currently in this hotel. Pull up all surveillance footage immediately."

Warren's heart skipped a beat.

Adrian?

Alexander's younger brother?

Recalling Damian Valdemar's strange smile earlier, everything clicked into place. Cold sweat dampened his back.

"Mr. Valdemar's brother? But..."

He feigned concern with a frown. "It's late. A large-scale search would disturb our guests. If this gets leaked online..."

The unspoken implication: He wasn't refusing, just protecting the company's image.

Sophia smirked. "You're fired."

She had already notified other executives and security when summoning the manager.

Warren's smile froze. "On what grounds?"

"I've worked for Valdemar Holdings for twelve years! From waiter to manager. And you dismiss me with one sentence?"

His voice rose. "Who would remain loyal after such treatment?"

The threat hung thick in his words.

Henry's face darkened. "Watch your tone, Kingsley. Your termination paperwork is already processed."

Vincent Valdemar turned with eyes sharp as knives.

"Hand over that video. Publicly apologize to Damian. Admit you framed him."

Adrian strode past him toward Diana Valdemar, who was being restrained by bodyguards.

"Mother, don't do this."

He gently pried the guards' hands away.

Diana broke free and began pounding her fists against Adrian's chest.

"Why? Why must I endure this?"

Adrian grunted in pain as his wounds throbbed.

Sophia Laurent gave a sharp glance. The bodyguards immediately pulled Diana away.

"Are you hurt?"

Sophia rushed to Adrian's side.

He shook his head, signaling for the housekeeper to take Diana upstairs.

Once his mother was gone, Adrian turned an icy gaze toward Vincent.

"Haven't you hurt her enough?"

Vincent sneered. "I wouldn't be here if you hadn't framed my son."

"Framed?" Adrian scoffed. "Your bastard inherited your treachery. He reaped what he sowed."

Vincent's hand shot up.

Sophia reacted instantly, yanking Adrian out of reach.

"You dare dodge me?" Vincent stumbled forward.

"Should he just stand there and take it?" Sophia positioned herself between them.

"I'm his father!"

"Father?" Sophia's laugh was bitter. "You don't deserve that title."

She pulled Adrian back as bodyguards formed a protective circle.

"Sentencing without evidence—is this your idea of justice?"

Vincent's face darkened. "Damian doesn't lie!"

"And Adrian does?" Sophia stood her ground.

"I raised him. I know him."

"You know him?" Sophia's voice dripped sarcasm. "You can't even see your own son clearly."

She met Vincent's glare. "No apologies. Not until we settle Damian's bullying of Adrian."

"Lies!" Vincent roared.

"The old man made a mistake marrying you! I'll make sure he knows the Valdemars don't need a shrew like you!"

He turned on his heel and stormed out.
###Chapter 308

Sophia Laurent's lips curled into a mocking smile as she observed Vincent Valdemar's pretentious expression.

Before she could speak, Adrian Valdemar cut in sharply.

"Bullshit!" Adrian's eyes blazed with fury. "Alexander and Sophia's marriage was arranged by the Patriarch. Who the hell are you to interfere?"

Sophia arched an eyebrow.

Since when were she and Alexander so devoted?

Vincent's face darkened. "I'm your father! Watch your tone!"

He glared at Adrian. "Alexander is my son. I decide his marriage!"

Sophia was impressive, but useless to him—just a thorn in his side.

Adrian scoffed. "You call yourself a father? Having you as a dad is a curse from our ancestors!"

Vincent trembled with rage, raising his hand to strike.

Despite his injuries, Adrian dodged effortlessly.

Vincent chased him fruitlessly, panting heavily.

"Adrian!" he snarled. "Issue a statement clearing Damian's name immediately, or I'll divorce your mother!"

Adrian smirked. "Like I care."

He'd be glad to see the miserable couple split.

But a flicker of concern crossed his eyes—his mother's obsession with Vincent was no secret.

"And forget about your acting career. I’ll make sure you’re blacklisted."

Adrian's expression froze.

Though no longer in power, Vincent had deep connections after decades in the Valdemar family.

Sebastian Valdemar still controlled Valdemar Entertainment.

"Quite the show of authority," Sophia interjected coldly. "Since when did you own the entertainment industry?"

Vincent narrowed his eyes. "Acting is a disgrace. I’m doing him a favor."

His gaze slid to Sophia. "Or are you afraid he’ll outshine you?"

Sophia nearly laughed.

"No wonder the Patriarch handed the group to Alexander," she said smoothly.

Vincent exploded. "You—how dare you disrespect your elders!"

Sophia kept smiling. "Better than being a heartless snake."

Vincent grabbed a teacup, ready to hurl it.

"Margaret," Sophia said calmly, "note down any damages caused by Mr. Valdemar."

Vincent froze, cup midair, face flushing crimson.

"You’ll regret this!" he spat.

Sophia lifted her own teacup with grace. "We’ll be waiting."
###Chapter 309

The door slammed shut behind Vincent Valdemar with a thunderous crash.

Sophia Laurent watched his retreating figure with a sardonic smile curling her lips.

"Is that all you've got?"

She had expected more resistance from him.

The real puppet master pulling the strings was the woman who'd remained in the shadows all along.

Genevieve Roche—mother of Sebastian and Damian Valdemar.

A cold glint flashed in Sophia's eyes.

"Sis!" Adrian Valdemar bounded over, his eyes sparkling with excitement.

Sophia arched an eyebrow.

Adrian was practically vibrating with enthusiasm.

Diana Valdemar had always been outmatched in confrontations with her husband.

Each encounter reopened old wounds that left her devastated.

Today's outcome was unprecedented.

"You were absolutely brilliant!"

Sophia chuckled at his exaggerated admiration.

"Shall we check upstairs?" She gestured toward the second floor.

Adrian's expression sobered as he remembered their purpose.

"Will you come with me?"

Sophia's fingers stilled momentarily.

This would be her first meeting with Alexander's mother.

The timing wasn't ideal.

But leaving now would be even more improper.

"Let's go," she murmured softly.

In the second-floor bedroom, Diana slept peacefully.

The sedatives smoothed the lines of distress from her face.

Not yet fifty, she looked decades older from years of suffering.

Adrian sat by the bedside, his gaze troubled.

For as long as he could remember, his mother had vacillated between fragile stability and breakdowns.

During her lucid moments, she often held him while weeping silently.

Sophia observed quietly.

This society matriarch had imprisoned herself in a gilded cage of misery.

A ringing phone shattered the heavy silence.

Patriarch Valdemar summoned them for dinner.

"Let's go," Adrian whispered.

Stealing a glance at Sophia's expression, he suddenly thumped his chest in reassurance.

"Grandfather favors me and Alexander above all. Vincent's words mean nothing."

Sophia paused mid-step.

"Who said anything about divorce?"
###Chapter 310

Sophia Laurent blinked in confusion.

When had she ever expressed any concerns?

Though she thought this privately, she maintained her composure outwardly.

"My marriage with your brother is... complicated. Let's just let things unfold naturally."

To her, Alexander Valdemar was merely a means to an end.

Besides, with his status and position, how could she possibly make him an unwitting father?

"What do you mean 'naturally'? Marriage is a divine blessing! My brother would never dream of letting you down—"

Sophia's eyes widened. "???"

"Divine... blessing?"

She studied Adrian Valdemar skeptically.

Was this boy misunderstanding something?

Adrian smirked knowingly.

"Don't be shy, sister-in-law. I saw the Valdemar Group's press conference..."

Only then did Sophia recall that day.

To silence the media, she had spun a childhood sweethearts tale.

"..."

This misunderstanding had spiraled out of control!

"That was just PR talk. Don't take it seriously."

Adrian winked. "I get it, I get it. No need to explain."

Sophia: "..."

You get nothing.

Valdemar Sanatorium.

The Patriarch had prepared an elaborate lunch.

"Sophia, come sit."

Patriarch Valdemar beckoned warmly. "You've been working hard lately."

Sophia took her seat gracefully.

Adrian grumbled beside her. "Old man, aren't I your actual grandson?"

The Patriarch didn't even glance up. "Leave if you're not eating."

Adrian: "..."

"This is blatant favoritism!"

Ignoring him, the Patriarch turned to Sophia.

"Sophia, thank you for looking after this troublemaker."

Had Henry Chamberlain not reported it, he wouldn't have known how long Adrian had been mistreated.

The thought filled him with both heartache and guilt.

Damian Valdemar had been corrupted from childhood.

And the most despicable one was Vincent Valdemar.

Without his backing, who would dare target Adrian?

Sophia paused mid-bite. "It was nothing, Grandfather. No need to dwell on it."

To her, it was just a small favor.

But for Adrian, it was a turning point in his life.

The drama "Empress" might just be his chance at redemption.
###Chapter 311

The wilderness. The Celestial Sword Sect.

At the foot of the Celestial Sword Peak, the crowd stirred.

"Isn't that Su Zheng? The traitor who was supposed to die in the Outer Battlefield six years ago!"

"Shh, keep your voice down. He was the top genius of the Northwest back then, reaching the Half-Step Divine Demon Realm at sixteen."

"What does genius matter? He colluded with the otherworldly races and got nine Divine Demon Elders killed. Even his fiancée testified against him."

Amid the whispers, a ragged young man walked forward slowly. His body was covered in wounds, his clothes stained with blood, yet his back remained straight, his gaze sharp as a blade.

This was Su Zheng.

Once the prodigy who dominated the Northwest, now stripped of all his cultivation. Yet he had stubbornly returned to the place that betrayed him.

Inside the grand hall, the atmosphere was tense.

"Elder Luo, Bi Zhu and I are deeply in love. I hope you'll grant us your blessing." Chu Feng held a gilded betrothal letter, his smile confident.

Luo Quan frowned. "But Bi Zhu's engagement to Su Zheng—"

"Su Zheng has been dead for six years. The engagement is void." Chu Feng interrupted. "Besides, my Flame Cauldron Sect has two spots at the Primordial Academy. If Bi Zhu marries me, she can attend with me."

Qing Yi snorted and turned to leave, only to freeze at the entrance.

"Brother?"

Her shocked cry silenced the entire hall.

Chi Bi Zhu's pupils constricted, her fingers trembling uncontrollably. She had personally pushed Su Zheng into the abyss. How could he still be alive?

Su Zheng stepped inside, his gaze like a honed blade.

"Surprised?" He stared at Chi Bi Zhu. "When you stole my Divine Demon Marrow Elixir, did you ever imagine this day?"

"Su Zheng!" Luo Quan slammed the table and stood. "How dare you show your face here?"

"Why wouldn't I dare?" Su Zheng smirked coldly. "I wasn't the traitor. You were!"

Chi Bi Zhu forced herself to remain composed. "You colluded with the otherworldly races and got nine elders killed. I saw it with my own eyes!"

"What a convincing eyewitness account." Su Zheng's eyes glinted with frost. "Outside the Heavenly Gate, who was it that stabbed me in the back?"

Luo Quan roared, "Enough! The evidence is irrefutable, yet you still deny it?"

"Evidence?" Su Zheng scoffed. "Based solely on her word?"

A crushing pressure descended like a mountain, yet Su Zheng didn't flinch. He met Luo Quan's gaze head-on.

"Grandfather plucked you from the snow. Father treated you like a brother. And this is how you repay them?"

The hall fell deathly silent.

Su Zheng spoke slowly, each word deliberate.

"Today, I've returned to demand justice."
###Chapter 312

Sophia Laurent's lips twitched slightly at Adrian Valdemar's attempt to comfort her.

She truly wasn't upset. Visiting Alexander Valdemar was merely a formality.

"I'm really fine."

She settled into the chair beside the hospital bed, propping her chin on one hand as her gaze lingered on Alexander.

Valdemar Holdings' operations had stabilized.

A few more major deals, and she could gracefully step back, returning control to Patriarch Valdemar.

If Alexander never woke, the family would have to choose another heir.

She'd done all she could.

He shot Alexander a glare but held his tongue.

"Adrian, I'm going to check on Aunt Margaret. Wait here."

"Bro, how long are you planning to keep faking this coma?"

Alexander's eyes opened. "Problem?"

Alexander's brow furrowed. "Did she cry?"

"Not exactly." Adrian scoffed. "But she's clearly unhappy."

Silence.

Alexander hadn't meant to deceive her.

They were practically strangers, and with his injuries still healing—he could barely stand—he didn't know how to face her.

When Alexander remained quiet, Adrian continued unprompted. "She's a good woman. Don't screw this up."

Alexander's icy glare cut through him. "Out."

Adrian snorted. "Fine. Like anyone besides Sophia wants to visit you anyway."

The door slammed behind him.

Alexander massaged his temples.

He reached for his phone, scanning the documents Henry Chamberlain had sent.

During his "coma," Vincent Valdemar and Genevieve Roche's collaborators had revealed their hands.

Some demanded exorbitant prices. Others imposed impossible terms.

All applications bore Vincent's associates' signatures.

Perfect for rooting them out.

Legitimate projects were quietly funneled to Sophia through Henry.

One month, max. Then the trap would spring shut.
###Chapter 313

Sophia Laurent left Alexander Valdemar's hospital room and went straight to the building where Margaret Delaney was staying.

She first consulted the attending physician.

"The patient has shown frequent brainwave activity recently, with clear signs of awakening," the doctor said, flipping through the medical records.

Sophia's eyes lit up.

During her time at the Lowell family estate, Margaret had given her the maternal love she had been missing.

She remembered when she first got her period—Margaret had patiently taught her how to use sanitary pads.

"Aunt Margaret, Sophia is about to start her internship," Sophia murmured softly by the bedside.

She held Margaret's wrinkled hand.

"The company is hosting a design competition, and Sophia will participate," she continued gently. "If you wake up, you can go see her in person."

The figure on the bed suddenly twitched a finger.

Sophia was talking about Sophia's design talent when she felt a tug on her sleeve.

She looked down to see Margaret gripping the fabric of her shirt.

"Aunt Margaret!" Sophia gasped.

The woman on the bed slowly opened her eyes.

Sophia reached for the call button in excitement, but Margaret stopped her.

Margaret's lips trembled as if she wanted to speak.

"Don't rush. Take your time," Sophia leaned in closer.

The room was so quiet the sound of the IV drip could be heard.

"It... was... a scheme..." Margaret's voice was barely audible. "The switch... was intentional..."

Sophia's pupils constricted.

"You mean, my being switched at birth was planned?"

Margaret nodded weakly.

The motion drained the last of her strength.

Sophia's expression turned icy in an instant.

If this was true, then Emily Lowell and her family were the masterminds.

"Your adoptive mother's... sister..." Margaret spoke haltingly. "She used to... work as a maid... for the Lowells..."

The words struck Sophia like a bolt of lightning.
###Chapter 314

Margaret's trembling lips parted slightly. Sophia caught several key words.

"You mean...Emily's biological aunt?"

The elderly woman on the hospital bed nodded weakly, a glimmer of relief flashing in her clouded eyes.

Sophia clenched her fists, nails digging into her palms.

"So it was a premeditated switch all those years ago?"

Margaret's breathing grew labored, her skeletal fingers twitching.

Sophia immediately pressed the call button.

"Don't exert yourself. I'll get the doctor."

In the hallway, Sophia leaned against the cold wall as fragmented memories flooded her mind.

Adrian found her staring blankly out the window.

"Sophia?"

He'd approached quietly but froze when he saw her expression.

The icy glint hadn't faded from Sophia's eyes when she turned.

"Find someone," she said tersely. "Emily's maternal aunt."

Adrian understood instantly, pulling out his phone to make a call.

During the car ride home, Sophia's phone lit up.

"Sophia dear..."

Victoria's voice dripped with uncharacteristic sweetness.

"Come home for dinner tomorrow? I'll cook personally."

A cold smile curled Sophia's lips.

"Sure."

Her immediate agreement seemed to startle the woman on the other end.

"What...what would you like to eat?"

"Leftovers will do," Sophia said lightly. "I often had nothing to eat as a child."

A sharp intake of breath came through the phone.

Hanging up, Sophia watched the scenery blur past the car window.

Tomorrow's dinner would be interesting. She couldn't wait to see what new performance the Lowells had prepared.
###Chapter 315

The line went dead with a sharp beep. Sophia Laurent hung up decisively.

Victoria Lowell's hand trembled slightly as she clutched the phone.

Her earlier joy evaporated instantly, replaced by a suffocating tightness in her chest.

Richard Lowell leaned in eagerly. "Did she agree?"

Lowell Entertainment had been struggling recently.

"River Banquet" had become their last lifeline.

If this film succeeded, the company might survive.

William Lowell had pulled all-nighters for a week straight, handling endless crises.

Daniel Lowell moved near the office to focus on the Starlight Design Awards.

Nathan Lowell spiraled into self-destruction, drowning himself in alcohol daily.

The once brilliant musician now refused to leave his room.

Christopher Lowell remained in detention with no release date.

The Lowell family had crumbled in just one month.

Only then did Richard realize Sophia's true worth.

Ever since she married into the Valdemar family, he'd tried to reconcile.

But Sophia never gave him the chance.

Tonight's dinner finally offered hope.

Her return could save them all.

News spread quickly through the Lowell household.

William exhaled in relief at his office, his reprimands to subordinates softening.

Daniel kept his head down, absorbed in design sketches.

Nathan set down his glass, his expression conflicted.

His career didn't have to end this way.

Creative blocks could be overcome. Fans could be won back.

Yet he remained trapped in self-loathing.

The news of Sophia's return stirred something within him.

Emily Lowell clenched her fists.

Her nails dug deep into her palms.

Sophia wasn't the same pushover anymore.

With Pearl Group and the Valdemars backing her...

Emily regretted stepping aside.

Had she known this would happen, she'd never have let Sophia marry Alexander.

That video remained her trump card.

Once obtained, the Valdemars would discard damaged goods.

Pity those greedy gangsters kept delaying delivery.
###Chapter 316

A sinister glint flashed in Emily Lowell's eyes.

If the Lowells had disposed of Sophia Laurent earlier, she wouldn't have been reduced to this state.

As the sole heiress of the Lowell family, she should have been living carefree.

Time was running out. She needed to act fast.

With the Lowell family's decline, she had to secure her own future.

Her phone rang, interrupting her thoughts.

"Emily, care to join me for dinner tonight?"

The man's warm voice instantly smoothed her furrowed brows. A sweet smile curved her lips.

"I finished filming early today..."

"Was the shoot exhausting?"

"Not too bad." Her voice softened. "Just these period costumes are so heavy..."

"Give me half an hour."

After hanging up, the tips of Emily's ears turned pink.

Richard Lowell had always been profit-driven. If not for her beauty, elite education, impeccable socialite reputation, and Ryan Cunningham's relentless six-month pursuit, she would have been the one married to that vegetative Alexander Valdemar.

The old fox wanted both the Valdemar and Cunningham alliances. That's why Sophia became the sacrificial lamb.

Ryan's courtship had become her lifeline.

Though furious about Derek Langley parachuting into Lowell Entertainment, Richard had to swallow his pride for the Cunninghams' sake.

Marrying into the Cunningham family would secure her future.

What touched her most was Ryan's unwavering affection despite knowing the shadows in her past.

Emily chose a pearl-white mermaid gown with understated elegance. A million-dollar diamond necklace sparkled at her collarbone, enhancing her ethereal beauty.

At the staircase landing, she encountered Richard.

"Going out so late?"

"Ryan invited me to dinner." She lowered her eyes demurely.

Richard's face brightened. "Shall I arrange a car?"

"He's picking me up personally."

Watching his daughter's bashful expression, Richard smiled wider. "Be safe."

As Emily left, Victoria Lowell emerged from the shadows.

"Finally..." She exhaled in relief.

"What's wrong?"

Victoria hesitated.

Those leaked photos of Emily getting cozy with her four adoptive brothers still haunted her.

For six months, Emily had played hard to get with Ryan.

Everything changed when Alexander fell into a coma after the accident.

Richard seized the chance to pawn Sophia off to the Valdemars while reserving the Cunninghams for Emily.

Victoria's greatest fear was a scandal between her adopted daughter and four sons.
###Chapter 317

Emily Lowell finally got the frequent dates she'd been waiting for with Ryan Cunningham. Her anxious heart could finally settle.

Inside the upscale French restaurant, crystal chandeliers cast a soft glow. Emily sat poised across from Ryan, the sound of a violin drifting through the air.

Ryan reached into his suit jacket and produced a velvet jewelry box, sliding it toward her alongside ninety-nine champagne roses. "Mimi, I picked this especially for you."

Her fingers trembled slightly as she accepted the gift, her pulse racing. "Thank you."

Inside lay a rare pink diamond bracelet—the very one that had been snapped up by a mysterious bidder at last week's auction. She fastened it carefully, the gems shimmering under the light.

"It's beautiful," she murmured, turning her wrist to admire it, eyes alight with delight.

Ryan's lips curved. "Worth every minute in line if it makes you happy."

The thought of him queuing for her sent warmth through her chest. "You always put so much thought into everything."

He sliced his foie gras with deliberate grace, gaze intent. "For you? Anything."

The suggestive words made her ears burn. Throughout dinner, their conversation flowed effortlessly, each exchange laced with playful teasing and unspoken tension.

As they left the restaurant, Ryan draped her coat over her shoulders. "Let me take you home."

Emily bit her lip, reluctant for the night to end. But she nodded with practiced restraint.

Inside the limousine, neon lights flickered past the windows. The enclosed space carried the mingled scents of sandalwood and faint cigar smoke, making her heartbeat quicken.

A quiet sigh escaped him.

"What's wrong?" She turned sharply.

Ryan shook his head. "Nothing."

"Don't lie to me."

"Professor Smith?"

"The leading authority in AI medical applications." Ryan launched into an animated explanation of the man's achievements before catching himself. "Sorry. I shouldn't bore you with technical details."

He shifted topics smoothly. "When are you free? My parents have been asking to meet you."
###Chapter 318

Ryan Cunningham's arm encircled Emily Lowell's slender waist, pulling her closer.

Emily nestled against his chest without hesitation.

Her pulse quickened when he mentioned taking her to meet his family.

"Really...you want me to meet your parents?"

"Of course." Ryan's voice softened. "You're extraordinary. I need to make you mine before someone else does."

The words sent a thrill through her.

"Stop..."

The lead scientist of Lowell Group's medical robotics project shared that name.

The classified nature of the project meant few knew its details. She'd only overheard William discussing it in his study.

If even the Cunninghams valued this scientist, the project must be more significant than she'd realized.

"Today was rushed. I'll visit properly next time."

Emily nodded shyly. "I'll be waiting."

This project was the key to surpassing the Valdemars.

"Prepare the proposal venue," he ordered coldly.

The chauffeur immediately complied.

Emily returned to the silent Lowell mansion.

After showering, she slipped into a black silk nightgown and entered William's bedroom with practiced ease.
