He abandoned his paperwork and headed home early.

Anticipation warmed his chest at the thought of seeing her.

But when he pushed open his bedroom door, he found Emily lounging in his bed.
###Chapter 319

William Lowell pushed open the door to find Emily curled up on the couch watching TV.

"Big brother!" Emily's eyes lit up as she sprang from the sofa.

She wore pink loungewear, her damp hair dripping water droplets from a recent shower.

William's Adam's apple bobbed slightly as he averted his gaze.

"You're home so late?" Emily took his briefcase, her fingertips brushing his knuckles.

His body stiffened. "Had a project deadline."

"It's ten o'clock!" She frowned. "You'll ruin your health like this."

Rising on tiptoes to check his temperature, she found him deftly avoiding her touch.

"I'm fine." His smile looked strained.

Emily bit her lip and suddenly grabbed his sleeve.

"Let me help at the company."

William blinked. "You?"

"I know I'm not as capable as Sophia," her lashes lowered, "but I could handle minor tasks."

"No." His refusal came sharp as a blade. "It's too demanding."

Emily's eyes instantly glistened.

After a hesitation, he nodded.

Emily squealed and threw herself against him.

The soft warmth of her body pressed close, her shampoo's floral scent enveloping him.

William shoved her away abruptly.

"I need a shower." He practically fled.

Under the cold spray, William slammed a fist against the tiles.

How could he entertain such thoughts about his sister?

Outside, Emily traced where he'd touched her, lips curving in a knowing smile.

When William emerged, the living room stood empty.

Only the lingering warmth on the couch proved it hadn't been a dream.
###Chapter 320

Twilight descended as the Lowell mansion blazed with light.

Sophia Laurent stepped into the grand hall, her stilettos clicking against marble. The crystal chandelier cast dazzling prisms across her path.

"Sophia!" Richard Lowell hurried forward, his face creased with practiced warmth. "Our Michelin chef prepared bluefin tuna and foie gras with black truffles."

William Lowell pulled out a chair with exaggerated courtesy. "Sit here, sister."

Emily Lowell offered a napkin with trembling hands. "For your hands, sister."

A decade ago when she'd first been brought to this house, they'd barely spared her a glance.

Now that she held the reins of Pearl Group, they'd suddenly learned to act.

An expensive Bordeaux gleamed on the table. Sophia lifted the glass, taking a measured sip.

Emily's nails dug into her palms.

Her once-protective fourth brother now couldn't be bothered to spare her a glance.
###Chapter 321

Morning sunlight filtered through the sheer curtains into the bedroom.

Little Fubao rubbed her sleepy eyes and sat up, her fluffy curls sticking out in every direction.

"Fubao's awake?" Uncle Number One pushed open the door with a steaming glass of milk.

Uncle Number Two followed closely behind, holding two brand-new dresses. "Pink or blue today?"

Uncle Number Three peeked in from the hallway. "I made your favorite strawberry pancakes."

Fubao blinked her big eyes and said in her sweet baby voice, "I want both~"

Uncle Number Four squeezed in with a plush toy. "Look what I got you!"

Uncle Number Five held up flash cards. "Time to learn new words today."

Uncle Number Six waved a tiny comb. "Let me braid your hair."

Uncle Number Seven carried a fruit platter. "Have some fruit first."

The little girl found herself surrounded by eight doting uncles, her face lighting up with joy.

The grown men scrambled to fulfill their princess's every wish.

Grandma's voice boomed from downstairs. "Come eat breakfast! Stop spoiling that child!"

All eight uncles instinctively ducked their heads.

Fubao covered her mouth and giggled, her eyes crinkling like crescent moons. "Uncles got scolded again~"

She bounced toward the stairs, making all eight men chase after her. "Slow down! Don't fall!"

In the dining room, Grandma pretended to frown while secretly slipping the largest fried egg onto Fubao's plate.

"Thank you, Grandma~" the little girl chirped.

The uncles watched with puppy-dog eyes. "Mom, where's ours?"

Grandma glared. "Don't you have hands?"

Fubao's laughter filled the morning with warmth and joy.

The aroma of the Forgetfulness Elixir drifted across the Naihe Bridge.

Little three-year-old Fubao stood on tiptoes, peering curiously.

"Granny, does this soup really make people forget everything?"

The Soul Ferrywoman didn't look up, mechanically ladling the brew.

"Drink it and you'll be reborn."

Footprints trailed across the snow. Xiao Jiuyue stared at the half-empty dining table where the pot still bubbled merrily.

"Sister, why did Third Brother leave so suddenly?" Xiao Jiayuan frowned.

"They'd cheer me on!" Xiao Jiayuan grinned. "Sister, may I visit the county seat on my day off?"

Sophia Laurent's gaze lingered on the gilded tea set displayed on the auction block.

She had gambled and won.

A cool, feminine voice cut through the room.

All eyes turned toward the source.

Sophia sat poised in her seat, a faint smile playing on her lips.

Forty million—she couldn't possibly match that.

###Chapter 348

The board members passed around the detailed financial report, its pages clearly marked with data from Vincent Valdemar's tenure.

Someone gasped audibly.

Vincent shot to his feet, the papers trembling slightly in his grip.

He narrowed his eyes at Sophia.

This little upstart dared to pull such a move.

"I admit my initial inexperience," Vincent suddenly softened his tone. "But I'm not the same man I was years ago—"

His gaze flicked meaningfully toward Sophia.

Whispers rippled through the boardroom.

A faint smile touched Sophia's lips.

"Shall we review Alexander's first-quarter report instead?"

Her fingertip pressed a button, illuminating the projector screen.

The dancing data curves left everyone breathless.

One board member absently stroked his chin.

Vincent's fists clenched.

"Alexander is lying in a hospital bed!" His voice rose sharply. "Are we really going to let some inexperienced girl—"

He cut himself off, realizing his blunder too late.

Sophia chuckled softly.

"Today's discussion is about the Eden Project." She pushed forward another document. "This proposal bears Alexander's personal signature."

The rustle of turning pages filled the room.

Vincent ground his molars until they ached.

She'd outmaneuvered him again.

Mentioning Alexander had been a mistake.

The old foxes' eyes gleamed with new interest.

Sophia lifted her teacup, her clear eyes visible through the rising steam.

Vincent suddenly met her piercing gaze.
###Chapter 349

Those icy eyes held unmistakable mockery.

Vincent Valdemar's chest tightened. His fingers clenched involuntarily.

Every shareholder's gaze in the boardroom was fixed on him. He had no choice but to suppress his fury.

Alexander's proposal outlined transforming the Eden Project into Asia's largest integrated resort.

The vast suburban expanse was precisely why the land had remained undeveloped for so long.

Watching the shareholders' wavering expressions, Vincent gritted his teeth.

"Gentlemen," his voice rose sharply, "don't forget the dividends I've promised."

He feigned distress, pressing fingers to his temple. "As a father, seeing Alexander hospitalized pains me more than anyone. But Valdemar Group cannot descend into chaos."

"Your livelihoods depend on its stability."

His words had the intended effect. Shareholders lifted their heads attentively.

"As for the Eden Project, we'll revisit it another day."

"Now, I propose revoking Sophia Laurent's authority as acting CEO."

He'd already secured the votes.

The Patriarch had been maneuvered away. By the time he realized what happened, it would be too late.

Then the project's fate would rest solely in Vincent's hands.

Sophia tapped the table lightly with her fingertips.

So this was outright theft.

Her rapport with these old foxes couldn't compare to Vincent's long-standing relationships.

Those supporting her did so out of respect for the Patriarch and Alexander.

Judging by the atmosphere, Vincent must have promised substantial incentives.

Her gaze flickered.

If he was playing dirty, she needn't hold back either.

As long as she refused to surrender the corporate seal, Vincent couldn't touch her.

Once the Patriarch noticed something amiss, he'd intervene.

This realization relaxed Sophia. She leaned back leisurely, surveying the room with an amused half-smile.

That look ignited Vincent's temper.

"Sophia," he snapped, "hand over the seal. Let's keep this civil."

She didn't even bother looking at him.

This was a test of patience now.

Being ignored finally shattered Vincent's composure.

"What's this attitude? I'm your elder!"

The boardroom doors burst open.

A razor-sharp voice cut through the tension:

"So you do remember being an elder?"
###Chapter 350

The deep, icy voice cut through the air like a blade.

Every person in the boardroom stiffened.

Heads turned toward the entrance in unison.

Sophia Laurent sensed the shift in atmosphere instantly.

She turned.

Her breath caught.

A man stood at the doorway, his presence commanding the room.

His chiseled features were sharp, his posture tall and imposing. Dark eyes gleamed with quiet authority.

Alexander Valdemar.

Silence swallowed the boardroom.

Vincent Valdemar's face drained of color.

Memories of being overshadowed by Alexander flooded back.

His fingers trembled against the table.

Alexander had never lifted a finger against him—yet always outshone him effortlessly.

Even shareholders who once supported Vincent had defected to Alexander's side.

And Alexander? He regarded Vincent with nothing but cold indifference.

The worst part? Every decision Alexander opposed had proven correct in the end.

Now, Vincent couldn't even meet his son's piercing gaze.

That sharp stare made his instincts scream at him to flee.

But Alexander didn't spare him a glance.

Henry Chamberlain brought forward a chair. Alexander took his seat beside Sophia.

"Ms. Laurent."

His voice was like winter pine—cool, crisp, with a hint of cedar.

Sophia's pulse quickened, despite her usual composure.

Henry cleared his throat. "Mr. Valdemar is attending as a shareholder. Please proceed with the meeting, Ms. Laurent."

The message was clear: Sophia remained in control.

Yet Alexander's mere presence beside her made the room tense.

Sophia steadied herself. "Any thoughts on the proposal?"

The previously indecisive shareholders fell silent.

Vincent shot a pointed look at one of his allies.

The man swallowed hard. "Ms. Laurent, the Eden Project land would be ideal for luxury villas—"

Alexander's gaze flicked toward him.

The shareholder broke into a cold sweat.

The temperature in the room seemed to plummet.

Vincent's supporters lowered their heads.

An Alexander-aligned shareholder seized the moment. "Ms. Laurent, you believe the amusement park has more potential?"

Sophia nodded smoothly. "Modern families prioritize shared experiences. The theme park market shows consistent growth—"

She outlined Alexander's proposed entertainment complex in detail.

Another shareholder immediately voiced agreement.
###Chapter 351

The conference room was dead silent.

Director Zhang was the first to rise, slamming his documents onto the table. "I support Madam Laurent's decision!" His gaze swept across the room. "Who else shares my view?"

This veteran shareholder had always been Alexander's staunchest ally, previously clashing most fiercely with Vincent's faction.

With someone taking the lead, the situation became crystal clear.

The wavering shareholders had already made up their minds the moment Alexander walked in.

The most uncomfortable were those early investors tied to Vincent's interests. Beads of sweat formed on their foreheads, yet they dared not even breathe loudly.

Their negligible share percentages couldn't possibly sway the outcome.

The game was over.

No one dared mention returning the company seal to Sophia again.

Vincent shoved his chair back violently, sending papers scattering across the floor. He stormed out, slamming the door behind him with a thunderous expression.

Alexander's supporters exhaled in relief, stepping forward to exchange pleasantries.

"Glad to see you've recovered, Mr. Valdemar. We'll take our leave now."

The neutral faction hastily followed suit with their goodbyes.

Alexander remained expressionless, not even bothering to glance their way.

Henry smoothly gestured. "You're dismissed."

Only when the room emptied did Sophia notice her slightly damp palms.

It wasn't nervousness—just discomfort at being alone with Alexander.

She'd heard too many legends about this man's dominance in the business world. At various events where she'd glimpsed him from afar, he'd always been surrounded like the moon among stars.

Now, the crisp scent of pinewood lingered between them.

Sophia pressed her lips together, about to speak—

"Mr. Valdemar—"

"Miss Laurent—"

Their voices overlapped.

Alexander's long fingers flexed against his knees. "You first." His tone remained cool but carried three degrees more warmth than before.

This subtle shift eased Sophia's tension.

"Our engagement was purely accidental." She met his gaze directly. "Now that you're awake, Valdemar Holdings should rightfully return to you."

She paused, her voice steady. "Rest assured, I won't use this to cling to you."

A flicker of surprise crossed Alexander's eyes.

The young woman before him had clear, guileless eyes—startlingly transparent.

He suddenly recalled that press conference where she'd claimed to have admired him for years.

So this was...

The corner of his mouth lifted. What a clever girl.

"I understand." He gave a slight nod.
###Chapter 352

Seeing Sophia's resolute attitude, Alexander knew further persuasion would be futile.

"Ms. Laurent, you've worked hard these past months."

His long fingers tapped the mahogany desk with restrained rhythm.

"Valdemar Group rewards merit. Legal will draft the agreement—state your terms."

He paused, the words "terminating our engagement" poised on his lips when the conference door burst open.

"Mr. Valdemar!"

Henry Chamberlain rushed in, beads of sweat glistening on his forehead.

His gaze flickered to Sophia for a fleeting second before darting away.

Alexander's brow furrowed.

"Excuse us." He turned to Sophia. "Five minutes?"

She noted Henry's agitation.

Smoothing her skirt, she rose.

"I'll wait in your office."

The conference room felt stifling. She needed air.

"Report."

"We found Tiffany Morrison."

Alexander's fingers clenched.

"Arrange the meeting."

That hazy night flashed through his mind—the girl hadn't resisted.

Dawn had forced his departure, leaving only his card and Patek Philippe behind.

Yet she'd never contacted him.

The erased security footage had made the search excruciating.

"Sir..."

He extended a dossier.

"Our investigation confirms Tiffany Morrison is Ms. Laurent."

Alexander's pupils contracted.

"Repeat that."
###Chapter 353

"We've verified the identities of all female guests at the hotel that night." Henry Chamberlain placed the investigation report on the desk. "Although the hotel surveillance was deleted, cross-referencing surrounding cameras and the banquet guest list confirmed Tiffany Morrison's true identity."

Tiffany Morrison...

Alexander Valdemar stared at the report, his fingers absently tapping the desk.

The office fell into silence.

Recognizing the CEO's unreadable expression, Henry quietly excused himself.

Pearl Group CEO's Office.

Sophia Laurent lounged in an armchair by the floor-to-ceiling window. Sunlight streamed through the glass, gilding her hair with gold.

Her workload had decreased significantly since Alexander woke up.

Oliver Granger handled Pearl Group's daily operations, leaving Sophia to focus on major decisions. The Versini Couture design competition was her only recent public appearance.

The thought of upcoming leisure time made her lips curve unconsciously.

The office door opened.

Alexander stood at the threshold, his gaze settling on the sunlit woman. She squinted slightly like a contented cat, bathed in a soft glow.

"Sorry to keep you waiting." He approached quietly.

Sophia turned with an unchanged smile. "No problem."

She waited for him to continue.

Several seconds of silence passed.

"Ms. Laurent." Alexander sat across from her, his voice low. "I need your help with something."

Sophia arched a brow. "Oh?"

"Valdemar Group is currently unstable." His expression remained neutral. "Our recent public appearance as a couple means divorcing now would affect stock prices."

Her brows furrowed slightly.

He'd agreed readily during their meeting.

"Mr. Valdemar means...?" She kept her tone even.

"Maintaining the marriage." Alexander met her gaze directly. "One hundred million per year. Pearl Group becomes Valdemar's preferred partner. I won't interfere in your life—strictly business."

He stated it clinically, as if negotiating a routine deal.

Only he knew his palms had grown damp.

Sophia swallowed her immediate refusal.

The offer was too tempting.

She studied the man opposite her—immaculate suit, impassive demeanor, not a single crack in his composure.
###Chapter 354

Sophia's fingers trembled slightly as she processed Alexander's offer.

The nine-figure annual salary burned in her palm.

Even hotter was the preferential partnership agreement—a golden ticket to elevate Pearl Entertainment into the elite circle.

Alexander tapped the mahogany desk with his manicured fingers. "Have you made your decision, Ms. Laurent?"

Sunlight streamed through the floor-to-ceiling windows, making her squint.

His fountain pen left an ink blot on the document.

Her head snapped up.

The project her dying father had obsessed over.

###Chapter 355

The shareholders who had been so arrogant moments ago fell silent the instant Alexander Valdemar entered the room. Sophia Laurent observed their reaction with narrowed eyes. This wasn't mere fear.

No one would refuse such an olive branch.

When he smiled, he seemed bathed in golden light.

She didn't want to owe him any more favors.

###Chapter 356

Sunset gilded the young woman in golden light as she stood there, eyes sparkling with quiet amusement.
###Chapter 357

Sophia bent to slide into the seat, her voice cool. "Mr. Valdemar."

Her tone was polite yet distant, as if addressing a stranger.

The accident was indeed his fault.

###Chapter 362

The Patriarch scoffed. "I'll naturally arrange a proper wedding for them."

"Mother, calm down—"

Alexander had been born during his parents' happiest period, and the Matriarch had indeed spoiled him rotten.

Whether releasing Sophia or marrying someone else, either outcome would serve their purpose.

Adrian Valdemar clenched his fists, barely containing his anger.

Sophia lowered her head to hide her amusement.

Who still played the guilt-tripping card in this day and age?

The Matriarch glared. "We only want what's best for him!"

"Stop being unreasonable."

The Patriarch slammed the table. "Leave if you've lost your appetite."

If not for him, Sophia wouldn't have been subjected to such unwarranted hostility tonight.

Decades of marital bonds weren't easily severed.

Coward!

Their conversation turned to business matters.

Sophia's hand stilled around a grape.

"Why would I be angry with him?"
###Chapter 367

Hadn't it only been a short while?

Six men surrounded Sophia in the footage, the grotesque scene making his fingers tighten around the device.

The second was the original hotel surveillance footage.

It documented the entire process of Sophia being drugged.

Ethan Winston noticed Alexander's darkening expression and lowered his voice. "This is my fault."

The footage showed him personally escorting Sophia back to her room after the gala.

Alexander's gaze sharpened like a blade. "You should take responsibility."

Gavin pulled Sophia aside by the window, his voice strained. "Sophia, the whole internet is spreading—"

Sophia stared at the hallway footage, her blood turning to ice.

In the clip, she stumbled into a man's arms, clearly disoriented.

When the man turned—it was Alexander's face.

"This is doctored!" She jerked her head up.

Alexander strode over and shoved his phone in front of her.

Two videos played side by side.

One was the viral "scandal footage."

The other was the authentic hotel surveillance.

Sophia's face drained of color. "Someone is trying to ruin me."

Ethan slammed his fist against the wall. "I'll find out who leaked the footage!"

The reporters' shouts filtered through the door.

"Ms. Laurent, care to comment on the video's authenticity?"

"What is your relationship with Mr. Valdemar?"

Gavin shielded Sophia, his voice shaking. "What do we do now?"

Alexander suddenly grasped Sophia's hand.

His fingers were cold, but his tone was firm. "Come with me."

Ethan blocked their path. "Where are you taking her?"

Alexander's gaze was razor-sharp. "To fix this."

Sophia watched the two men face off and let out a soft, humorless laugh.

She pulled her hand free and straightened her collar.

"I'll handle it myself."

Under their stunned gazes, she turned and yanked open the lounge door.

Blinding camera flashes instantly swallowed her.
###Chapter 392

Ethan Winston's eyes darkened at Alexander Valdemar's icy tone.

"I understand."

He had originally believed Sophia Laurent left the hotel on her own that night.

Now with the video exposed, he vaguely recalled handing Sophia over to someone else himself.

"I'll take full responsibility."

Ethan's voice was resolute. "No matter what she's been through, my feelings won't change."

Alexander seemed perplexed by his stance.

His gaze swept over Ethan coldly. "Unnecessary."

He pocketed his phone, his voice low.

"Sophia is mine. Responsibility isn't yours to claim."

Ethan frowned deeply.

"What do you mean?"

His tone was disbelieving. "You'd still stay with Sophia after this?"

Alexander's voice remained calm. "If she wishes it."

"I can't comprehend this."

Ethan shook his head. "You two share no special bond. Why go to such lengths?"

A shadow flickered through Alexander's eyes. "You wouldn't understand."

But he offered no explanation, striding past Ethan toward Sophia.

Sophia's face was frosty after viewing the footage.

"Director Gavin, that woman isn't me."

Though the resemblance was uncanny, it absolutely wasn't her.

Gavin Winslow exhaled in relief.

"Thank goodness."

His back had been drenched in cold sweat watching the video.

If even he was this shocked, Sophia's reaction was understandable.

Thankfully, it wasn't her.

Realization dawned on Gavin, his expression turning furious. "This is clearly an attempt to ruin you."

His voice was urgent. "The public already believes it's real. What do we do now?"

Sophia's eyes were glacial. "We need irrefutable proof to clear my name."

Otherwise, the public wouldn't believe her.

Gavin looked troubled. "But whoever released this must have destroyed the original..."

Sophia had anticipated this.

When she'd gone to check the hotel surveillance, she was told all footage from that night was missing.

The thought made her heart heavier.

Remembering the reporters' aggressive behavior earlier, she could already foresee the harassment to come.

She'd likely be hounded by journalists wherever she went.

Just as frustration threatened to overwhelm her, a cool voice cut through.

"Ms. Laurent, a word."

She turned to meet Alexander's penetrating gaze.

Before Sophia could respond, another figure intervened.

"Sophia..."

Ethan's face was etched with guilt. "No matter what happens, I'll stand by you. I won't judge you. After the divorce, I'll propose to you publicly—"

Sophia had intended to ignore him.

But his words piqued her interest. "Really?"

Encouraged by her response, Ethan nodded emphatically. "Absolutely."
###Chapter 393

Sophia's lips curved slightly, but her eyes remained cold.

High society in the capital valued pedigree and reputation above all.

With the scandal raging online, how could the Winstons ever accept a daughter-in-law like her?

If Alexander insisted on marrying her, he might even lose his position as heir.

"Sophia, my parents are open-minded," Ethan said, avoiding her gaze. His voice lacked conviction.

"Really?" Sophia let out a light laugh. "Would the Winstons accept a woman entangled with six men?"

He thought the online bullying had driven her to delusion.

"And what about this child?" Sophia placed a hand on her abdomen, meeting his eyes directly.

Ethan's voice turned grim. "Get rid of it."

The Winstons might tolerate her for the sake of the Lowell Group.

But they would never accept another man's child.

Sophia's smile vanished.

Ethan jerked his head up.

"You're keeping that bastard?" His eyes widened in disbelief.

Sophia's gaze turned sharp as a blade.

"Ethan Winston!" She enunciated each word. "Call my child that again, and I won't hold back."

Ethan froze under her glare.

He'd never seen this side of Sophia before—cold, resolute, a stranger that unsettled him.

Sophia turned and walked toward Alexander.

"Let's talk inside," she said wearily, rubbing her temples.

Alexander followed silently.

In the lounge, Sophia collapsed onto the sofa, drained.

The day's events had unfolded too suddenly.

Seeing her pale face, Alexander's chest ached.

From their conversation, he'd guessed the truth.

That child... was likely his.

"Sophia, about the baby—" he began carefully.

The priority now was dealing with the online storm.

But the memory of that night at the hotel—he didn't know how to bring it up.
###Chapter 394

Sophia Laurent's fingers unconsciously tightened around her skirt when Alexander Valdemar posed his question.

She had believed the child was Ethan Winston's, but his attitude had shattered her heart.

Not only had Ethan denied paternity, but he'd looked at her with disgust—as if she were something filthy.

The composure she'd maintained in front of everyone crumbled.

"I don't know."

Her voice was feather-light, her lashes trembling slightly. "I truly don't know."

Growing up in an orphanage, she'd yearned for family but remained achingly alone. Keeping this child had been her one solace.

Now, even that was slipping away.

Suddenly, the warm scent of pine enveloped her.

Alexander had moved beside her without her noticing, drawing her into a gentle embrace.

It was perfect—supportive without being suffocating.

"Mr. Valdemar?"

Sophia looked up in confusion, meeting his deep gaze.

Seeing her reddened eyes and how the blue dress accentuated her fragility, his chest tightened inexplicably.

"I'm sorry."

"That night..." His Adam's apple bobbed. "I was at the gala too."

"Alexander Valdemar. Business legend." Her voice softened. "Hard to miss."

He chuckled, the stern lines of his face relaxing.

Sophia stared, momentarily entranced.

"A shame..." Alexander sighed.

"A shame?"

"That Mrs. Valdemar doesn't think much of me."

Her eyes widened. "What Mrs. Valdemar?"

He held her gaze, enunciating clearly.

"You."
###Chapter 395

Sophia's fingers trembled slightly as she instinctively took half a step back.

"It's not that I'm disgusted." Her voice was barely audible.

The moment the words left her lips, she regretted them.

They were strangers bound by a contractual marriage.

Sophia turned her face away, avoiding his eyes.

"You know my situation..."

She was carrying another man's child. This marriage shouldn't continue.

"And we..."

The thought of two strangers suddenly living under the same roof was suffocating.

Alexander's eyes dropped to her rounded belly, his Adam's apple bobbing.

"Sophia, there's something you should know."

She kept her head lowered. "What is it?"

"If we find the father, would you be with him?"

A thin layer of sweat formed on Alexander's palms as he asked.

Sophia's head snapped up. "What do you mean?"

After a weighted silence, Alexander pulled out his phone.

"Watch this first."

He played the video Henry had sent and handed it to Sophia.

The footage showed a glittering banquet hall.

A drunken Sophia was seen being helped out by Ethan.

Then the scene shifted to Emily appearing beside Ethan.

Sophia's pupils constricted.

After exchanging a few words, Ethan handed her over to Emily.

Emily guided her into an elevator.

The elevator stopped at the 83rd floor.

With one forceful shove, Emily pushed her out before quickly closing the doors.

An icy chill ran down Sophia's spine.

This was the beginning of the viral video.

In the surveillance footage, her drunken figure staggered down the hallway.

Six gangsters closed in around her.

Sophia's breathing turned ragged.

On screen, she was completely surrounded, crouching on the floor.

Then suddenly—she burst through the crowd—
###Chapter 396

Sophia Laurent stumbled free from the gangster's grasp.

Alcohol blurred her vision, but survival instinct drove her forward.

Shouts and chaotic footsteps echoed behind her.

She careened around a corridor corner and collided with a solid chest.

The faint scent of cedar drifted from the black suit.

"Sorry..." she slurred, making no move to pull away.

The man didn't push her off.

Crude curses erupted from the approaching gangsters.

"You bitch think you can run? I'll teach you a lesson tonight!"

Sophia trembled, fingers tightening around the man's sleeve.

"Help me..."

The man seemed drunk too. Her tug made him press fingers to his temple.

The gangsters closed in.

"Who's this pretty boy? Get lost!"

Someone shoved the man roughly.

He lifted his head slowly.

Dark eyes burned with terrifying ferocity.

Sophia's breath caught.

The man on screen was unmistakably Alexander Valdemar beside her.

"That night...it was you?" She turned in disbelief. "Why were you there?"

Alexander's expression darkened.

"More than just coincidence," he murmured.

On screen, the gangster's vulgar threat cut off as Alexander seized his wrist.

A swift judo throw slammed the man onto the floor.

Five others charged forward.

"Take out this meddling bastard first!"

Amid the chaos, Alexander moved with lethal precision.

But Sophia noticed his unsteady footing, the sweat beading at his temples.

Soon all five gangsters lay moaning on the ground.

Alexander braced against the wall, breathing ragged.
###Chapter 397

The gangsters lay sprawled on the ground, groaning in pain.

Alexander Valdemar didn't even glance at them as he strode forward.

Sophia Laurent peeked out from the corner. Seeing him leave, she hurried after him.

"Ah!"

A grimy hand suddenly seized her ankle.

Alexander whirled around and kicked the hand away.

Trembling, Sophia clutched his sleeve.

Like a frightened rabbit, she followed him into the hotel suite.

The surveillance footage froze on the moment the door closed.

Sophia stared at her phone screen, fingers shaking slightly.

So that night...

She had willingly followed Alexander into the room?

Her mind went blank.

"I'm sorry."

Alexander's voice was rough. "I was drugged that night."

His Adam's apple bobbed. "I hurt you."

Sophia lowered her lashes. "It wasn't entirely your fault."

Sophia's ears burned.

Sophia murmured her thanks.

Only the hum of the air conditioner filled the room.

"Can we not divorce?"

Alexander's sudden question made Sophia's cheeks flush. She inched away.

"If it's just a contractual marriage..."

###Chapter 398

Sophia Laurent knew all too well that her relationship with Alexander Valdemar was far from intimate.

His refusal to divorce stemmed partly from business interests tied to Valdemar Holdings.

The other reason likely involved the unexpected child growing inside her.

She never imagined this baby would be Alexander's.

Under these circumstances, maintaining their contractual marriage seemed reasonable.

This was their scheduled prenatal appointment—the real reason he'd been waiting.

In the suite's living room, Ethan Winston sat with stormy eyes.

Gavin Winslow fidgeted beside him, worry etching his features.

Alexander and Sophia emerged side by side—one aristocratic and imposing, the other radiantly beautiful. A painfully perfect match.

"If you cared, you'd convince her to abort that bastard!"

Ethan froze, staring at their retreating figures in disbelief.

Madness.

Alexander had clearly lost his mind!

In the hotel's underground parking lot, Daniel Lowell slumped against his car seat.
###Chapter 399

Sophia Laurent's poised figure at the judges' panel lingered in Daniel Lowell's mind.

He sat conspicuously in the front row, yet failed to earn even a glance from her.

Had their lives not been swapped all those years ago, they wouldn't have been separated for decades.

They wouldn't have ended up like this.
###Chapter 400

Richard Lowell glared at Daniel's mocking expression. He grabbed the purple clay teapot from the coffee table and hurled it at him.

The only sister he acknowledged was Sophia Laurent.

Not that cuckoo bird who stole her nest.

"River Banquet" was about to premiere, elevating Emily Lowell's status.

William Lowell drowning in corporate affairs;

Nathan Lowell drowning his sorrows in alcohol;

Christopher Lowell still running around for Sophia's sake;

"That girl this time... she's probably ruined for good."

They called her shameless, said she deserved her suffering.

Claiming a gangster's bastard should miscarry to spare society the trouble.

"Mom, netizens have short attention spans... If sister just lays low for a while..."

Mr. Valdemar had just called—it was time to spring the trap.

###Chapter 401

Alexander Valdemar's slender fingers tapped twice on the desk, his gaze icy.

Her chest pressed against him. His lips twisted into a sneer.

###Chapter 422

He answered in front of her.

###Chapter 423

###Chapter 425 The Secret Floor

###Chapter 426

Top corporations worldwide struggled to develop medical robotics with little success.

Her eyes widened in disbelief.

Vincent Valdemar opened his mouth to speak but was promptly ushered out.

Sebastian Valdemar wisely pulled his younger brother away.

Once the commotion settled, Patriarch Valdemar massaged his temples wearily.

"My apologies for the spectacle."

Guests quickly smoothed things over.

"The Matriarch is elderly. It's understandable she'd be upset."

"Time will ease her concerns."

The Patriarch gave no response. Turning to Sophia, his face softened into a grandfatherly smile.

"Sign the papers, my dear."

Sophia hesitated, glancing at Alexander.

The man looked exceptionally tall in his cream-colored suit. He took the documents and flipped them open for her.

"Accept Grandfather's gift."

Sophia clutched the pen uncertainly.

Alexander leaned in, his whisper brushing her ear. "Sign and become Mrs. Valdemar. Or don't..."

The pen finally touched paper.

Patriarch Valdemar nodded in satisfaction, as if the earlier scene had never occurred.
###Chapter 437

Patriarch Valdemar's usually stern face was now radiant with smiles, the wrinkles at his eyes smoothing out. "Good, very good. Sophia, if this brat ever dares to mistreat you, come straight to me. I'll teach him a proper lesson."

His open favoritism toward Sophia Laurent was on full display before all the guests.

This was his genuine attitude.

Sophia met the old man's affectionate gaze with a slight curve of her lips. "Don't worry, Grandfather. He treats me very well."

"Haha, that's good to hear."

Patriarch Valdemar instructed his staff to carefully store the congratulatory gifts, arranging a special vehicle to deliver them to Westmount Villa.

After exchanging a few more pleasantries with Sophia, he excused himself to rest due to fatigue.

Many older guests took the cue to depart, leaving the banquet hall to business associates discussing deals and younger attendees brought by their elders for networking.

Once the patriarch left, Alexander Valdemar was pulled away by several business partners.

Soon, Sophia found herself surrounded by unfamiliar faces. She exchanged polite greetings before gracefully extricating herself.

The autumn night carried a slight chill. Tree shadows swayed in the garden, accompanied by the occasional chirp of cicadas.

A cool breeze brushed through her hair as Sophia settled onto a bench.

Unseen bodyguards maintained vigilant watch nearby.

Just as she was enjoying this moment of tranquility, a shrill voice shattered the peace.

"Look how triumphant you are tonight, sister!"

Sophia looked up, surprised to see Emily Lowell whom she hadn't encountered in months.

Her eyebrow arched slightly. "How did you get in?"

Given Sophia's estrangement from the Lowell family, no invitation had been extended to them.

The question instantly struck a nerve.

Emily had always sailed through life smoothly. Even after the truth of her parentage emerged, Sophia remained beneath her—merely a pawn of the Lowell family.

But since marrying into the Valdemars, Sophia had climbed to heights Emily could only envy.

This position should have been hers.

If not for her "generosity," how could Sophia enjoy such glory?

Flames of jealousy burned in Emily's eyes. "What are you so proud of? If I hadn't given you this arranged marriage opportunity, where would you be today?"

Sophia regarded Emily's contorted expression with an amused chuckle.

"Emily Lowell, have you forgotten something fundamental?"

"What?"

"That you were born to butchers? That your biological parents were despicable thieves?"

Sophia's tone remained calm as she leaned back casually on the bench, a faint smile playing on her lips. "As for you 'giving' me the marriage opportunity—that's the real joke."

Not only did the marriage never rightfully belong to Emily, but she had explicitly rejected it when Alexander was comatose, forcing Sophia to take her place.

Watching Emily's face twist further, Sophia raised an eyebrow. "What's wrong? Having regrets now that Alexander has woken up?"

Emily trembled violently. Her gaze fell on Sophia's slightly rounded abdomen, venom flashing in her eyes.

Just some cheap woman riding on her pregnancy!

Without this child, what worth did she have?

With a sudden lunge, Emily hurled herself at Sophia.

Anticipating the move, Sophia sidestepped neatly.

"Thud—"

Emily crashed heavily into the bench.

A piercing scream tore through the garden. "Ah—!"
###Chapter 438

Sophia Laurent heard rapid footsteps approaching from behind and immediately stood up in alert.

She took two steps back to create distance as her bodyguard swiftly moved to shield her.

Emily Lowell's outstretched hand grasped empty air as she collided heavily with the backrest of the bench.

"Ah!"

Her knees hit the hard ground with a painful thud.

"Sophia! How despicable!" Emily glared up with fury.

Sophia arched an eyebrow. "You tried to push me, then blame me when you fell?"

The shrill scream drew curious glances from nearby guests.

Emily's eyes flickered before instantly transforming into a pitiful expression.

Her choice of pink chiffon dress now accentuated her fragile vulnerability.

"Sister, I know you're jealous of me..."

Her voice trembled with feigned emotion. "I just came to wish Patriarch Valdemar happy birthday. Why would you treat me like this?"

The onlookers' gazes toward Sophia turned judgmental.

"Nonsense!" The bodyguard snapped. "You attacked first!"

Emily flinched and turned away, deliberately displaying the scrapes on her knees.

"Emily!"

Ryan Cunningham rushed over and helped her up with visible concern.

"Is this how the Valdemar heiress treats her sister?" He glared at Sophia.

Sophia gave a light laugh.

"First, we share no blood relation."

"Second, my bodyguard stated the facts."

Ryan refused to listen.

He had to defend Emily—she'd promised to obtain Dr. Quincy's research data.

"Alexander!" Ryan turned abruptly. "Is this Valdemar hospitality?"

All eyes shifted toward Alexander Valdemar.

Such an accusation could indeed damage the Valdemar reputation.

Emily hid in Ryan's embrace, flashing Sophia a triumphant look.

She'd nearly choked on envy upon seeing that three-billion welcome gift.

All this should have been hers!

If only she hadn't let Sophia take her arranged marriage spot...
###Chapter 439

This failed attempt didn't matter.

If she could use this opportunity to drive a wedge between Alexander and Sophia, forcing her out of the Valdemar family, it would be a godsend.

Alexander remained composed under the crowd's skeptical gazes. "Ryan Cunningham," he said calmly, "jumping to conclusions without thorough investigation is reckless."

Adrian stood behind him, his voice icy. "Exactly. Making judgments based on one-sided accusations isn't wise."

He stared at Emily's deliberately fragile expression, disgust churning in his stomach. This woman was clearly scheming—how dare she frame his sister-in-law?

With both sides sticking to their stories, the truth was hard to discern.

The Valdemar Manor sprawled across vast grounds, shaded by lush trees. This remote corner lay beyond the surveillance cameras' reach.

Emily had counted on that when she brazenly set up her trap.

The standoff continued.

Emily tugged at Ryan's sleeve, her eyes glistening with unshed tears. "Ryan, let it go... Sophia couldn't have meant it. I don't blame her."

Her act of false magnanimity only reinforced the "fact" that Sophia had pushed her.

Ryan gripped her hand protectively. "Emily, you're the future matriarch of the Cunningham family. I won't let you suffer any injustice."

He turned to Alexander, his tone frigid. "Mr. Valdemar, my fiancée was injured in your home. A simple apology from your wife will settle this without affecting our business relations."

On the surface, it sounded reasonable—just a verbal apology.

The guests murmured in agreement:

"Miss Lowell did get hurt. An apology isn't too much to ask."

"Her injuries should be treated first."

"Sibling squabbles happen..."

Their whispers implied that Sophia would be petty not to apologize.

Alexander's expression darkened.

Adrian exploded. "You call this a birthday celebration? This was a setup against my sister-in-law!"

He smirked coldly. "Oh, I remember now—Miss Lowell here has quite the grudge against Sophia..."
###Chapter 440

Most guests were unaware of the past conflicts between Sophia Laurent and Emily Lowell.

But Adrian Valdemar was different.

To get closer to Sophia, he had thoroughly investigated her feud with the Lowell family.

"You enjoyed all the privileges as the Lowell heiress, yet caused trouble everywhere after the real daughter returned. Now you're bringing these tricks to the Valdemar family?"

Adrian sneered. "Too bad we're not blind like the Lowells..."

Emily's face paled.

She finally recognized him as the actor who played the Young Marquis in "Empress."

"Mr. Valdemar, must you humiliate me just to defend your sister-in-law?"

The guests were surprised by the Valdemars' fierce protection of Sophia.

It was just an apology. Why such a strong reaction?

Several guests with business ties to the Cunninghams spoke up.

"As hostess, shouldn't Mrs. Valdemar apologize when a guest falls?"

But Valdemar allies immediately countered.

"Didn't you hear Emily was the one who crashed into her? Does being Ryan Cunningham's fiancée give her license to twist the truth?"

All eyes turned to Alexander Valdemar.

Sophia rested her chin on one hand, smiling at him with amusement.

Alexander met her gaze.

His heart softened. He gently stroked her hair.

"I won't let you be wronged."

Under the warm golden lights, the strikingly handsome man gazed tenderly at his delicate wife—a breathtaking scene.

The crowd was stunned by the rare gentleness from this usually aloof man.

When Alexander looked up, his eyes turned icy.

"Call the police," he ordered coldly. "Ryan Cunningham's fiancée attempted to murder my wife and unborn child."

Gasps filled the room as guests stepped back.

Adrian's eyes lit up.

"Attempted murder with solid evidence. Brilliant move!"

Ryan's face darkened.

"Alexander, are you declaring war on the Cunninghams? The Valdemars are being too arrogant in front of all these people!"

He tried to turn other families against the Valdemars.

Alexander surveyed the crowd, his voice steady and commanding.

"Anyone who harms my wife and child will face the full consequences."

The guests who had been swayed by Ryan now understood.

Protecting one's family was only natural. What was wrong with that?
###Chapter 441

The Cunninghams have finally shown their true colors.

After playing second fiddle for so long, their ambition has grown unchecked. How dare they bare their fangs at the Valdemars?

Today's farce was clearly orchestrated by the Cunninghams.

They sought to tarnish the Valdemar name in high society.

But Alexander Valdemar isn't one to be trifled with.

"Ryan Cunningham, I won't forget this insult to my family," Alexander said, his voice icy.

Ryan smirked. "Alexander, I'll repay today's humiliation tenfold."

"Be my guest." Alexander's tone was dismissive.

Emily Lowell stood nearby, her eyes glinting with malice.

She hadn't expected Alexander to defend Sophia so fiercely.

Not even a simple apology could be negotiated.

No matter.

As long as Sophia's reputation took a hit, her goal was achieved.

Bodyguards blocked their path with stone-faced efficiency.

"No one leaves until the police arrive."

Ryan whirled around, livid. "Alexander! You've crossed a line!"

Alexander adjusted his cufflinks leisurely. "Weren't you the ones demanding justice?"

Adrian Valdemar wrinkled his nose as he sidled up to Sophia.

"Let's step back, sis. These two reek of desperation."

The crowd instinctively gave them wider berth.

Ryan trembled with rage. "Show some respect now, and I might spare you later!"

Adrian made a show of cleaning his ear. "With what? The Cunningham fortune couldn't buy a Valdemar fingernail."

"You—"

Ryan's fists clenched.

Dr. Preston Quincy's research would be completed soon.

With that technology, the Cunninghams would rise to power.

"Mark my words! Valdemar's reign is ending!"

Alexander didn't even blink. "We'll see."

Sirens wailed in the distance.

As Emily was led away, her mind raced with contingency plans.

The Valdemars' retaliation only proved Sophia's importance.

Guests exchanged knowing glances.

Who would dare underestimate the Valdemar heiress now?

Sophia watched their retreating figures, a thoughtful smile playing on her lips.

She remembered the shadowy figure outside Dr. Quincy's office.

The banquet lasted well into the night.

Behind the Valdemar Manor's artificial rocks, two figures whispered.

"Did you hear? The Patriarch gifted his granddaughter-in-law a dowry worth over three billion!"

"Tsk tsk. Mrs. Valdemar has truly ascended to the highest branch..."
###Chapter 442

"Oh my god, how wonderful it would be to marry the Valdemar heir!"

"Absolutely! I heard Patriarch Valdemar's welcome gift for his grandson's bride is worth three billion!"

Behind the rockery, Jasmine Keane clenched the hem of her dress.

She'd deliberately worn her most expensive white dress today. Though the fabric was slightly coarse, the design was refreshingly elegant.

Beside her, Julian Valdemar fidgeted with the gift box in his arms, his shirt cuffs slightly yellowed.

"Maybe... we should just go back," Julian murmured.

Jasmine whirled around, impatience flashing in her eyes.

Ever since being cast out from the Valdemar family, Julian had become timid. His monthly salary of ten thousand couldn't even afford the handbag she wanted.

"Don't you want to see your grandfather?" she softened her tone, "And Alexander... he just woke up..."

Julian's gaze wavered.

He did miss his family. But in his current state, he could only afford the cheapest gifts...

Recognizing his hesitation, Jasmine sighed dramatically. "Fine. It's not like Patriarch Valdemar needs your blessings anyway."

The words pierced Julian's heart like needles.

Taking a deep breath, he strode toward the mansion's entrance.

A triumphant smile curled Jasmine's lips.

As the doorbell rang, she smoothed her dress, her eyes gleaming with calculation.

Three billion... enough to last her a lifetime.
###Chapter 443

What a complete fool!

That worthless Julian Valdemar actually left the Valdemar estate without a fight after Sophia Laurent kicked him out?

Didn't he know he could go complain to Patriarch Valdemar?

Even if he didn't dare make a scene, couldn't he at least pretend to be pitiful?

Such a spineless coward!

The Valdemar estate gates slowly creaked open, revealing a middle-aged maid.

"Young Master Julian, what brings you here?"

Her expression suddenly darkened as she remembered something.

"Tonight is the Patriarch's birthday banquet. Do you have an invitation?"

Jasmine Keane's eyes widened in disbelief.

How dare a servant speak to them like this?

What shocked her more was Julian's reaction. Instead of anger, his face showed only apology.

"Aunt Sunny, my apologies for disturbing you. I don't have an invitation, but could you please inform Grandfather that I've come to wish him a happy birthday?"

The maid nodded curtly.

"Wait here."

The gates closed again.

Jasmine gritted her teeth in fury.

Once she married into the Valdemar family, this old hag would be the first one she'd fire!

How dare a servant block her master from entering his own home!

But now wasn't the time to make a scene.

She sighed softly, adopting a fragile tone.

"Julian, it's all my fault for dragging you into this..."

Julian gently squeezed her hand.

"Don't say that. I'm actually happy with how things are."

Supporting the woman he loved through his own efforts filled him with satisfaction.

"I'll work hard to save enough money for our wedding."

Jasmine nearly rolled her eyes.

Wasn't inheriting the Valdemar fortune better?

Why not ask the Patriarch for support? Who did Sophia think she was?

"I don't care about a dowry..."

"That's not acceptable." Julian said firmly. "A dowry shows a man's sincerity."

"At my current salary, I'll have saved two hundred thousand in three years."

Jasmine almost laughed in his face.

Two hundred thousand? That wouldn't even buy one of her handbags!

"You're so thoughtful, Julian."

"Of course. You're my future wife."

As they spoke, the gates reopened.

"The Patriarch will see you now."

Julian exhaled in relief.

"Thank you, Aunt Sunny."

He took Jasmine's hand and hurried inside.

Jasmine greedily surveyed the magnificent estate.

This grand mansion should have been her home.

What expensive gift would the Patriarch give her?
###Chapter 444

Jasmine Keane followed Julian Valdemar in her high heels. Her heart pounded violently as they entered the banquet hall of the Valdemar mansion.

The crystal chandelier's glare made her squint.

Julian's palms grew damp with sweat.

He hadn't stepped foot in the Valdemar estate since that phone call months ago.

The birthday gift he brought was a lacquerware piece purchased with three months' salary.

"Grandfather, I wish you boundless happiness and eternal health."

The Patriarch's fingers hesitated briefly when accepting the gift.

Their last unpleasant encounter still lingered. Yet seeing his grandson's gaunt face, the old man's eyes softened.

"You've come a long way. That's enough."

Julian's tense shoulders visibly relaxed. "I'm glad you're not angry."

"Everyone has their own path." The Patriarch sipped his tea calmly.

Jasmine twisted her fingers anxiously.

"Grandfather Valdemar," she interjected with honeyed sweetness, "May your brilliance rival the sun and moon, your vitality never fade."

The Patriarch finally looked at her.

"And you are?"

Julian immediately clasped Jasmine's hand. "My girlfriend, Jasmine Keane."

The old man studied their joined hands for several seconds before sighing deeply.

"As long as you're certain."

Julian's eyes brightened. "Thank you, Grandfather!"

Jasmine nearly laughed aloud.

She eagerly echoed, "Thank you, Grandfather!"

The Patriarch abruptly set down his teacup.

"It's getting late. You should leave now."

Jasmine's smile froze.

She stared in disbelief as the old man rose with his cane.

Where was the lavish welcome she expected?

Where were the customary gifts?

That bitch Sophia Laurent got three billion, yet she didn't even receive a jewelry box!

Even in the taxi, Jasmine kept looking back.

The Valdemar mansion's lights grew distant as her nails dug into her palms.
###Chapter 445

Tiffany Sinclair lowered her lashes, the long fringe casting delicate shadows beneath her eyes.

She bit her lower lip lightly, suppressing the turbulent emotions swirling in her gaze.

Adrian Valdemar watched coldly as Julian Valdemar laughed with unrestrained delight across the room. An inexplicable fury ignited in his chest.

"What an idiot..."

Beside him, the doll-faced girl wore a haute couture gown in smoky gray, her hair elegantly pinned up to lend an air of maturity.

Those almond-shaped eyes concealed undercurrents of emotion—this was Tiffany Sinclair, Julian's fiancée.

Realizing his companion, Adrian quickly backtracked. "Don't take it to heart, Tiffany. Julian's just blinded by stupidity."

Tiffany suddenly laughed, revealing her signature little canine teeth. "I'm not upset."

She was merely calculating how to handle her parents' inevitable interrogation later. The Sinclair family had mapped out her life with precision—becoming the perfect Valdemar daughter-in-law.

Watching Alexander Valdemar's tender care for Sophia Laurent, a pang of bitterness rose in her chest.

Both were arranged marriages, yet she was publicly scorned by Julian while bearing the full weight of family expectations.

If Julian insisted on breaking the engagement...

The thought sent a chill through her fingertips. Since she was fourteen, everyone had told her she would marry into the Valdemar family.

Now, calling it off would make her the laughingstock of their entire social circle.

That was why she'd barely left home these past two years. Only Patriarch Valdemar's birthday banquet had forced her family to drag her here.

Fortunately, the old man had already retired, and her parents were busy socializing elsewhere. No one noticed the tension brewing in this corner.

Tiffany silently prayed the couple would leave quickly, but Julian began striding toward them. She immediately lowered her head, wishing she could vanish into the chair.

"Adrian, long time no see," Julian greeted with a smile.

Adrian rolled his eyes dramatically. "What's the point of seeing someone who's blind?" He gave a sarcastic thumbs-up. "Bravo, abandoning your family for a woman. Such backbone!"

Julian shook his head ruefully. "You'll understand when you find true love."

"Gag—" Adrian fake-retched. "Take your white lotus and get lost!"
###Chapter 446

Adrian's dismissive attitude made Julian decide not to press further.

He turned to bid farewell to Alexander and Sophia.

Jasmine suddenly grabbed his sleeve.

Her eyes reddened with unshed tears. "Young Master Adrian, have I done something wrong?"

Adrian scoffed. "Drop the act. Your tricks don't work on me."

Jasmine dabbed her eyes, voice trembling. "Miss Sinclair, I apologize. I didn't know about your history with Julian..."

Her tone shifted subtly. "But they're brothers after all..."

The implication was clear—Tiffany was stirring trouble between them.

Julian frowned.

He grasped Jasmine's hand firmly. "Adrian, Jasmine will be your sister-in-law soon."

His gaze flickered toward Tiffany.

That single glance ignited Adrian's fury.

"Eyes to yourself!" He slammed his glass down. "You think this fake deserves your attention?"

"Adrian!" Julian's rare anger surfaced. "One more word and we're done."

Adrian froze.

Then exploded. "You'd cut ties with me for her?"

"Not cutting ties." Julian's voice softened. "But if you can't get along, limited contact benefits everyone."

"Have you lost your mind?"

Adrian raised his fist, ready to strike.

Tiffany quickly intercepted him. "Don't be rash..."

Though volatile, Adrian stilled at her touch.

"She's clearly manipulating you and Julian!"

Tiffany shook her head. "It doesn't matter. I barely know them anyway."

She planned to offer token mediation.

Just enough to save face later.

To her surprise, Adrian actually heeded her.

"Tiff..." Adrian suddenly noticed her small canine teeth, his anger dissipating.

He grinned. "Julian's always been an idiot. Never good enough for you."

Tiffany coughed lightly. "That's not what I meant."

She addressed the couple. "Since Mr. Valdemar has found love, let's cancel the arranged marriage. I wish you both happiness."
###Chapter 447

Tiffany Sinclair's lips curved into a perfectly polite smile, her gaze as calm as still water.

Her slender fingers rested lightly on the champagne flute, exuding effortless grace.

Julian Valdemar found himself inexplicably unsettled by those clear almond-shaped eyes.

Their startling purity stirred a long-buried memory within him.

"Thank you for your understanding, Miss Sinclair." He quickly composed himself with a courteous nod.

Tiffany inclined her head slightly, her smile not reaching those fathomless eyes.

Beside them, Adrian Valdemar stood with a thunderous expression.

"Get lost if you're done." His voice dripped with undisguised hostility. "I'm not here to entertain your theatrics."

Julian merely shook his head in resignation, accustomed to his younger brother's temper.

"I should bid farewell to Alexander."

Taking Jasmine Keane's hand, he turned to leave. The girl's eyes glistened with unshed tears, her nails digging crescent moons into her palms.

Jasmine seethed with humiliation.

Adrian's public slight stung, but Julian's silence hurt more.

What infuriated her most was Julian's noticeably different demeanor toward that Sinclair heiress.

Across the ballroom, Alexander Valdemar had just concluded his conversation with several business magnates.

Sophia Laurent sat alone in the lounge area, scrolling through her phone.

"Sister-in-law."

She looked up to see Julian approaching with a teary-eyed Jasmine.

"Julian." Sophia pocketed her phone, her gaze flickering between the pair.

"Adrian's throwing another tantrum," Julian offered with a wry smile.

Sophia understood immediately.

Adrian's inexplicable animosity toward Jasmine had become legendary.

"You know how he is. Don't take it personally."

"Of course." Julian's tone remained gentle.

Their fraternal bond, forged through shared childhood, was impervious to outsiders.

Sophia studied Julian thoughtfully.

The Valdemar brothers were studies in contrast.

Alexander was a drawn sword—razor-sharp yet disciplined.

Julian resembled polished jade—unassuming yet invaluable.

Adrian burned like wildfire—all passion and no restraint.

"This must be Miss Keane?" Sophia broke the silence.

Julian blinked as if remembering his companion. "Yes, Jasmine. Last time—"

He trailed off awkwardly.

The memory of being tricked by Adrian into asking Sophia for money still made him cringe.
###Chapter 448

Julian Valdemar couldn't help but chuckle.

He had gained nothing from Sophia Laurent. Instead, he'd temporarily lost his inheritance rights to the Valdemar family.

Yet strangely, he found this outcome oddly satisfying.

Countless times before, Patriarch Valdemar had stubbornly insisted on the arranged marriage with the Sinclair family, refusing to budge.

The two families had deep collaborations across multiple industries, their interests intricately intertwined.

The marriage alliance served as a crucial bond maintaining this relationship. Its dissolution would bring unimaginable consequences.

The thought had given Julian endless headaches.

Now the old man had finally relented—undoubtedly out of respect for Sophia.

"Miss Keane, hello." Sophia nodded politely at Jasmine.

Jasmine's fingers tightened slightly at her sides, a shadow flickering through her eyes.

But in an instant, she conjured a sweet smile. "Hello, sister-in-law."

She used the term Julian had chosen.

Sophia didn't correct her.

She and Julian had agreed to a one-year trial.

If they lasted a year without breaking up, she would help him dissolve his engagement with Tiffany Sinclair.

But... would they really make it that far?

Sophia's lips curved slightly.

She hadn't missed the hatred in Jasmine's eyes or the whitened knuckles from clenched fists.

Alexander Valdemar chose that moment to enter.

"Brother!" Julian greeted him warmly. "Are you feeling better?"

Alexander gave a terse nod.

Julian, accustomed to his brother's aloofness, continued cheerfully, "Let me introduce you. This is Jasmine Keane."

He paused, voice firm. "The woman I want to spend my life with."

Alexander acknowledged with another nod.

He'd heard all about his brother's broken engagement and new romance from Henry Chamberlain during his hospital stay.

"It's getting late. You should head back."

Julian nodded. "Take care, sister-in-law."

As he led Jasmine away, he failed to notice the fury simmering in her eyes.

Jasmine was seething.

Julian hadn't mentioned a word about being kicked out of the Valdemar estate!

If Alexander learned Sophia had banished them while he was comatose, even if he didn't reprimand her, resentment would surely take root.

Between blood relatives and an outsider, Alexander's allegiance was obvious.

This could be their ticket back into the Valdemar fold—perhaps even reclaiming Julian's inheritance.

Without it, their current two-million monthly allowance would let them live lavishly.

Far better than scraping by like this!

Jasmine longed to crack open Julian's skull to see what nonsense filled it...

Sophia watched their retreating figures, her smile laced with quiet amusement.
###Chapter 449

"Alexander, he's your own cousin. You don't blame me for this, do you?"

Sophia Laurent tapped her fingers lightly on the table, watching the retreating figure through the window.

Alexander Valdemar didn't even lift his gaze. "He brought this upon himself."

"I heard he can't even afford rent now."

Sophia turned her attention back to Alexander's sharp profile.

The second son of the Valdemar family now wore faded shirts with frayed cuffs.

Alexander took a sip of tea. "He chose this path."

On the garden path, Jasmine Keane's heels crushed fallen leaves.

"Julian! Have you forgotten why we came here today?"

She spun around, chest heaving.

Julian Valdemar blinked before offering a gentle smile. "Don't be upset, Jasmine."

"Adrian has always been like this—even Patriarch Valdemar couldn't control him."

Jasmine rolled her eyes internally.

She forced a tight smile. "I don't mind. But why didn't you explain things properly?"

The wind caught her white skirt as she bit her lip. "I don't want you fighting with your family over me."

Julian scratched his head. "I think our current situation is fine."

Jasmine nearly choked.

"You really think this is fine?" Her voice trembled. "I don't want to burden you. You should stay and marry Tiffany Sinclair!"

She turned to flee.

Julian grabbed her arm. "Don't talk nonsense! How could I ever leave you?"

"But you were supposed to be the second heir..." Tears welled in Jasmine's eyes.

"If you hadn't saved me..." Julian hesitated. "I won't abandon you."

Jasmine's blood boiled.

Who wanted to squeeze into that roach-infested apartment with him?

"I don't care!" She shook off his grip. "Stop following me!"

She dashed into the street and hailed a cab.

Julian hurried after her.

Two hours later, the taxi stopped before a dilapidated apartment building.

"One hundred seventy-eight dollars." The driver drummed his fingers on the wheel.

Julian pulled out his phone—his face drained of color.

Insufficient balance notifications flooded the screen.
###Chapter 450

Julian Valdemar stared at his phone screen, fingers trembling slightly as the insufficient balance notification glared back at him.

He had grown up in luxury, never once worrying about money.

Now he couldn't even afford a 200-dollar cab fare.

The scanner emitted a sharp, mocking beep—payment declined.

The driver's puzzled gaze met his through the rearview mirror.

Julian swallowed hard, cheeks burning with humiliation.

"Just a moment."

His grip on the phone turned his knuckles white.

Last month when rent was due, all his so-called friends had made excuses.

In the end, Jasmine Keane had quietly covered it for him.

The stern face of Adrian Valdemar flashed in his mind, instantly extinguishing any thought of asking for help.

Alexander was out of the question.

To escape the arranged marriage with the Sinclair heiress, he'd vowed to live independently for a year.

Scrolling through his contacts, only Jasmine's name remained.

"Jasmine, can you transfer me two hundred?"

The crisp click of high heels echoed through the phone.

Jasmine stood outside a boutique, admiring a limited-edition handbag in the display window.

A cold smile curled her lips.

This fool was actually begging for pocket change?

"Julian, you should go home..."

Her voice trembled with fake concern while her fingers glided over a new lipstick shade.

Sweat beaded on Julian's forehead.

"Just send the money first, okay?"

He'd given her his entire paycheck last month, then spent his savings on a gift for the Patriarch today.

The line went dead.

Redialing only produced a busy signal.

Julian froze as his phone screen darkened.

The driver sighed.

"Young man, should I call the police for you?"

Julian's head snapped up, meeting the driver's pitying stare.

Here he sat in a tailored suit—the biggest joke of all.
###Chapter 451

The taxi driver drummed his fingers impatiently on the steering wheel, brows furrowed.

"Pay up fast. Don't waste my time for the next fare."

Beads of sweat dotted Julian Valdemar's forehead as his fingers flew across his phone screen.

His contacts list stopped at "Adrian Valdemar." He closed his eyes briefly.

The call connected faster than expected.

"Well, well. The second young master actually calling me first?" Adrian's teasing voice crackled through the receiver.

Julian's Adam's apple bobbed. His voice dropped to a near whisper. "Lend me two hundred."

Dead silence on the other end.

"Damn it! Wait there!"

Adrian stood on the banquet hall balcony, double-checking his hearing.

Julian Valdemar—the man who never carried cash—asking to borrow two hundred dollars?

His finger hovered over the transfer screen before deleting four zeros from the intended amount.

The payment notification chime sounded like salvation to Julian.

He practically fled the taxi.

The cold wind cooled his burning cheeks.

Dim hallway lights flickered in the apartment building.

Julian paused at the door, taking a deep breath before retrieving his keys.

Inside the modest two-bedroom flat, Jasmine Keane was in the midst of a rampage.

A glass shattered against the wall, shards scattering everywhere.

At the sound of turning keys, she quickly wiped her face and curled into the sofa corner.

Julian froze in the doorway.

Amidst the wreckage, Jasmine lifted tear-filled eyes.

"You...you came back?" Her voice trembled.

In three long strides, Julian gathered her into his arms.

"How could I ever leave you?"

Jasmine clutched his collar, nails nearly piercing her own palms.

"I thought you'd abandoned me..."

"Never." Julian's voice held steel.

Unseen by him, a fleeting smirk ghosted across the woman's lips.
###Chapter 452

Julian Valdemar held Jasmine Keane tightly in his arms, his fingers gently brushing the faint redness at the corners of her eyes.

A silent vow formed in his heart.

Just one more year. Once the arranged marriage with the Sinclair family was dissolved, he would give the girl in his arms the recognition she deserved.

The mess in the room couldn't dampen the warmth of this moment.

Julian had endured too much today.

He carefully laid her down on the bed.

The blue glow of the screen illuminated his weary face.

This illustration gig was hard-won. He needed to finish it quickly to secure a permanent position.

Next door.

The moment the door clicked shut, Jasmine's eyes flew open.

She turned over irritably, burying her face in the pillow.

In the gardens of Valdemar Manor.

Adrian Valdemar felt a suffocating tightness in his chest after transferring money to Julian.

He pulled out a cigarette and crouched in the shadows of the flowerbed.

Wreathed in smoke, his sharp features looked even more severe.

A sudden argument reached his ears.

"What were you thinking? Letting him bring another woman here?"

The shrill voice of a middle-aged woman pierced the air.

Adrian realized he'd unintentionally become an eavesdropper.

Tiffany Sinclair.

"The marriage alliance must proceed!" The woman's tone brooked no argument. "With so many Valdemar assets at stake, you must produce an heir!"

"But—"

"No buts!"

The click of high heels faded into the distance.

Under the moonlight, Tiffany stood alone in the garden, her shoulders trembling slightly.

Almost against his will, Adrian stepped forward.

"Miss Sinclair."

Tiffany jerked her head up, her face deathly pale.

"You... heard everything?"

Adrian's chest tightened painfully at the sight of her red-rimmed eyes.

This suffocating feeling was a hundred times worse than when Julian had come to him for money.
###Chapter 453 An Unexpected Proposal

Tiffany Sinclair's fingers twisted the hem of her dress unconsciously. The tips of her ears flushed pink.

"Actually..."

The tension in Tiffany's shoulders eased slightly.

Tiffany found it hard to breathe.

"Give me some time..."
###Chapter 454 

Tiffany Sinclair's fingers unconsciously twisted the hem of her skirt.

She had known since childhood that she was destined to marry Julian Valdemar, the second son of the Valdemar family.

Three months ago, she'd even taken a knife for Julian.

That night.

###Chapter 457

###Chapter 458

The once-glorious entertainment giant was reduced to an empty shell.

After Alexander Valdemar took over Valdemar Holdings, he immediately severed all ties with Lowell Group.

Lowell Group's stock prices plummeted.

Old friends who had distanced themselves suddenly became warm and chatty.

###Chapter 460

###Chapter 461

The woman in surveillance footage, though heavily bundled, revealed caramel-colored curls.

These details proved she wasn't Sophia.

William Lowell remained obstinate.

"Surveillance distorts images. Weight gain is normal during pregnancy. As for the hair, she might've dyed it as disguise."

Brows furrowed at his claim, but no one objected.

The possibility existed.

When the pair headed straight for the CEO's private elevator, William froze.

Others remained focused on the screens, missing his sudden pallor.

Sophia had never possessed elevator clearance.

Even during her internship at Lowell Group since college, William had denied her privileges.

She'd always used the staff elevator with other employees.

The two elevators stood at opposite ends of the lobby.

Footage showed them ascending directly to the 32nd floor executive suite.

Without pause, they proceeded to Dr. Preston Quincy's rooftop lab.

The black-clad woman moved with unsettling familiarity.

She swiped an access card through the first security checkpoint.

The coded door yielded to her touch.

Finally, the biometric scanner.

She pressed a synthetic fingertip against the sensor. The light turned green.

Three-tiered security collapsed like dominoes.

Such intimate knowledge of the lab raised fresh suspicions.

Who else but Sophia could navigate the facility this flawlessly?

Dr. Quincy spoke abruptly. "Pull last night's access logs. Verify the fingerprints."

Technicians worked swiftly.

When data flashed across screens, collective gasps erupted.

Records showed the 11:36 PM lab entry fingerprint belonged to William Lowell, current CEO of Lowell Group.

Dozens of accusatory stares pinned the man at the room's center.

"Mr. Lowell, where were you at this time last night?"

Dr. Quincy's question landed like a thunderclap.

William's temple vein bulged. "Dr. Quincy, are you implying something?"
###Chapter 467

William Lowell shook his head slowly.
"I'm not accusing you. I just need to confirm who had access to your fingerprints recently."

Sophia Laurent's pupils constricted sharply.

The realization hit him like a thunderbolt.
Someone had stolen his fingerprints to infiltrate the research facility.
The access card used was his spare—the one kept in his desk drawer.

Every detail sent chills down his spine.

His assistant interjected suddenly.
"Mr. Lowell, didn't you give your sister a tour of the facility last month?"

Emily Lowell's visit had left an impression on every researcher present.

"The woman on surveillance footage also had caramel-colored hair and a similar—"

"Enough!" William snapped.

The assistant recoiled under his glacial stare.

Richard Lowell noticed the tension immediately.
"Who did you bring into the facility?"

William's legs turned to jelly.
Cold sweat beaded on his forehead.

He should have known.
That woman's mannerisms—they matched Emily perfectly.
And the only person who'd been near him frequently was Emily.

Sophia would never have had the opportunity to obtain his fingerprints.

This revelation froze the blood in his veins.

He had pointed fingers at Sophia with such conviction.
Now the evidence pointed elsewhere.

The conference room plunged into silence.

Dr. Preston Quincy opened his mouth to speak, but William cut in first.
"Father, please wait in my office. I'll handle this."

Richard studied his son for a long moment before turning away.

"My apologies for my earlier rudeness."

"No matter." The scientist adjusted his glasses calmly.
"Data recovery takes time."

"Our research facility has no contractual ties with Lowell Enterprises."

He pushed his glasses up the bridge of his nose.
"We're relocating. You may bill us for any outstanding facility fees."

"Absolutely not!" William slammed his palms on the table as he shot to his feet.
###Chapter 468

William Lowell had intended to ask Dr. Preston Quincy to reorganize the research data.

Even if they missed the first opportunity, they could still secure a share of the profits.

"Dr. Quincy, please reconsider. Lowell Entertainment will ensure you're generously compensated."

"Brother, what's going on?"

Though the brothers had kept a low profile recently, news of Lowell Entertainment's press conference had reached them.

When the event failed to start on time, they called their father.

Richard gave vague answers, only saying there was an issue and urging them to come immediately.

William looked at his brothers' confused expressions and let out a heavy sigh, his energy completely drained.

The mere thought of the possibility made it hard to breathe.

"Dr. Quincy's research... was stolen."

Nathan shot to his feet. "How is that possible? Dr. Quincy has lived in seclusion for years, keeping to himself. How could his work suddenly be stolen?"

Daniel's face darkened as a thought flashed through his mind.

He remained silent, his gaze fixed on William.

William took a deep breath, struggling to find the right words.

He couldn't bring himself to say it—the thief was Emily Lowell, the girl they had doted on since childhood.

If Sophia had done it, he might have accepted it.

But it was their beloved adopted daughter.

William's silence led Richard to the wrong conclusion.

"It must be that wretched Sophia!" Richard slammed his fist on the table. "She deliberately humiliated Lowell Entertainment in front of everyone!"

Victoria quietly wiped away tears but didn't argue.

He wanted to explain it wasn't Sophia.

But before he could finish, Nathan interrupted. "Father, are you sure?"

He hadn't been completely idle during this time. He'd secretly investigated Sophia and Emily's past.

The results shocked him.

Their entire family had been deceived.

Sophia had never harmed anyone, while Emily had been living a double life.

"How could it be false?" Richard gritted his teeth, his eyes burning with hatred.
###Chapter 469

"Who else but Sophia Laurent would be so desperate to ruin us?"

Her sudden request to visit the top floor had been premeditated.

His obedient adopted daughter wouldn't betray him.

"My Lord, I truly don't know!"

Black Demon wiped his tears, voice trembling. He curled up in the corner like a frightened child.

Chen Zongheng arched an eyebrow. "How long have you been here?"

Chen's pupils constricted. He'd assumed mere days had passed, not a decade!

The results were more absurd—Black Demon claimed another decade had passed, while Chen experienced only an instant.

"My Lord, please stop toying with me!" Black Demon collapsed to his knees. "Even if I was unreliable before, this torment is too much!"

His gaze fell upon the demon sword in his hand, and realization dawned. Each space here was an independent prison cell—with Black Demon serving as the key.

The demon recoiled. "My Lord, your smile terrifies me..."

###Chapter 480

And alternative methods to recruit the doctor were impossible.
###Chapter 481 Marriage Is Just a Transaction

Ryan Cunningham Jr. tapped his wine glass with slender fingers, his gaze fixed on his brother's carefree expression.

"Are you really going to marry Emily Lowell?"

Ryan swirled his glass, the amber liquid tracing an elegant arc.

"Just for fun."

A smirk played on his lips, his eyes aloof.

"Women are nothing but distractions."

That Emily Lowell was unbearable.

###Chapter 482

Quentin Shaw's announcement sent waves through the conference hall.

#DrQuincyMedicalRobot trended at the top of search rankings.

###Chapter 483

Years ago, he was destitute and couldn't even afford the rent for his research lab. It was Sophia Laurent who extended a helping hand, giving him a chance at rebirth.

Sophia immediately instructed him to transfer the core data.

What Emily stole was nothing but carefully fabricated false information.

###Chapter 484

As for Lowell Entertainment? Not her concern.

###Chapter 495
