Rather than frustration, exhilaration surged through him.

"Heavenly Dao Tome, assist me!"

Golden light erupted as the sacred text materialized above the stele.

Under its celestial pressure, the artifact's resistance waned.

This unclaimed relic would only answer to masters of the Grand Yin-Yang Art.

Liu Wuxie sought not ownership, but communion.

As energy continued flowing, a subtle resonance formed—not the bond of a blood-bound artifact, but a covenant with the cosmos.

Night deepened.

Eerie luminescent specks drifted above the Shadowwoods like shattered constellations.

Bestial howls echoed through the trees, raising hairs on necks.

Bai Ling tensed. Never before had she faced such danger alone.

A rustling came from the forest's edge.

Leaping onto a branch, she glimpsed hundreds of demonkin shuffling forward under faint light.

"Why would demons come here?"

Alarm bells rang in her mind.

Human cultivators soon appeared from other directions.

Transforming into her nine-tailed fox form, Bai Ling melted into the canopy.

"Ever heard of the Shadowwoods?" someone whispered below.

"A forbidden zone of the mortal realm," answered an immortal lord.

"With demons massing here, something's amiss."

"The Oracle Guild prophesied a supreme treasure's emergence."

"The Oracle Guild? Weren't they extinct?"

"Now they serve the Celestial Sovereign Alliance..."

The voices faded.

Bai Ling dropped down, brow furrowed.

If true, finding her mother's celestial soul would become far harder.

Dawn approached.

Within the cauldron, Liu Wuxie's eyes snapped open.

"Rise!"

The Yin-Yang Stele obeyed, its terrifying aura shaking the divine vessel.

"Such devastating power."

Liu Wuxie marveled. This artifact could suppress realms and slaughter enemies alike.

"With this, even immortal kings could fall."

At his thought, the stele settled beside the Heavenly God Stele in his Primordial World.

Nourished by primordial energies, their connection strengthened.

"Visitors last night?"

Emerging, Liu Wuxie noticed countless footprints.

Bai Ling recounted her observations.

"The Oracle Guild..." Liu Wuxie's pupils contracted. "The Celestial Sovereign Alliance too?"

This spelled trouble.

"Shall we proceed?" Bai Ling asked.

Unconsciously, she'd grown reliant on Liu Wuxie.

"Forward!"

His decision was instant.

Following earlier tracks, they ventured deeper.

Daylight revealed the Shadowwoods' gnarled trees and tangled vines.

A croaking sound came from the left.

A pitch-black frog perched on a vine.

"Dark Abyss Toad!" Liu Wuxie's expression darkened. "Trouble has arrived."
###Chapter 496

The Lowell family living room was eerily silent.

Victoria Lowell watched her eldest son slumping on the sofa, tears streaming down her face.

"Maybe... we should go to Sophia?"

Her words dropped like a stone into still water.

William and Nathan looked up simultaneously, a flicker of hope in their eyes.

But it vanished just as quickly.

William massaged his temples. "Mom, Sophia won't interfere with these matters."

Nathan tugged at his tie irritably. "Our priority is solving the immediate crisis."

At Lowell Group headquarters, the PR manager rushed in, sweating profusely.

"Mr. Lowell, our official account's comments section is exploding!"

The computer screen flooded with accusatory questions.

"Is Dr. Quincy really sick?"
"Did Sophia Laurent sabotage this?"
"What exactly did Emily steal?"

Nathan slammed his fist on the desk. "Don't these internet trolls have anything better to do?"

William rose slowly, his gaze icy.

"If they want the truth, let's give it to them."

Thirty minutes later, Lowell Group's official account posted:

"Investigation confirms Emily Lowell stole Dr. Quincy's research and delivered it to Cunningham Group."

The post detonated across social media.

Within minutes, the top three trending topics were:
"Emily Lowell Theft Scandal"
"Cunningham Group Corporate Espionage"
"Emily Lowell & Ryan Cunningham"

Comments poured in like a tidal wave.

"OMG! Has Emily lost her mind?"
"The Lowells treated her so well, and this is how she repays them?"
"Cunningham Group is finished!"

At Cunningham Group headquarters, Ryan Cunningham stared at his screen, face dark with rage.

"Those Lowell idiots!"

He hurled his coffee cup against the wall.

They could have shared the research profits. Now everything was ruined.

His secretary hovered nervously by the door. "Mr. Cunningham, our stock is plummeting..."

Ryan's eyes turned venomous. "Get William Lowell on the phone."

Meanwhile, the three Lowell brothers stood before the floor-to-ceiling windows, gazing at the city lights.

Daniel asked quietly, "William, what's our next move?"

A cold smile curled William's lips. "Let's watch the Cunninghams burn."
###Chapter 497 

Sunlight streamed through the floor-to-ceiling windows, but Ryan Cunningham's expression remained stormy.

He slammed the documents onto the desk, papers scattering everywhere.

"Have the Lowells lost their minds?"

Ryan Jr. sat behind the expansive desk, fingertips tapping rhythmically against the polished surface.

"They didn't just report Emily to the police. They're cutting all ties with us."

Ryan paced angrily, leather shoes clicking sharply against the marble floor.

"I thought they adored that adopted daughter. How could they throw her to the wolves?"

Ryan Jr.'s gaze drifted toward the city skyline.

"Sophia's the problem."

Ryan halted mid-step, brow furrowing.

"Explain."

"Dr. Quincy has defected to Sophia's side." Ryan Jr.'s voice turned icy. "The Lowells got played."

Understanding dawned on Ryan's face, twisting his features further.

"They'll come after us with everything they've got."

Ryan Jr. turned, eyes sharp as daggers.

"Deny everything."

He picked up a fountain pen, spinning it deftly between his fingers.

"Our research belongs to Cunningham Laboratories. The Lowells have no claim."

Ryan nodded slowly.

"I'll arrange for the tech team's relocation immediately."

Pulling out his phone, he dialed a number with quick precision.

"We'll need to secure Emily's release too."

Ryan Jr. gave a slight nod, expression inscrutable.

"She must remain our ally."

Meanwhile, Cunningham Group's press release trended across social media.

The concise statement denied all allegations with surgical precision.

Online chatter gradually subsided.

But inside Lowell Entertainment's boardroom, a furious fist slammed against the conference table.

"Outrageous!"

Richard Lowell's face flushed crimson as he hurled the tablet onto the table.

As tensions simmered between the two families, Sophia's phone buzzed unexpectedly.

"I'm downstairs."

Alexander Valdemar's rich baritone resonated through the receiver.

Sophia's lips curved upward involuntarily.

"Be right there."

In Pearl Group's lobby, Alexander sat perfectly composed on a leather sofa.

His elegant fingers turned the pages of a financial magazine, the tailored black suit accentuating his broad shoulders.

The crisp white shirt remained buttoned to the top, exuding restrained elegance.

"Oh my god, is that Mr. Valdemar?"

"Even more handsome than in magazines!"

Receptionists whispered behind their hands, cheeks pinkening.

Alexander ignored the attention, his focus fixed on the elevator doors.

Waiting for his wife.
###Chapter 498

Sophia Laurent stepped out of the elevator and immediately sensed the unusual tension in the corporate lobby.

Alexander Valdemar sat alone on the leather sofa in the lounge area, a three-meter radius around him completely empty.

Several female employees pretended to be busy near the water cooler, but their eyes kept darting toward him.

"Ms. Laurent!" Her assistant hurried over, whispering. "Mr. Valdemar has been waiting for you for half an hour."

Sophia arched an eyebrow and looked over.

The setting sun through the floor-to-ceiling windows cast a golden halo around the man. He wore an impeccably tailored black suit, his long fingers flipping through a financial magazine.

As if sensing her gaze, Alexander suddenly looked up.

Their eyes met. He closed the magazine and stood.

"Finished work?"

His deep voice made nearby employees gasp audibly.

Sophia heard a chorus of whispered reactions behind her.

"Oh my god, Mr. Valdemar's voice is so mesmerizing..."

"Is that level of attractiveness even real?"

"Did Ms. Laurent save the galaxy in her past life?"

Shaking her head in amusement, Sophia walked toward him.

Alexander naturally took her briefcase. "How are you feeling today?"

Ever since learning about her pregnancy, he'd been punctually waiting for her after work each day.

"I'm fine." She smiled. "You don't need to pick me up every day."

He didn't respond, instead carefully studying her complexion.

Lately he'd been poring over pregnancy guides and consulting obstetric specialists.

"The Patriarch wants us for dinner at the manor," he changed the subject. "Those old men from last night's birthday banquet called again today asking about you."

Sophia chuckled.

The Patriarch had thrown that lavish celebration specifically to show off his granddaughter-in-law to his friends.

They walked side by side toward the parking garage, their shadows stretching long in the sunset.

Alexander spoke suddenly. "The Patriarch knows about Emily Lowell."

Sophia's steps faltered slightly.

"He's displeased," Alexander said calmly. "Should I handle the Lowell family?"

"No." Sophia shook her head. "I'll deal with them myself."

She knew the Lowells too well—greedy, foolish sharks who smelled blood in the water.

Alexander studied her resolute profile, admiration flashing in his eyes.

This was what he admired about Sophia.

She never relied on others, always maintaining her clarity.

"Alright." He opened the car door. "Let me know if you need anything."

As the car pulled away from the office building, Sophia gazed at the passing scenery before remembering something.

"About the Matriarch yesterday—"

"Don't worry about her." Alexander cut in firmly. "I'm in charge of the Valdemar family now."

His tone brooked no argument.

Sophia's lips curved slightly.

This man always knew exactly when and how to give her the support she needed.
###Chapter 499

Are the Lowells all fools?

Any idiot would choose their biological daughter over an adopted one.

Yet the Lowells are clearly blind.

Patriarch Valdemar began preparing the banquet at dawn.

He researched dietary restrictions for pregnant women and arranged for the freshest ingredients to be airlifted in.

Besides Alexander and Sophia, he also invited Adrian, Julian, and his grandniece Vanessa.

Vanessa was the only girl in the Valdemar third generation, doted on since childhood.

She'd just returned from a global tour when she called the old man, still dusty from travel.

"Happy birthday, Grandfather!"

Her voice was bright and melodious.

"I saw the canals in Venice, watched sunsets in Santorini, and brought you handmade glassware..."

The Patriarch couldn't stop smiling.

"When are you coming home, Vanessa? I want to introduce someone to you."

Vanessa was the granddaughter of Patriarch Valdemar's younger brother.

Her parents lived overseas, so she'd grown up in the Valdemar household.

"Who is it? Why so mysterious?"

Her tone turned playful.

"Your cousin Alexander got married. You'll meet his wife Sophia today."

"No way!"

Vanessa's voice rose in surprise. "I actually have a sister-in-law now?"

"Would I lie about that?"

The old man sounded proud. "She's quite remarkable—beautiful and capable..."

"Well, I'll have to see for myself."

Vanessa hung up with a laugh and immediately searched online.

Discovering Sophia owned Pearl Entertainment and had connections with Gavin Croix, her eyes lit up.

A new sister-in-law...

She'd need an impressive welcome gift.

Vanessa arrived at the estate before the newlyweds.

Sophia heard silver-bell laughter the moment she stepped inside.

She paused in surprise.

The stern Patriarch rarely smiled, even with his own grandsons.

Who was this girl?
###Chapter 500

Sophia Laurent had just stepped across the threshold of Valdemar Manor when Patriarch Valdemar beckoned to her.

"Sophia, come here."

The elderly man wore a benevolent smile.

"This is Vanessa Valdemar, the youngest daughter of the Valdemar family."

"Vanessa, meet your sister-in-law Sophia Laurent."

Sophia gave a slight nod, her lips curving into a perfectly composed smile.

The living room held more than just Vanessa. Alexander Valdemar, Adrian Valdemar, and the disinherited Julian Valdemar were all present.

Adrian lounged lazily on the sofa, only lifting his eyelids briefly in greeting.

Julian appeared visibly disheveled, his shirt wrinkled and his gaze unfocused.

Alexander remained characteristically taciturn.

But Sophia could sense he seemed more at ease among family.

Vanessa clung affectionately to Patriarch Valdemar's arm.

"Hello, sister-in-law."

She tilted her head, eyes sparkling.

"Shouldn't you prepare a gift for your new little sister?"

Sophia blinked in surprise.

Then smiled gently.

"I came in a hurry today. May I give you something later?"

Vanessa immediately brightened.

"Really? Can I ask for anything I want?"

Adrian suddenly slammed his palm against the coffee table.

"Vanessa, have you lost your mind?"

Patriarch Valdemar frowned sharply. "Adrian!"

"Did you hear what she just said?"

Adrian mimicked Vanessa's tone with exaggerated disgust.

"Ugh—"

He made a gagging expression.

"Only you would indulge this nonsense."

Sophia instinctively moved closer to Alexander.

Patriarch Valdemar's beard quivered with anger.

"You insolent—"

Adrian shrugged indifferently.

"Perhaps you should ask who taught her such manners."

"She's your sister. Must you always provoke her?"

Adrian sneered and turned away.

The atmosphere turned icy.

Patriarch Valdemar gave Sophia an apologetic look.

"Don't mind him, Sophia."

She offered a gracious smile.

"I understand, Grandfather."

Vanessa suddenly stamped her foot.

Her eyes reddened as she bit her lip in distress.
